loans.name: Las Picaflores Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las PicaF.” esta representado por L. señora Maria Inés y conformado por 12 miembros muy unidos, alegres y responsables. L. señora Maria Inés tiene 4 hijo en edad escolar y se encuentran estudiando en un colegio fiscal cercano a su domicilio, L. señora María Inés se dedica a L. venta D. refrescos y jugos el cual es único sustento D. toda su familia, L. señora Maria Inés desea el crédito para poder instalar una pequeña tienda D. dulces e incrementar sus ingresos ya que su mayor anhelo  es poder sacar a sus hijos con una profesión para que puedan mejorar en su vida. L. mayoría D. los socios se dedican a L. venta D. verduras, huevos, frutas, cds, comida, abarrotes, entre los varones se dedican a L. cerrajería y transporte público D. pasajeros al transporte publico. Existe bastante competencia en su entorno por lo que cada socio se esmera en brindar una buena atención y ofrecer productos D. calidad para L. satisfacción D. sus clientes, es por esta razón que ya tienen clientes fieles que demandan sus servicios.  El crédito será destinado para el mejoramiento D. sus con L. compra D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a generar una mayor cantidad D. ventas y incrementar sus ingresos que son el sustento D. sus familias.  L. mayor expectativa D. los socios es poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad debida con un techo propio y una mejor educación. Todos los socios tiene experiencia en créditos solidarios gracias a créditos similares en otras instituciones pero se sienten muy felices D. trabajar con una institución será que le brinda un apoyo económico para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group "Las PicaF." is represented by Señora Maria Inés. The group has 12 members who are very united, cheerful and responsible. Maria Inés has 4 school-aged children who study in the public school close to her house. Maria Inés has a business selling soft drinks and juices that is the only source of support for her family. Maria Inés wants a loan to establish a small sweets store and increase her income, since her main wish is to be able to get her children into a profession so that they can improve their lives. The majority of the members sell vegetables, eggs, fruit, CDs, meals, and groceries. Among the men in the group there are individuals providing locksmith and public passenger transportation services. There is a lot of competition in their area, so each member must take care to proviD. good service and offer quality products to satisfy their customers, so that they will have loyal customers who demand their services. The loan will be used to improve their businesses with the purchase of merchandise, supplies, materials and tools that will help them generate better sales and increase the incomes they need to support their families. The greatest hope of the members is to be able to give their families a better quality of life: including owning their own home and giving their children a better education. All of the members have experience with solidarity group loans, thanks to similar loans they have taken with other institutions. They feel very happy to work with an institution that will proviD. economic support so that they can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco P. de 62 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil. Su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicio básicos. Su esposa le ayuda en la papelería ellos tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad.

Francisco trabajaba en el Banco Central del Ecuador pero por la frustrante idea de ser independiente y tener su propio negocio decidió renunciar a su trabajo y con la liquidación compro unas cuantas vitrinas, arreglo un local para tener su negocio y compro cosas para  papelería.

En la actualidad el esta contento con su negocio porque le ha dado estabilidad económica pero no los ingresos suficientes para poder arreglar mejor su casa. Con el préstamo quiere comprar bloques, cemento y piedra para poder construir mejor su casa y asegurar el futuro de el y de su esposa. 

En el futuro quiere mantenerse con el negocio y que pueda tener otras papelerías para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco P. is 62 years old and lives on the outskirts of town in Suburbio de Guayaquil. His house is of cement and has all the basic services. His wife helps him in the store they have. They have four grown children. Francisco worked in the Central Bank of Ecuador but due to the continuing idea of being independent and having his own business he decided to resign from his job and with the severance pay bought several display cases, set up a location for his business, and bought items for the store. Now he is pleased with his business because it has provided him with economic stability but not with sufficient income to be able to improve his house. With the loan he wants to buy blocks, cement, and stone to be able to improve his house and secure the future for himself and his wife. In the future he wants to maintain himself with the business and be able to have other stores for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blocks, cement, stone

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Maria tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles ya que no contaba con suficiente capital pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado salir adelante. Este negocio surge con la idea de buscar ingresos necesarios para su hogar. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, detergentes, gaseosas y jugos. Su deseo es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 43 years old, and she runs a grocery stores. Maria has three children in her care. She has been running this business for 7 years and it was very difficult at the beginning as she didn't have sufficient capital, but with the help of loans she has been able to make a success. She started the business in order to bring in necessary income for her household. She is requesting a loan for business capital in order to buy candy, natural soft drinks, bread, detergents, sodas, and juices. Her wish is to be bring up her children well.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Señor  Blas G., tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, ambos en edad escolar.
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad trabajaba como chofer en una distribuidora de productos embutidos, de apoco fue vendiendo en forma independiente, hasta que montó su propio negocio.
    Esta actividad ya lo realiza hace aproximadamente 2 años, ya no trabaja en forma dependiente, pero ese trabajo le ayudó a conseguir sus clientes actuales.
    El negocio tiene mucho éxito, porque ofrece los productos a un precio menor y con mayor calidad que sus competidores.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de más mercaderías (embutidos en gran cantidad como, fiambres, mortadelas, chorizos, panchos, y otros), para tener una mayor diversidad de productos.
 El deseo del Señor Blas es ampliar su local, para una mayor comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blas is 45 years old and has two children who are both of school age. To be able to start his current activity, he worked as a driver for a distributor of cured meats, and little by little began selling independently until he was able to set-up his own business. He has been doing this for about 2 years and no longer works for anyone else, but his previous work helped him to find his current clients. The business is very successful because he offers products at a lower price and higher quality than his competitors. The requested loan is for buying more merchandise (cured meats in large quantity such as cold cuts, bologna, chorizos, hot dogs, and others) so he can offer a greater variety of products. Blas' wish is to expand his premises so that he can offer greater comfort to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cured meats

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años, separada de su esposo desde hace 28 años, tiene 4 hijos, pero vive con el  menor de ellos, en su domicilio propio fabricado de material rústico. Desde 30 años se dedica a la agricultura,  pero paralelamente prepara comida, negocio que vende en la casa de su hijo mayor. Sin embargo a ella le preocupa mucho, el no poder contar con la ayuda de su familia cada vez que trabaja en su chacra, por lo que tiene que contratar operarios para agilizar su labor. Dentro de estas dos actividades, lo que más le gusta es la agricultura, por que sabe que podrá obtener una buena recompensa durante la cosecha y eso le permitirá cubrir los gastos del hogar y sobre todo colaborar económicamente con sus hijos, que buscan un futuro mejor para sus nietos. Más adelante desea cultivar frutas cítricas, plátanos y paltas como hasta hoy, ya que espera tenerlos fértiles para heredarles a sus hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y está contenta de trabajar con su grupo comunal, porque se siente respaldada por sus compañeros en cada decisión que toma. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 10 sacos de fertilizantes, 8 latas de herbicidas, asimismo comprará trampas para la mosca, para evitar que afecten los cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old. She has been separated from her husband for 28 years. She has four children, and she lives with her youngest child. She lives in her own house, which is made of humble materials. She has been farming for 30 years. She also prepares food, which is sold in her oldest child’s house. Nevertheless, she worries a lot about not being able to count on help from her family each time she works on her farm. She needs to hire workers to speed up her work. Of her two activities, she likes farming the best. This is because she will be able to get a good reward during the harvest, which allows her to cover the household expenses. Also, above all, she can collaborate economically with her children who are looking for a better future for her grandchildren. Later on she wants to plant citrus fruits, bananas, and avocados. She hopes to have them fertile so that she can leave them to her children. This is her third loan with MFP. She is happy working with her communal bank she feels the support of her colleagues in every decision she makes. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy ten sacks of fertilizer and eight cans of herbicides. She will also buy traps for flies so that they do not affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 sacks of fertilizers, 8 cans of herbicides, and fly traps

loans.name: Santa Elisa Group

texts.es:
Desde muy joven María ayudo a su Hermana en la confección de cortinas ambas trabajaban para otras personas  pero poco a poco ella fue juntando dinero hasta poder ahorrar y comprarse su propia maquina, ahora confecciona cortinas por su propia cuenta ahora lo hace en su propia casa donde habilito un taller, al principio le fue algo difícil ella misma tenia que ir a los mercados a ofrecer sus productos es así que se hizo de clientela empezó vendiendo por unidad solo algunas cortinas. Actualmente entrega pedidos por mayor a las tiendas, ferias  mercados etc. con sus ganancias ha podido construir su casa y ayudar en los estudios de su hija,  Ella es tesorera del grupo “SANTA ELISA”  con el dinero de su desembolso comprara telas para confeccionar  sus productos. Mas adelante piensa abrir una tienda donde pueda mostrar  al publico lo que confecciona y vender directamente,  ella sabe que pronto lograra su objetivo para eso es que trabaja  con mucho sacrificio.
* María esta en la foto con polo plomo es la tercera sentada
texts.en:
Since she was very young María helped her sister making curtains, both working for other people but little by little she saved up money until she was able to buy her own machine. Now she has her own business making curtains in her own house where she has fitted out a workshop. In the beginning it was somewhat difficult as she had to go to the markets herself to sell her products and in this way she got clients. She started selling curtains by the unit. Currently she delivers wholesale orders to shops, markets etc. With her profits she has been able to build her house and help her daughter in her studies. She is the treasurer of the “SANTA ELISA” group. With the money from her payment she will buy material for making her products. In the future she is thinking of opening a shop where she can show what she makes and sell directly to the public. She knows that soon she will achieve her goal, it is for this that she working and sacrificing a lot. * María is in the photo with the grey shirt, seated third

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for her business

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su hija, su yerno y sus nietos en el sector Simón Bolivar de la ciudad de Chiclayo, conocida como La Ciudad de la Amistad, es una zona altamente comercial, es capital de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de almuerzos en los exteriores del centro comercial Aguas Verdes, el cual se encuentra ubicado cerca al Mercado Modelo, en toda la zona se concentra bastante comercio formal e informal. Ella prepara almuerzos todos los dias y los lleva al lugar en donde los vende a los comerciantes de la zona, Miguelina es bastante conocida  y todo lo que lleva a diario lo vende completamente. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para sustentar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento familiar.

Miguelina desea ampliar su negocio para poder satisfacer la demanda diaria que acude a su puesto para proveerse de alimentos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de de insumos para seguir preparando mas platos de comida y así lograr su objetivo.

Miguelina es una mujer que gusta mucho de mantenerse activa y ganarse su propio sustento, su mayor anhelo es instalar un restaurante en un local mas grande y asi ampliar aun mas la cobertura de su atención. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Miguelina, age 60, lives with her daughter, her son-in-law, and her grandchildren in the Simón Bolivar sector of the city of Chiclayo. It is known as the City of Friendship, and it is a highly commercial area. It is the capital of the city of Lambayeque. For over five years she has been selling lunches outside of the Aguas Verdes (Green Waters) commercial center. It is located close to the Mercado Modelo (Model Market). There is a lot of formal and informal commerce concentrated in the entire area. She prepares lunches everyday and takes them to the place where she sells them to the merchants in the area. Miguelina is well know, and she sells everything that she takes to sell daily. She uses the income that she gets to pay for her personal expenses and to help support the family. Miguelina wants to expand her business in order to be able to meet the daily demand for food at her stand. That is why she is requesting, for the first time, a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternantiva. She plans on using it to buy supplies to keep preparing more food and achieve her objective. Miguelina is a woman who really likes to stay active and earn her own living. Her biggest desire is to set up a restaurant in a larger place and be able to wait on more people. The people who know her consider her to be very responsible and hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make food and expand her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, tiene 27 años, es soltera, es natural del Cusco y es Ingeniero Agrónomo. Su principal actividad económica es vender artesanía como por ejemplo carteras de material de lana, ella exporta sus productos a los países de Bolivia y Chile pronto va ha exportará a Brasil. Ya son 5 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que el negocio de venta de carteras ha disminuido pero se las ingenio para seguir vendiendo. Ella también se dedica a la confección de vestidos a pedido del cliente y los manda a la ciudad de Lima.  

Elizabeth es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo casacas. El anhelo de la socia es abrir una industria alimentaria en la ciudad de Quillabamba que esté encargada de la elaboración, transformación, preparación, conservación y envasado de los alimentos como por ejemplo el cacao y el café.
 
Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal y también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 27, is single. She is from Cusco, and she is an agricultural engineer. Her main economic activity is selling handicrafts. For example, she sells purses made from wool. She exports her products to Bolivia and Chile. She will soon export to Brasil. She has been in this business for five years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. With much sadness, she tells us that the business of selling purses has decreased, but she manages to keep selling them. She also makes clothes that are ordered from customers, and she sends them to the city of Lima. Elizabeth is a hard-working and enterprising young person who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead. She helps her family with her daily efforts. She needs the loan to buy merchandise like jackets. Her wish is to open a food industry in the city of Quillabamba, which would be in charge of making, transforming, preparing, conserving, and packaging food like cacao and coffee. Elizabeth belongs to the Los Diamantes Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa. The communal bank has been operating during ten cycles. She says that she is happy and satisfied with the loan services, the savings, the training, and for the time the bank has been in existence. She is also grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it in the agreed upon time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like jackets

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de refrescos, posteriormente con el duro trabajo que realizaba, fue así con el poco capital que ha salido adelante. Financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de faldas, camisas, pantalones y trajes. Su deseo es ampliar cada día su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca has been working with the Fundación for a long time and she has shown herself to be an excellent client. Eight years ago, she began to sell clothing. Previously, she sold beverages. Later, with her hard work, she has been able to get ahead with a little capital. The financing is to be used for working capital to purchase skirts, shirts, pants and suits. She wishes to enlarge her business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía tiene 41 años, es una madre ejemplar, casada con Jerson de 36 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos, y juntos viven en su casa propia, fabricado con material rústico a base de hojas de árbol y madera. A ella se le considera, como una mujer “Mil oficios”, pues para sacar adelante a su familia no descansa, es así que lleva 20 años dedicada a la agricultura, asimismo se dedica a la elaboración de comida, a la crianza y comercialización de cuy, cerdo, así como la venta de productos de belleza, que le resultan muy beneficioso debido a que cuenta con muchos conocidos que son sus clientes favoritos. Lo que más le gusta de las actividades que realiza, es cosechar las deliciosas mandarinas que siembra, puesto que son comercializados tanto en el mercado de su zona como en la ciudad, recibiendo un poco más de ganancias. Por otro lado su esposo, trabaja en el programa “agua para todos”, por lo que él asume los gastos del hogar. Actualmente compró un terreno de 3 hectáreas de extensión y planea sembrar productos oriundos de la zona, asimismo desea instalar un puesto de comida en un espacio disponible de su vivienda.  Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, además sus compañeras de su grupo comunal están contentas con ella, por ser solidaria y honesta. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 20 sacos de abono, mil plantas de plátanos y sembrarlos en el terreno que acaba de comprar, además desea contratar operarios para que le ayuden en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 41 years old, is an exemplary mother, and is married to 36 year old Jerson, with whom she has four children. They live together in their own house, which is made of rustic materials based on tree leaves and wood. She is considered a woman of "a thousand trades" because, in order to provide for her family, she never rests. For this reason, she has been working in agriculture for 20 years and also prepares food, breeds and sells guinea pigs and pigs, and sells beauty products, all of which are very beneficial to her because she has many acquaintances who are among her favorite customers. Her favorite of the tasks she undertakes is harvesting the delicious mandarins that she grows, as they are sold both in her local market and in the city, and bring in a little extra profit. On the other hand, her husband works for the "Water For All" program, so he is responsible for the household expenses. She just bought a 3 hectare plot of land and plans to sow products of local origin, and she also wants to install a food stall in an available space in their home. This is her sixth loan from MFP, and her companions in the loan group are very happy with her as she is supportive and honest. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy 20 sacks of fertilizer and a thousand banana seedlings and will plan them on the land that she just bought. She also wants to hire some workers to help her with this task.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of fertilizer, a thousand banana plants, and hire workers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Carmen es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Carmen junto a su familia son artesanos y confeccionan tejidos en telar como frazadas, pasadizos. Actividad que realiza todos los días.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos y lana.
Los sueños de Carmen son construir su casa de material noble y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Alianza communal bank. She is married and 45 years old. Carmen and her family are artesans and they weave on looms, making blankets and rugs. She does this every day. Carmen needs a loan of 1,500 soles. this money will be invested in the purchase of yarn and wool. Carmen's dream is to build a house of concrete and offer her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn and wool

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mónica B. A. vive en el barrio Santa Isabel en el departamento de Cundinamarca, donde está ubicada la capital de Colombia. Bogotá; ella tiene una cigarrería, allí vende ranchos, víveres, bebidas,  para la cual requiere un financiamiento por valor de $ 2.000.000 que invertirá en la compra de enlatados, bebidas, embutidos, dulces,  salsamentaría en general y comestibles como arroz, aceite y café.

Su  idea de negocio surgió conjuntamente con su  hermano, ya que en su familia existe la tradición de ser independientes y fue así como montaron su cigarrería “Rancho Villa” aprovechando que Puente Aranda, localidad donde está ubicado el barrio Santa Isabel y donde ahora funciona su negocio, está rodeado de canchas deportivas, colegios, microempresas y   muchas familias residentes, lo cual hizo notorio un amplio mercado potencial para darle curso a su sueño. Ahora su principal desafío es acreditarlo y mejorar  su modo de vida y  condiciones económicas familiares día a día;  ahora su reto es fortalecer las relaciones entre sus vecindad, aprovechando la cigarrería como sitio donde hay mucha afluencia de vecinos, que con el tiempo pueden ser buenos amigos.
texts.en:
Mónica B. A. lives in the Santa Isabel neighborhood of Bogota, the capital of Colombia located in the department of Cundinamarca. She owns a small shop where she sells food, drinks, and general provisions. She needs a loan of $ 2.000.00, which she will invest in the purchase of canned goods, drinks, cold meats, sweets, general deli goods, and non-perishables like rice, oil, and coffee. Mónica came up with the idea for her business with her brother since her family has an established tradition of being independent. They opened their shop "Rancho Villa" in Puente Aranda, taking advantage of the fact that this Santa Isabel locale where there business is based, is surrounded by sports fields, schools, small businesses, and many family homes. The location gave them obvious market potential to achieve their dream. Currently, Mónica's biggest challenges are financing the business and improving her quality of life and the day-to-day economic conditions of her family. Since the shop is located in a place with a large number of neighbors, her goal is to strengthen her relationships with her neighbors who with time can become good friends.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for store

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Cirila es casada, tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, Cirila tiene un puesto en el mercado D. las Nazarenas en donD. venD. jugos D. frutas, además junto a su esposo tienen una tienda D. venta D. lubricantes y repuestos.
Cirila necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lubricantes.
Los sueños D. Cirila son mejorar sus negocios y seguir implementando el taller D. su esposo.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Alianza communal bank. She is 54, married, and has five children. Cirila has a stand in the Nazarenas market where she sells fruit juices. Besides that she and her husband have a store where they sell motor oil and spare parts. Cirila needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy oil. Her dream is to improve her businesses and continue building up her husband’s shop.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motor oil

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 51 años y 4 hijos, Felicitas compra cochinilla y tara que vende a intermediarios, Felicitas además vende abarrotes, verduras en la selva ayacuchana a donde viaja semanalmente, también vende ropa a pedido.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
Los sueños de Felicitas son educar a sus hijos y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Alianza village bank. Felicitas is 51 years old. She is married and has four children. She buys cochineal, the insect from which carmine is made, and tara, a Peruvian shrub, to sell them again. She also travels to the jungle in Ayacucho every week to sell groceries and produce, and takes special orders for clothes. Felicitas needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy a variety of clothing. She dreams of being able to send her children to school and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Felicitas Hermelinda

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas; pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR JUSTO JUEZ”, Nuestra socia es vive en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad ella es casada, tiene 5 hijos, tres de ellos son independientes y ella está a cargo de sus dos hijos,  Nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia es artesana y tienen dos tiendas de artesanías uno en la plaza san francisco, y otra en el centro artesanal, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería para sus tiendas e implementarlas.
 
Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Felicitas belongs to the communal bank SEÑOR JUSTO JUEZ. Our member lives in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, in the Cusco department. Our member is 43, married, and has 5 children. Three of the children are independent and she takes care of her other two. She alternates her household activities with her retail business. Felicitas is an artisan and she has two handicraft shops: one in the San Francisco Plaza and the other in the Handicrafts Center. Our member is asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise for her stores and to fix them up. Our member is thankful for and appreciates the loan given her this way and promises to complete the payments of the entire debt on the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our memeber is asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise for her stores and to fix them up

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia Soledad; pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR JUSTO JUEZ”, Nuestra socia es vive en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 57 años de edad ella es casada, tiene 3 hijos, 30, 27, 21 años de edad  Nuestra socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes pero desde hace unos meses atrás decidió dedicarse paralelamente a esto a vender zapatos por catálogo, la socia tiene unas 3 revistas que las ofrece a todas las entidades y deja los zapatos para que se le pague en dos partes, la primera que es la mitad del costo se paga al entregar los zapatos que pidieron y la segunda exactamente al mes siguiente, vende carteras y todo tipo de zapatos y zapatillas, A nuestra socia le gustaría poner en un futuro cercano su propia tienda de zapatos, ella es una persona muy carismática y muy optimista, nos comenta que ella hace el pago total del producto por anticipado, pero a fin de que sus clientes le compren ella les deja a dos partidas de pago. Nuestra socia desea el préstamo para pagar el pedido que está haciendo a Lima.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Señor Justo Juez village bank. She lives in the district of Huanchac, in the department of Cusco. Soledad is 57 years old. She is married and has 3 children, 30, 27, and 21 years old. She has a grocery store but a few months ago decided to also sell shoes by catalog. She offers three catalogs and allows people to pay her in two payments. She collects the first half when she delivers the shoes and the second the following month. She sells handbags and all kinds of shoes and sneakers. In the future, she would like to set up her own shoe store. She is a very charismatic, optimistic person. She tells us that she pays for all her merchandise in advance, but that to encourage her clients to purchase from her, she allows them to make two payments instead of one. She would like to have this loan to pay for the orders she making from Lima. Soledad is very grateful for the loan and is committed to paying off her debt in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for merchandise orders

loans.name: Darling Aracely

texts.es: Darling Aracely tiene la edad de 27 años, su estado civil es soltera. Darling tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. a ella siempre le ha gustado ser una mujer muy independiente, pues le han sido de mucha ayuda para salir adelante . Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima pues actualmente tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes. Por lo que desea establecer su negocio en un lugar amplio y cómodo.
texts.en:
Darling Aracely is 27 years old. She is a single mother with one son. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise. She has made a living in this business for more than 9 years. Darling has always enjoyed being a very independent woman, since it has been very helpful for getting ahead. She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase merchandise for her business, as she currently has many orders from her customers. Darling wants to set up her business in a place that is large and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Vicenta es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Vicenta tiene una imprenta en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, brinda diversos servicios, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papeles.
El sueño de Vicenta son seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Alianza (Alliance) Communal Bank. She is married, 44 years old, and has 3 children. Vicenta operates a printing shop in a rental space located in the city center. She offers diverse services, and does so every day. Vicenta needs a loan of 1,000 sols, which will be invested in purchasing various printing papers. Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRINTING PAPER FOR HER PRINT SHOP

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia Georgina; pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR JUSTO JUEZ”, Nuestra socia es vive en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad ella es divorciada no tiene hijos y La socia se dedica a las ventas, ella es jefa promotora de la línea Nestlé en Cusco, nos comenta que ella visita las diferentes tiendas y súper mercados llevando su producto, los exhibe y los promocionan, La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the “Señor Justo Juez” (Our Lord, the Just Judge) Communal Bank. She lives in the Huanchac district of Cusco province, in Cusco department. Georgina is 31 years old and divorced with no children. She is in sales; she is the chief promoter of the Nestlé line in Cusco. She reports that she visits the different stores and supermarkets carrying Nestlé products, and displays and promotes them. Georgina is requesting the loan for her personal use. She appreciates and values the loan offered by this means and promises to fully repay the debt in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR HER PERSONAL USE

loans.name: Rosa Magali

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Boca Chica, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, ella cría ovejas y chivos en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando están lo suficientemente desarrollados los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona para comprar animales y revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para apoyar al sostenimiento de la economía familiar, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como agricultor no son suficientes para mantenerlos.

Rosa desea mejorar la calidad de los animales que posee para que estos tengan mejor acogida y pueda obtener mas ganancias, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en alimento para lograr su objetivo.

Rosa es una mujer bastante comprometida con el progreso de su familia, ella se esfuerza todos los dias para salir adelante y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, sus vecinos y amigos la consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 28 year old mother of a family who lives alongside her husband and her children in the hamlet of Boca Chica, a rural area of the Olmos district belonging to the Lambayeque province which is found two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For six years, she has been dedicated to the raising and selling of young animals. She raises sheep and goats behind her house and when they are developed enough she sells them to businesses that visit the area to buy animals and resell them in the city of Chiclayo. The income that she receives from this activity is used to support her family economically since her husband's income as a farmer is not enough to support them. Rosa wishes to improve the quality of the animals that she owns so that they become more popular and can generate more earnings. For this reason she has seen the necessity to request for the first time a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she is thinking of investing in feed to achieve her goal. Rosa is a woman who is committed to the advancement of her family. She works every day to get ahead and provide them a better quality of life. Her neighbors and friends consider her to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed to maintain her sheep and goats.

loans.name: Mujeres Sembradoras Group

texts.es: Doña Candelaria Pú I. cuenta con 3 hijos, 2 nenas y un hombre, el mayor tiene una edad de 8 años y el menor de ellos cuenta con 1 año, ella vive a unos 25 kilometros de la ciudad de Momostenango, actualmente se dedica al servicio de Tienda de consumo diario y un molino de nixtamal electrico, con las necesidades que surgen de darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, necesita un prestamo para el aumento de capital de la Tienda con la que cuenta, para que de esa manera aumenta sus productos de ventas y con el tiempo obtener mejores ingresos economicos, para ello se organizaron con un grupo de personas de la comunidad la cual cuentan con principios morales, y acudieron a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un prestamo por cada uno de ellos, el resto del grupo se dedica a la Crianza de animales domesticos, y otros a la Agricultura como, la siembra de Tomate, Alberja China, Coliflor, Café entre otros.
texts.en:
Candelaria Pú I. has three children, two girls and a boy. The eldest is eight and the youngest is one. She lives 25 kilometers from the city of Momostenango. Currently, she is dedicated to working in her grocery store and an electric corn mill. With the need arising to provide better living conditions to her family, she needs a loan to increase the capital of the shop since she can then increase the products she can sell and, with time, obtain better income. For this, she organized with a group of people in the community who all have moral principles and they turned to the ASDIR association to solicit a loan for each one of them. The rest of the group is dedicated to raising domestic animals and others to farming such as sowing tomatoes, Chinese snow peas, cauliflower, coffee, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: comprar ropa y pescado para la venta.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: A sus 40 años, Teodora vive junto a su esposo Virgilio y sus cuatro hijos, en su domicilio propio, construido a base de carrizo y hojas de árbol. Ella se caracteriza por ser abnegada madre y muy hogareña. El trabajo de agricultura lo aprendió desde muy pequeña, pues su padre le enseño este oficio, aunque es un poco sacrificado su trabajo, le gusta, quizá por eso cuida con esmero sus cultivos de palta, plátanos y frutas cítricas, siendo su esposo quien la acompaña en cada jornada. Paralelamente a este trabajo, cría gallinas y cerdos, que luego son comercializados en el mercado de su ciudad, cuya ganancia le ayuda en algún imprevisto que se presente, ya que no quiere coger sus ahorros que están destinados para la compra de terrenos productivos, en donde renovará y alternará nuevos productos que crece en la zona. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y se muestra satisfecha de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, por ser un grupo muy unido y con mucho ganas de superarse. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 20 sacos de fertilizantes para nivelar la producción de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
At 40 years of age, Teodora lives with her husband, Virgilio, and their four children in their own home, built with bamboo and tree leaves. She is known for being a devoted mother and homemaker. She learned farming work when she was very young since her father taught her this work. Although her job requires sacrifice, she likes it. Perhaps this is why she protects from harm her crops of avocados, bananas, and citrus fruits. Her husband accompanies her every working day. Along with this job, she raises hens and pigs which are then sold in the city market and whose earnings help her with some inexpected problems since she doesn't want to take her savings that are intended for the purchase of productive land where she will renew and alternate new products that grow in the area. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is satisfied to belong to her community group since it is a very unified group with a log of desire to get ahead. With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase 20 sacks of fertilizer to level the production of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar 20 sacos de fertilizantes.

loans.name: Juan Gustavo

texts.es:
Juan tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero vive con su madre en vivienda propia. Juan se dedica 
a brindar el servicio de transporte en su vehiculo propio una mototaxi la cual 
adquirió hace 3 años, en la cual ya posee experiencia en el negocio y buen trato a sus 
clientes. Juan tiene el sueño de construirle su vivienda a su madre ya que por el 
terremoto ocurrido tuvo serios problemas, en la actualidad ya han construido una parte 
con el bono otorgado por el gobierno pero falta darle algunos acabados para que así su 
madre se sienta cómoda y segura en su vivienda. Juan solicita el crédito para las 
mejoras de la vivienda de su madre.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in their own home. Juan is dedicated to providing taxi services in his own vehicle, a mototaxi which he acquired three years ago. He already has experience in this business and he treats his customers well. Juan has a dream of being able to build a home for his mother and him since some serious problems have occurred since the earthquake. Currently, they have already built a part with the bond granted by the government but it failed to provide some finishing touches so that his mother feels comfortable and safe in her home. Juan is requesting a loan to improve his mother's house.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 48 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Las Pampas, del distrito de Olmos, una zona caracterizada por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en areas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, este negocio es de mucha utilidad para los vecinos de la zona en donde vive ya que esta se encuentra alejada de la ciudad y no cuentan con articulos de uso diario al alcance de la mano.  Adicionalmente constituye un ingreso importante para la economía familiar ya que los ingresos que percibe como trabajador agrícola no le bastan para mantener a los suyos.

Juan desea ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ventas y asegurarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas abarrotes con los cuales lograr su objetivo.

Juan es una persona bastate entregada a su familia y su progreso es su mayor anhelo, el desea incrementar el volumen de sus ventas para otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y clientes lo consideran alguien amable y confiable.
texts.en:
Juan is a 48-year old head of household, who lives with his family in the Las Pampas section of Olmos. It is known as a rural zone that belongs to the Lambayeque province, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, he has dedicated himself to the sale of products of basic necessity. This business provides a great service to the neighbors of the area, since they are located far from the city and don’t have easy access to many everyday supplies. Additionally, the business constitutes a vital source of income for the family since his work as a farmer does not provide enough to support them. Juan wants to expand his business in to increase sales which, in turn, can help assure a better standard of living for his family. For this reason, he finds himself for the first time appealing to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to invest in the purchase of more supplies to meet his goals. Juan is devoted to his family, and getting ahead is his greatest wish. He wants to increase the volume of his sales in order to better provide for them. His neighbors and customers consider him friendly and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to expand his general store.

loans.name: Jose Fidel

texts.es:
El Sr. Cárcamo M. es un ganadero que vive con Chorrera – Palermo una comunidad del municipio del Viejo.

El va a utilizar el crédito para la compra de terneros para desarrollo ya que el se dedica a la producción de ganado.

El Sr. Cárcamo actualmente ha tenido 4 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha pagado bien, de igual manera se siente muy agradecido con la Institución  por todo el apoyo que le se le ha brindado y espera seguir siendo apoyado para seguir generando mayores Ingresos.
texts.en:
El Sr. Cárcamo M. es un ganadero que vive con Chorrera – Palermo una comunidad del municipio del Viejo. El va a utilizar el crédito para la compra de terneros para desarrollo ya que el se dedica a la producción de ganado. El Sr. Cárcamo actualmente ha tenido 4 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha pagado bien, de igual manera se siente muy agradecido con la Institución por todo el apoyo que le se le ha brindado y espera seguir siendo apoyado para seguir generando mayores Ingresos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Terneros para Desarrollo

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 46 años, casada con Santiago de 47 años, juntos tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales vive con uno de ellos, en su casa propia, hecho de material rústico, a base de hojas de árbol y madera. Con la esperanza de mejorar cada vez más sus cosechas, Yolanda en compañía de su esposo, se dedican gran parte de su tiempo a cuidar sus cultivos de carambola, plátanos, palta y frutas cítricas, sembrados sobre sus terrenos. A esta pareja le agrada retirar la maleza de los terrenos y mantenerlos limpios, es así que ya llevan 20 años realizando esta actividad, permitiéndoles salir adelante y sobre todo poder brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Para su futuro planea mejorar su casa e instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles y una dulcería. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y está entusiasmada de laborar con su grupo comunal, por estar integrada por personas muy buenas y concientes de sus responsabilidades. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará decenas de plantas cítricas, asimismo para contratar operarios que le ayuden en la siembra.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 46 and married to Santiago, who is 47. Together, they have 4 children of whom one still lives with them. They own their home, which is made from rustic materials and has a base of tree leaves and lumber. Yolanda and her husband, with the hopes of always improving their harvests, dedicate a good part of their time to cultivating their crops of star fruit, bananas, avocado, and citrus fruits, planted on their lands. This couple enjoys clearing and keeping their land healthy and clean, which is how they’ve managed 20 years carrying out this activity. It has allowed them to get ahead and provided a good education for their children. In the future, they hope to make improvements to their home and install a food and candy store. This is her third credit with MFP, and she is enthusiastic about working with her communal group as it is comprised of good people who are conscious about their responsibilities. With the loan she requests, she will buy dozens of citrus plans and hire workers to help sow them.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dozens of citrus plants.

loans.name: Jose Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. R.  es un taxista que vive en el municipio del Viejo.
El va a utilizar el crédito para  Reparación y mantenimiento del Mismo.
Actualmente ha tenido 6 créditos los cuales todos los ha pagado bien y espera seguir trabajando con la Institución  ya que se siente muy satisfecho por toda la ayuda que le han dado así como también ha tenido mejoría en sus ingresos ya que dándole un bien mantenimiento a su Taxi le esta asegurando una larga vida para la alimentación  de su hogar diario.
texts.en:
El Sr. R. es un taxista que vive en el municipio del Viejo. El va a utilizar el crédito para Reparación y mantenimiento del Mismo. Actualmente ha tenido 6 créditos los cuales todos los ha pagado bien y espera seguir trabajando con la Institución ya que se siente muy satisfecho por toda la ayuda que le han dado así como también ha tenido mejoría en sus ingresos ya que dándole un bien mantenimiento a su Taxi le esta asegurando una larga vida para la alimentación de su hogar diario.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mantenimiento y Reparación de Taxi

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa C. is from the village of Miputak. She is 37 years old. Rosa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling variety of products to local community and members. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosa from PMPC and 3rd in kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian M. is from the village of Miputak. She is 49 years old. Lilian is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Lilian owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lilian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lilian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & be used towards working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lilian from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 47 años, casado con Natalia de 37 años y juntos tienen 4 hijos, de las cuales viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia. Desde hace 30 años que se dedica a la agricultura, en donde su esposa la ayuda en esta labor, resultándole menos pesado el trabajo, pero en temporada de cosechas son sus hijos quienes lo ayudan a recolectar los frutos. Luego serían transportados y vendidos, proceso del cual se muestra satisfecho, pues ve la recompensa al arduo trabajo que realizó. Lo que más le agrada de esta actividad es retirar la maleza de sus cultivos de plátanos, guanábana, palta y  frutas cítricas, de igual manera, le gusta colocar trampas para roedores y moscas, que afectan sus siembras. Para su futuro, piensa instalar un negocio de comestibles dentro de su localidad, para que su esposa lo administre y no se sacrifique ella en la chacra. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y asegura que en su grupo comunal, se siente muy bien  porque aprende nuevas experiencias en cada reunión, que le ayudan a progresar, además por que todos son muy unidos y comprensivos. Con los dos mil soles que solicita, comprará 200 sacos de fertilizantes que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos para nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 47 and married to Natalia, who is 37. They have 4 children together, of whom three still live with them in the house they own. He has dedicated himself to agriculture for more than 30 years. His wife assists him, which makes his work less difficult. However, in harvest time, it is his children who help him gather the fruit. Later, they are transported and sold, a process he enjoys because it is the actual reward for his hard work. What he enjoys most is keeping his banana, soursop, avocado and citrus plants healthy. Likewise, he installs traps for the rodents and insects that affect his crops. In the future, he hopes to start a food sales business in his home that his wife could tend to instead of sacrificing herself on the farm. This is his third credit with MFP, and he assures us that he feels very content within his cooperative bank because he learns something new at every meeting. They help him to get ahead, and the group is very united and supportive of each other. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting, he would like to buy 200 sacks of fertilizer to spread throughout his farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 200 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: La Sra. M. V. Octavia, vive en el Caserío de San Antonio perteneciente al distrito de Santiago, junto a su esposo y sus 3  hijas. Trabaja como obrera de campo en el fundo del Sr. Martinez desde hace 5 años. Solicita  financiamiento para  terminar la construcción de su casa que fue afectada por el terremoto en el año 2007. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa y que cada uno de sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. La Sra. Octavia M. V.  agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a travez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. M. V. Octavia lives in the settlement of San Antonio, located in the Santiago district, together with her husband and three children. For 5 years, she has worked as a field laborer on the farm of Sr. Martinez.

She is applying for a loan in order to finish work on her house, which was damaged in the 2007 earthquake. Her dreams are to finish constructing her house and that each one of her children will have a better quality of life. Sra. Octavia M. V. is grateful for the support she has been offered through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to her home.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta S. is from the village of Miputak. She is 32 years old. Julieta is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a general storewhere she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Lordamila

texts.en:
Lordamila M. is from the village of Miputak. She is 56 years old. Lordamila is married and has 6 adult children and 1 school aged child. To make a living, Lordamila owns & operates a business selling a variety of vegetables and spices in the local community. Lordamila has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lordamila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lordamila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Lordamila is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lordamila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José Santos tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales, pertenece a la ciudad de Lambayeque y queda ubicada a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace quince meses, gracias a sus ahorros, pudo adquirir una mototaxi con la que actualmente trabaja brindando servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en la ciudad de Olmos y sus caseríos, esta actividad  tiene bastante acogida en la zona ya que este medio de transporte es muy utilizado por lo pobladores de la zona para transportarse a sus domicilios que muchas veces quedan ubicados a varios kilometros de Olmos.

Durante las ultimas semanas, la unidad movil ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas debido al tiempo de uso y al estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona. Estas fallas dificultan su correcto funcionamiento y requieren de urgente solución, por este motivo Jose Santos se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Jose Santos es un joven responsable y trabajador, con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a sus padres a sostener la economía de su hogar, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y adquirir mas mototaxis. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado tranquilidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José Santos is 23 years old, is single, and lives with his parents in the district of Olmos, where most of the population is concentrated in rural areas. He lives in the city of Lambayeque, which is located one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Fifteen months ago, he used his savings to buy a mototaxi, with which he offers transportation services for cargo and passengers in the city of Olmos and the surrounding areas. His services are well-received in the area because this mode of transportation is used by people in the area who live many kilometers from Olmos. During the last few weeks, the vehicle has begun to have from some mechanical problems because of over-use and the state of the roads in the area. These problems affect the functioning of the mototaxi and need to be addressed immediately. Because of this, José Santo is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles, which he plans to invest in repairs and maintenance for his vehicle. José Santos is a responsible and hard-working youth. With the income he earns, he helps to support his parents. His biggest dream is to continue growing as a businessman and to buy M. mototaxis. He has worked with our institution in the past and has demonstrated patience and responsibility at the time of repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs and maintenance for his mototaxi

loans.name: Rega¤On

texts.en:
Rega¤on L. is from the village of Baniga, Liloy, Zamboanga del norte. She is 56 years old. Rega¤on is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Rega¤on owns & operates a businessraising livestock (pigs) for sale. Rega¤on has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rega¤on joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rega¤on has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Rega¤on is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rega¤on from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita C., from the village of Tolon, is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elenita has been selling jewelry for over eight years, earning a monthly net income of about 10,000.00.

In 2006, Elenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, she is requesting a new loan, her eighth, of 50,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Elma's Group

texts.en:
Elma A., from the village of Bagacay, is the 27-year-old leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elma, who is married and has three school-aged children, owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling household items in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be her first from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's the living situation.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Ignacia's Group

texts.en:
Ignacia M. is from the village of Rizalina. She is 63 years old. Ignacia is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ignacia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ignacia owns & operates a business selling food, primarily snacks & other delicacies, that she sells in the local community. Ignacia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ignacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ignacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ignacia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ignacia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 53 años, es viuda y vive en su casa propia junto a su última hija,  de los 6 hijos que tiene, que son independientes y ya conformaron sus propias familias. A parte de contar con una pensión mensual por su estado de viudez, Rosa comercializa frazadas, almohadas, mantas artesanales, edredones, sábanas entre otros enseres que le solicitan sus clientes, en las ferias o cuando realiza una visita a sus casas. Es así que tiene 3 años dedicándose a este negocio, además asegura que no le molesta desempeñarse sola en el trabajo, puesto que esta acostumbrada. De todas sus virtudes dice que más resalta la generosidad y el espíritu emprendedor que tiene, es por ello que planea ampliar la construcción de su casa, acondicionando espacios para habitaciones en las que luego alquilará a estudiantes, aprovechado que el lugar donde vive es una zona céntrica. En adelante desea comprar un moto carro a nombre de su hija Daisy de 13 años,  para que ambas puedan tener mejor beneficio, considerándolo como un negocio rentable. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y se muestra feliz porque ya cuenta con el capital de trabajo para emprender sus metas. Con el crédito que solicita más los ahorros que tiene, comprará una moto carro, para que alquile y le genere otros ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 53, is a widow. She lives in her own house together with her youngest daughter. Her other 6 children live independently and have their own families. She supports herself, in part, with a monthly state pension for widows.

Rosa sells handcrafted blankets, pillows, quilts and sheets, among other household goods ordered by her customers, at markets or when she visits their homes. She has been in this business for 3 years. It has not been a problem for her to pay off her businesses debts.

Of all her virtues, what stand out most are her generosity and enterprising spirit. This is leading her to enlarge her house, preparing spaces for rooms that she will rent to students since the place where she lives is in a central zone.

She wants to purchase a mototaxi (a three-wheeled motorcycle that can transport passengers) in the name of her 13 year old daughter, Daisy, so that they both can have a better income since it is a profitable business. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is happy because she has had working capital for achieving her goals. With the loan she is applying for and the savings that she has she will buy a mototaxi that she will rent out to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a mototaxi.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida B. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Zenaida is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a tailoring business, providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. This will be the second loan taken out by Zenaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads

loans.name: Mukhtayaran's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtayaran is 50 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historic places and its Punjabi foods.
 
Mukhtayaran is an uneducated lady, but she wants to give her children a good education. To achieve this goal she operates a business selling quilts. Her business grows in the winter season, but in the summer season she sells pillowcases and bed sheets. Her business gives her an income of PKR 8,000 every month. Her income makes her family more confident.
 
She has seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her first two sons help her in her quilt-selling business. The others are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Her husband, L. A., is also very supportive of her business. He sometimes takes time out from his work and helps her sell quilts. He is a mason by profession. Their combined earnings allow their family finances to run smoothly. 
 
Mukhtayaran has successfully repaid her two loans to Asasah (a microfinance institution in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to purchase pillowcases and bed sheets in bulk to expand her sales and to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase pillowcases and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Jamila Bano's Group

texts.en:
Jamila bano is a very hardworking lady. She lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 
She is 45-years old, but her courage and determination never make her tired from her circumstances. She operates a bangle selling business. Her business is a renowned business in the community. She has a variety of bangles. She sells different kinds of bangles, such as steel and bead. Her variety of bangles attracts more customers. She utilizes her income to pay for the utilities. 
She is a mother of five children: one son and four daughters. Her son operates a used phone handset repairing & selling business. His shop is located in the main market. Her elder daughter reads in 10th standard and the others read in 5th, 4th and 3rd standard. 
Her husband's name is A. R.. He is a mason by profession. He has been in this profession for over 25 years. 
Jamila bano is a regular client of Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She has successfully repaid her four loans to Asasah and is now applying, for the fifth time, to purchase used handsets and repairing tools to expand her son's business.

loans.use: To purchase used handsets to sell.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a wife of F. M.. They both live in a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. She is a mother of three boys. Her elder son runs an electrical supplies selling business. the next son works in a local factory on a monthly wage and the youngest son works in a private company as a computer operator.

Khursheed's husband is a government employee, earning a meager income. To run the financial circle she makes handmade decorative fans which have high demand in summer season. Her work gives her an income of Pak Rupees 10,000 in the summer season. This has become a great source for her family. She has successfully repaid her four loans to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to purchase the electrical supplies (wires, switches, tube lights and bulbs) to expand her sons’ electrical supplies selling business.

loans.use: To purchase electrical supplies to sell.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
39 year- old Flor A. aims to support the education of her three children until they graduate from college and have their own careers. Her eldest child is 15 years old and has graduated from high school/secondary school. In June (opening of classes), she will be entering college and will be incurring larger expenses for tuition, fees, uniforms, and other expenses related to her education. It is good that Flor's two younger children are only seven and eight years old and yet in primary school. Expenses are somehow too much for Flor and her husband to bear.

Flor and her husband have been in a rice farming business since they started their own family. The land they use for that business is rented from someone in their village. Before Flor became a member of ASHI, the only capital she had to finance her business was borrowed from wealthy people in their village. The owner of the land takes a percentage from their harvest, and so did the person who lent them money. At the end of the day, all that is left for Flor and her family is just enough for their consumption.
