He has never before requested a loan from WAGES, and is doing so for the first time to buy 80 audio CDs and 150 video DVDs. He is married and the father of three children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida por sus festividades religiosas, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de reparación de automóviles en un pequeño taller ubicado en la zona donde vive, allí atiende todos los dias a los diversos clientes que acuden al lugar para que solucione los problemas que tienen con sus unidades móviles, el trata de realizar su trabajo con mucha responsabilidad y eficiencia para que sus clientes le sigan otorgando su preferencia.

Debido al tiempo que lleva funcionando su taller muchos de los instrumentos y herramientas con la que realiza su trabajo se estan deteriorando y ya no pueden ser utilizadas, por ello Julio se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de herrammientas para reeemplazar las viejas y seguir implementando su taller.

Julio es una persona que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, por ello trata de brindarle mucha dedicación para así progresar poco a poco, su mayor anhelo es formar una empresa de venta de repuestos para automóviles. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institucion y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Julio is a family man of 50 years of age, who lives with his wife and children in the Motupe district. This area is known for its religious festivals, and is located in the Lambayeque province, about 1½ hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, he has dedicated himself to providing auto repair services from a small workshop in the area where he lives. There, he tends to customers very day who seek him out for help with their mechanical problems. He aims to carry out his work with great care and efficiency so that his customers continue to choose him for their repair needs. Given the amount of time he has been in business, his tools are deteriorating and can no longer be used. For this reason, Julio finds himself having to appeal to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles. He plans to invest the loan into purchasing new tools to replace the old ones, and therefore be able to more efficiently continue with his work. Julio is a person who very much enjoys his line of business and, because of this, he has given it a great deal of dedication so it will continue to grow. His greatest wish is to start an enterprise selling replacement car parts. He has worked with our institution previously, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility from the moment he assumes his installment payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing cloth/fabric and scarves

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia. DesD. hace 10 años se dedica a vender leche en el mercado central D. su ciudad. Es entonces que todas las mañanas se dirige a su punto D. venta, del cual ya sus clientes la esperan para comprar le leche fresca que ofrece. Es así, que su rutina empieza con el orD.ño D. sus vacas, para luego pasar el proceso D. cuajo, siendo el producto final la leche que comercializa. Al término del día, va a su casa a cuidar D. sus demás animales que tiene. Paralelo a ello, se dedica también al cultivo D. maíz y papa, que lo utiliza para su propio consumo. El trabajo que realiza es gratificante, por lo que planea comprar más animales, además esta actividad le permite estar ocupada todo el tiempo y sentirse autosuficiente. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. un becerro para su respectiva crianza y convertirlo en una vaca muy productiva, asimismo desea comprar sacos D. abono para sembrar alfalfa, en el que serán utilizados como forraje para sus animales.
texts.en:
Agustina is 62 years old. She lives with her husband in their own house. For the past 10 years, she has worked selling milk in her city's central market. Every morning when she goes to her sales stall, her customers are already waiting to buy the milk she offers. Her routine starts with the milking of her cows and then the process of separation to produce the milk that she sells. At the end of the day, she goes home to take care of the other animals she raises. Parallel to this, she also grows corn and potatoes, which she uses for her family's own consumption. She finds her work satisfying, and she plans to expand it by purchasing more animals. Her work also allows her to keep busy all the time and feel self-sufficient. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She believes this support will be very useful for the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to invest in buying a calf to raise into a highly productive milk cow. She would also like to buy sacks of fertilizer to grow alfalfa, which she will use as feed for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a calf as well as sacks of fertilizer to grow alfalfa

loans.name: Ablan Novignon

texts.fr: Cette femme a commencé en 2003 le commerce de charbons de bois, actuellement son stock est en baisse raison pour laquelle elle sollicite son tout premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter  6 sacs de charbons de bois pour gonfler son stock. Elle est divorcée de son époux et a à sa charge un enfant. Les revenus issus de son commerce lui permettent de subvenir aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady began to sell charcoal in 2003, and presently her stocks are depleted, which is the reason why she is requesting her first ever loan from WAGES to buy 6 sacks of charcoal to bolster her inventory. She is divorced from her husband and is raising a child.The income from her little business allows her to support her household.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Centurión D. B. es viuda, con casa propia,  tiene 62 años D. edad.

     Es propietaria D. una despensa con 31 años D. funcionamiento, buena ubicación, con clientela formada, aparte tiene 3 salones que alquila.

     Sueña en cargar mas D. mercaderias su negocio para poder aumentar sus ingresos porque esta muy bien ubicado, ademas por que el fondo D. su negocio lo ha invertido en algunos gastos particulares y no ha podido recargar, y por ello solicita el crédito para la compra D. los articulos que faltan en su negocio; como panificados, lacteos, y todos los productos D. la canasta básica.
texts.en:
Lucia Centurión D. B. is a widow. She has her own house, and she is 62 years old. She has had a grocery store for 31 years. It is well located, and she has regular customers. She also has three salons that she rents. She dreams of carrying more merchandise for her business. She wants to be able to increase her income because she is well located. Also, she has invested funds from her business in some private expenses, and she has not been able to replenish. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy some articles that her business needs like baked goods, dairy products, and all of the basic needs products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baked goods, dairy products, noodles, rice, drinks, sugar, and others

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
En 2008, ce monsieur a ouvert sa propre boutique de vente des articles de quincaillerie qu’il a appelé « ETS ENERGIE AFRICA », il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.il n’a jamais obtenu du crédit chez WAGES, il sollicite sont premier crédit pour gonfler son stock avec divers articles de mercerie.sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.
il est marié et  a un enfant.
texts.en:
In 2008, this gentleman opened his own store selling hardware items. He calls his little shop « ETS ENERGIE AFRICA », and he buys his stocks in the big open-air market of Lomé. He has never had a loan from WAGES, and so he is requesting his first to bolster his stocks of various drygoods items. His clientele is composed of all sorts of people. He is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various hardware items

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Luchadores (Fighting Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a large city known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with husband and two children.

Ana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her nail salon business by purchasing more acrylic nails, as well as women's underwear and inexpensive jewelry to sell to her clients. She will use the profits to invest in a vehicle to make her life easier, as well as saving toward her long term goal of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase acrylic nails, women's underwear and jewelry

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es:
Yovanna, tiene 37 años, es madre soltera, es natural del Cusco y tiene dos hijos (Valeria de 15 años y Daniel de 10 años). Su principal actividad económica es jefa de personal de la Municipalidad distrital de Wanchaq y su actividad económica complementaria es vender joyería, ella tiene dos puestos de venta, uno en la Plaza de Armas del Cusco y otro en la plazoleta de “Regocijo”, ella cuenta con dos personas que atienden los negocios. Ya son 5 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que el negocio bajo considerablemente debido a las precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron en la ciudad y por este motivo no llegaban turistas a la ciudad del Cusco.    

Yovanna  es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo platería y joyería. 

Yovanna  pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal y también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yovanna is a 37 year-old single mother from Cuzco who has two children -- Valeria (15) and Daniel (10). She is the chief of personnel for the Municipality of Wanchaq. Moreover, she owns two kiosks (one in the Plaza de Armas in Cuzco, and one in a smaller plaza called "Regocijo"), run by two employees, where she sells jewelry. In large part due to her tremendous work ethic, she has successfully run this business for five years. Yovanna tells us that the recent torrential rainstorms have caused a slowdown in tourist activity in Cuzco, which has in turn caused her business to suffer. She is extremely hard-working, and always looks for opportunities to move forward and provide a better future for her children. Yovanna is requesting this loan to purchase additional merchandise, specifically jewelry and silver goods. She belongs to the Asociacion Arariwa "Los Diamantes" community bank. This bank has 10 loan cycles, and Yovanna is very happy with the loan, savings, and business training services provided by the bank. She is thankful for the opportunity offered by this medium, and commits to paying back the loan according to the arranged repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise: jewelry and silver goods

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Angela Nuñez D. E. es separada, tiene casa propia y vive con su hijo.
Es propietaria D. una despensa en su casa.La señora ha trabajodo en varias oportubidaes con la fundación en esta ocación solicita un prétamos para cubrír los gastos por medicamentos.
Tiene un hijo que habia sufrido un accidente hace dos años atrás y se fracturo las dos piernas y se esta recuperando D. a poco, lo que le causa muchos gastos en medicamentos y por otras cosas.
Es una señora responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora, tiene muy buenas referencias comerciales en todas las entidades.
texts.en:
Angela Nuñez D. E. is separated. She has her own house, and she lives with her child. She has a grocery store in her house. She has worked with the Fundación several times. On this occasion she is requesting a loan to cover the cost of medication. She has a child who suffered an accident two years ago. He broke both legs, and he is slowly recovering. There are a lot of expenses for medication and other things. She is a responsible, honest, and hard-working woman. She has very good references from all of the businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medications

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Madame Alimata D.  a 52 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle réside avec son époux, ses coépouses et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’initia très tôt aux  activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente d’habillements et d’articles divers en provenance de Bobo Dioulasso et de Bamako (respectivement du Burkina Faso et au Mali) depuis  20 ans. 
Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Elle vend ses marchandises de façon ambulante dans les différentes structures professionnelles de la ville et son activité marche à merveille. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 15 de bazins en couleur, 10 pièces de pagnes wax  et 4 complets de draps. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Madame Alimata D. is 52, married, and the mother of 8 children. She lives with her husband, her co-spouses, and their children in a big extended traditional family in Médine, a working-class neighborhood of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). Not having had the good fortune to progress at school for socio-economic reasons, Madame D. began early on to earn her living, notably by selling clothing and various other items coming from Bobo Dioulasso and Bamako (from Burkina Faso and Mali respectively); she has done this for 20 years. She is much in demand among her clientele due to the quality of her products. She does ambulant sales in the various professional buildings of the town and her business is doing great. Wishing to satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the MFI Soro Yiriwaso about 3 years ago. After 3 solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's group from her neighborhood, she is now on her first individual loan. With this loan she intends to buy 15 pieces of colored damask, 10 lengths of wax-brand African print cloth, and 4 sets of sheets. She expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 F CFA from this loan. The profit will be used essentially to increase her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interests on the loan, investing any remainder into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing for resale

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de cartes de recharges,il réalise de bonnes recettes, pour mieux diversifier son commerce il a impliqué 2 personnes de sa famille et a associé le service téléphonique à son activité. Voulant rehausser son stock afin de bien satisfaire ses clients,  il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 50 cartes de recharges Togocell, 50 cartes de recharges Moov et  20 cartes de recharges Illico.
il est marié et a 2 enfants
texts.en:
Mr Kokou Z.'s economic activity is to sell re-chargeable mobile telephone cards with credit on them. In order to diversify his business he also employs two family members and has associated himself with the telephone service. In order to replenish his stock and better satisfy his customers, he is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 50 re-chargeable cards from Togocell and Moov and 20 re-chargeable cards from Illico. He is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of re-chargeable phone cards

loans.name: Siguitèmasson Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Siguitèmasson sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec en moyenne 39 ans, 5 enfants et habitant  toutes  à Farabougou, un des villages de la Commune Rurale de Téssérèla  (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Elles font le commerce de riz,  de spaghetti, de poissons séchés, fumés, d’oignon, de savons etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro  Yiriwaso avec qui, elles sont  à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. 
Madame Fatoumata T. qui est un des membres du groupe a opté se spécialiser dans l’achat et la vente de céréales (maïs, fonio, mil, arachide, riz, etc.) 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, un sac de riz étuvé à Tissala auprès des producteurs. Elle revend son riz à domicile, à Gassola et Zambougou Fouta à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour acheter du condiment et entretenir ses enfants. 
Fatoumata T. a pour ambition l’achat d’une charrette et d’un âne pour assurer son transport et celui de ses marchandises dans les différentes foires.
texts.en:
The six members of the Siguitèmasson group are married for the most part into large traditional extended families and are on average 39 years old with five children. They all live in Farabougou, one of the villages in the Téssérèla Rural Community (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They became acquainted through family ties and weddings, and as neighbours. Their commercial activities deal with rice, spaghetti, dried and smoked fish, onions, soap, etc. Wanting to increase their working capital, they decided to join up with the Soro Yiriwaso credit loan programme, where they are requesting their first group loan. One of the group members is Mrs. Fatoumata T. who decided to specialise in the trade of grain cereals (corn, fonio, millet, peanuts, rice, etc.). She will use her loan to buy one bag of pre-cooked rice from producers in Tissala. She retails from her home, in Gassola and Zambougou Fouta to a mixed customer base. She hopes to achieve average monthly earnings of 15,000 FCFA, which will serve to buy condiments and support her children. Her ambition is to buy a donkey and a cart to ensure her transport and that of her merchandise to different market fairs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice

loans.name: Encuentro Con Jesus Group

texts.en:
Sonny is the coordinator of her group 'Encuentro con Jesus' (Encounter with Jesus), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their child.

Sonny is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing as well as other assorted items by purchasing clothing, shoes, pasta and soap to sell to her customers. She will use the profits in finishing her education as well as saving money for the future of her child and future children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Clothing, shoes, pasta and soap for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 32 años, madre de 2 hijos y juntos viven en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de diversos artículos, pero hace un año que empezó a vender prendas de vestir, en especial para niños, que son ofrecidos a las madres de las amigas de su hija que aún esta en etapa escolar. Es así que estos productos son dejados a créditos, pero solo a personas que ella considera son de garantía y responsables con el pago. Ella disfruta mucho del trabajo que realiza, ya que siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, puesto que considera que es un trabajo muy rentable. Su propósito inmediato es buscar nuevos clientes y aumentar su mercadería. Este es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, y esta contenta de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, ya que sabe que sus nuevos compañeros son solidarios y responsables con sus pagos, además considera que el aporte que recibirá le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería en prendas de vestir para niños como poleras, polos, pantalones y camisas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 32, has two children. They live together in a rented house. For 15 years she has been selling diverse articles. But, one year ago she started to sell clothing especially for children. She sells to the mothers of her daughter’s friends who are still school age. She leaves these products on credit, but only to people she considers are responsible and guaranteed to pay. She really enjoys the work she does. She has always worked in business, and she considers it to be very profitable work. Her immediate purpose is to look for new customers and to increase her merchandise. This is the first time she has requested a loan with MFP. She is happy to belong to her communal bank because she knows that her new colleagues are unified and responsible with their payments. She feels that the help she will receive will be very useful to the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy children’s clothes like t-shirts, polo shirts, pants, and shirts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy childrens clothing

loans.name: Abdoumandjid

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est très dynamique, afin de subvenir à ses besoins, il est lancé en 2007 dans le commerce de détail des volailles et des moutons, il achète ses moutons et volailles à l’intérieur du pays, après l’achat, il les élève quelques jours avant de les vendre,ainsi ils prennent plus de poids et sont  vendu à un prix plus élevé. Il a reçu une commande importante de ses clients, pour les satisfaire il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de volailles et de moutons
texts.en:
This dynamic young man decided in 2007 to meet his needs through the trade of poultry and sheep, which he buys from the interior of the country. After purchase, he keeps them a few days so that they can put one some weight and be sold at a better price. He has received an important order from his customers, and in order to satisfy it has requested from WAGES a loan to buy poultry and sheep.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy sheep and poultry

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail des articles scolaires, comme la rentrée du troisième trimestre est proche, elle voudrait gonfler son stock d’articles scolaires pour mieux vendre c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de règles, bics, cahiers et autres. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman has an income-generating retail business involving school supplies.  Since the third trimester will be starting soon, she would like to expand her inventory of school supplies in order to have better sales.  This why she's requesting a loan from WAGES for buying rulers, pens, notebooks, and more.  She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying school supplies

loans.name: Divina Misericoridia Group

texts.en:
Quesy is the coordinator of her group 'Divine Misericordia' (Divine Mercy), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiage, a large city known for tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with longterm partner and their four children.

Quesy is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small food stand, by purchasing the rice, beans, vegetables and cooking oil (all staples of Dominican life) that her customers demand. She will sell these goods and use the profits to invest in the education of her children by saving for them to go to the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: rice, beans, vegetables and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Estrellita Group

texts.es:
Ana Lilia D. L. C. T. tiene 28 años D. edad.  En L. foto elL. muestra uno D. los chalecos que elL. comercializa, y un voluntario nos modeL. otro D. ellos.

ElL. vive en L. comunidad D. Cerro del Marquéz, Valle D. Chalco Solidaridad Estado D. México. Es una acreditada activa D. L. UD. Estrellita.         


L. Señora Ana Lilia  se dedica a L. venta D. batas, overoles y chalecos reflejantes desD. hace 4 años. Por necesidad, comenzó a vender estas prendas  ya que sus hijos ingresaron  a L. escueL. y lo que su esposo ganaba  no alcanzaba para sus gastos, así  que al ver su situación económica,  deciD. buscar un lugar para obtener un préstamo.  
 A través D. una amiguita es como conoce a Fundación Realidad, y  L.  invita a integrarse a un grupo. Esta idea a elL. L. motiva porque le presenta L. oportunidad D. obtener un préstamo para invertir en más mercancía e incrementar sus ganancias  y D. esa manera, poder tener mejor solvencia económica. 

Su prioridad en este momento  es L. educación D. 4 D. sus hijos mismos que se encuentran estudiando, y uno más pequeño D. 1 año D. edad. 

Ana Lilia desea mejorar su calidad D. vida con este negocio y  agradece D. antemano L. ayuda que pueda recibir  

Los miembros del grupo son:

Ma Trinidad Jaimes Benítez                                  Venta D. cazos, parrillas
Virginia Mejia Gutiérrez                                        Impermeabilización
FabioL. Benítez Jaimes                                          Venta D. catalogo (cosméticos)
Maria D. Lourdes García VelarD.                          Papelería
Maria José Maceda Patiño                                     Venta D. catalogo (cosméticos)
Edith Rivera Romero                                             Venta D. ropa y zapato
Irma Godinez Tovar                                               Venta D. botanas
Gloria Hernández Carrillo                                     Venta D. catalogo (cosméticos)
Guly Gema Méndez Zurita                                    Venta D. catalogo (cosméticos)
Maximina Patiño Santiago                                    Abarrotes
Carolina García VelarD.                                        Venta D. catalogo  (zapatos)
texts.en:
Ana Lilia is 28 years old. We can see her in the photograph, holding up one of the vests that she sells, while a volunteer models another. She lives in Cerro del Marquéz, Valle D. Chalco Solidaridad in the state of Mexico. She is an active member of UD. Estrellita. Ana Lilia has been selling robes, overalls, and reflective vests. She began selling these articles out of necessity, now that her children have started school and her husband’s income was not enough to cover expenses. Due to her economic situation, she decided to look for a loan. She learned of Fundación Realidad through a friend, who invited her to join the group. This motivates her very much because it provides her the opportunity of obtaining a loan to invest in merchandise and increase her earnings. This way she will be able to become more economically solvent. Her priority at the moment is the education of four of her five children. They currently attend school; her fifth child is only a year old. Ana Lilia hopes to better her quality of life through this business and she is very grateful for this assistance. The other members of the group are: Ma Trinidad – Shoe and grill sales Virginia – Waterproofing FabioL. – Beauty products (catalog sales) Maria – Paper goods Maria – Beauty products (catalog sales) Edith – Clothing and shoes Irma – Appetizers Gloria – Beauty products (catalog sales) Guly – Beauty products (catalog sales) Maximina – Groceries Carolina – Shoe sales (catalog)

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Cinforosa

texts.es:
Cinforosa pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal.

Cinforosa, tiene 58 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Su principal actividad económica es vender comida en el mercado central del Cusco llamado “San Pedro”, ella tiene su propio puesto de trabajo en el mercado y trabaja todos los días desde las 5 mañana  hasta 5 de la noche, ella prepara desayuno, almuerzo y platos especiales a pedido del cliente. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Cinforosa es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar ollas y una cocina nueva.
 
Cinforosa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cinforosa belongs to “Los Diamantes” Communal Bank, which is part of the Arariwa Association. The bank has had 10 loan cycles, and Cinforosa says that she has been satisfied and pleased with the credit services, savings, and training the bank has offered during the time she has been a member. Cinforosa is 58 years old, married, and has three children. Her main economic activity is selling food in Cusco’s central market, which is called “San Pedro.” She has her own stall in the market, and works every day from 5 in the morning until 5 in the evening. Cinforosa prepares breakfasts, lunches, and special dishes that are requested by her customers. She has had this business for the past 10 years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Cinforosa is a mother who is enterprising and hard working. She is constantly looking for opportunities to get ahead, and is helping her family through her daily effort. She needs this loan so that she can purchase pots and a new stove. Cinforosa is grateful for the opportunity she is being given through this loan, and she agrees to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing pots and a new stove

loans.name: Bassa Group

texts.en:
Petee D. is the head of a group of five borrowers called 'Bassa Group'.  Petee is 52 years old and could not continue her education past 9th grade. She is single and has five children whose ages range from 34-13 years. Two of her children are in university and technical college respectively while the rest are in elementary and senior high school. She also takes care of three siblings.

Petee’s involved with the sale of slippers. She buys in bulk and sells retail and she has been in this business for one year. She started her business with two dozen slippers and now has eight dozens. She is challenged by police action. She takes her goods all over Monrovia to sell.

She says many customers are attracted to her business because she sells durable and good slippers. She hopes is to get involved in another business to generate some capital to augment her present business. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dozens of slippers.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Petee is holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia 's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

 
Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy more dozens of slippers

loans.name: Assiba Sssi

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans le commerce de vêtements et de sous-vêtements, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999 de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Pour toucher plus de clients elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, sa clientèle est composée de personnes de toute âge ; elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers catégories de  vêtements et de sous-vêtements.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who became specialized in the commerce of undergarments.  She has been in this business since 1999 going from door to door.  She stocks up in Lomé.  To reach more customers, she operates as an itinerant vendor.  Her customer base is composed of people of all ages.  She is faced with a drop in her stock of merchandise.  She would like to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying different types of clothing and undergarments.  She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing and undergarments

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.en:
Felicia is 56 years old and she is the coordinator of her group 'Nuevo Progreso' (New Progress). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of the capital, Santo Domingo, a crime-ridden area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband.

Felicia is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small food stand selling rice, salads, beans, and staples such as yuca and plantains. She will use the profits to save towards improving her home as well as helping her community. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: rice, salads, beans, and staples such as yuca and plantains to sell to her clients

loans.name: Moudjanatou

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris la couture, comme cette activité ne marchait pas pour elle, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits d’alimentation générale, sa clientèle est constituée de toutes  personnes, son stock de marchandises a baissé, elle voudrait reconstituer son stock c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat des cartons de spaghetti, 4 boîtes de  tomates en boîtes de conserve, divers détergents et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This is a women who learned tailoring.  Since this business wasn't doing well for her, she got started in the commerce of grocery items.  Hers customer base is composed of all people.  With the drop in her inventory, she would like to replenish it.  This is why she's requesting a loan for buying some boxes of spaghetti, four boxes of canned tomatoes, different detergents, and a variety of grocery items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grocery items to sell

loans.name: Royal Family Group

texts.en:
Marol Y. is the head of a group of five borrowers called Royal Family. Marol is 27 years old. She is a university student and is single. She also takes care of two siblings.

Marol’s work involves the sale of a variety of goods including biscuits, soap, toothpaste and radio batteries. She buys in bulk and sells retail and she has been doing this business for five year. She started his business with funds she got from doing vacation jobs. Her challenge is enormous; she is running the business alone and will have to close it down and go to school. Her business is located on McDonald Street downtown Monrovia.

She says many customers are attracted to her business because she sells quality goods. She hopes to increase her business and in the future build a house. She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more provisions.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marol Y. is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Reynaldo Bismarck

texts.es: Don Reynaldo es un hombre trabajador, padre de familia de dos hijas, su negocio lo formo hace varios años,  producto de su trabajo como electricista  domiciliar. Logro poner una ferretería que junto a su esposa administran los cuales hacen turnos. Ya que ella  hace los oficios de la casa y de esta manera logran ahorrar dinero. Sus hijas aun cursan el año escolar. Don Reynaldo comenzó con pocos productos y con mucha deseo de escalar, para ofrecer todos los productos de construcción ya que la demanda es mucho. La meta que tiene es lograr hacer más grande el local de la ferretería como invertir en pintura, hierro, lámparas, zinc entre otros productos para aumentar las ventas. Que espera lograr con el financiamiento ya que le ofrece plazo lo que es para el de muchos beneficios.
texts.en:
Don Reynaldo is a hard working man. He is a family man, a father to two daughters. He started his business several years ago, as a result of his job as a house electricist. He was able to open a hardware store that he and his wife manage in shifts. She manages the home and in this way they are able to save money. His daughters are still in the middle of their schoolyear. Don Reynaldo began with few products and with a strong desire to grow to offer all construction products, since demand is high. His goal is to make the hardware store locale bigger in order to invest in paint, hardware, lamps, and zinc, among other products, to increase sales. He hopes to do this with the financing since it offers him conditions that are very beneficial to him.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy paint, hardware, lamps, and zinc since he has few of these products and they sell well.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 34 años, casada y madre de 4 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años que se dedica a criar animales menores y reses en un establo que tiene en su casa, paralelo a ello, siembra papa y maíz. Cada quincena vende sus animales en la feria ganadera de su ciudad, ofertándolos a buen precio, en donde las ganancias es la recompensa de su arduo trabajo. En esta actividad cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, que le ayudan en la crianza y cuidado de sus animales. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, además que le permite estar al pendiente de su hogar. En el futuro espera tener un establo con regular cantidad de animales para incrementar sus ganancias. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, asimismo esta contenta de recibir este aporte, por que sabe que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una ternera, carnero y pollos para aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene en su granja.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Together they live in their own home. For ten years she has been raising small animals and cattle in a stable that she has at her her home. At the same time, she plants potatoes and corn. Every two weeks, she sells her animals in the city cattle fair. She offers them at a good price and the earnings are payment for her hard work. She has the support of her children for this activity. They help her raise and care for the animals. She enjoys her work a lot and it lets her keep track of her home. In the future, she hopes to have a stable with a regular amount of animals in order to increase her earnings. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She is happy to receive this amount because she knows it will be very useful for her business' progress. With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of a young cow, a ram, and in chickens to increase the number of animals she has at her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a young cow, a ram and chickens.

loans.name: Patience Akou

texts.fr: En 2004, cette dame a commencé le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  sacs de riz, des cartons d’huile « NIOTO », des cartons de biscuits et divers produits d’alimentation générale.. Elle a déjà obtenu  de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé
texts.en:
In 2004 this lady began a general food products business. She gets her supplies in Lomé. She is experiencing a decline in her stock of goods and for this reason is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase sacks of rice, cartons of "NIOTO" oil, boxes of biscuits and various other general food products. She has already had one loan from WAGES which she repaid correctly.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana C. M. A. is married and has five dependents. She has no educational background. Her husband is a fireman.

Juliana sells bags of sachet water (water in plastic bags) at Akotokyire and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Juliana will use the loan to purchase more bags of water for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her dependents.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of water to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, tiene 25 años y es soltera. Su principal actividad económica es ayudar a su tía Danila en la compra, distribución y vender artefactos en los mercados y centros comerciales como por ejemplo, al mercado “Molino I” y a los  Centros Comercial “Confraternidad” y “Paraíso” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nos cuenta que viaja a la ciudad de Tacna a traer los artefactos junto con su tía. Ya son 5 meses que ayuda a su tía en el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Mercedes es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar artefactos y de esa forma independizarse de su tía.   

Mercedes pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa es socia nueva. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación que brinda la Asociación. 

Mercedes se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 25, is single. Her main economic activity is helping her aunt Danila to buy, distribute and sell artifacts in markets and shopping centers like the “Molino I” market and the “Confraternidad” and “Paraíso” shopping centers in Cusco. She tells us that she and her aunt travel to the city of Tacna to get the artifacts. She has been helping her aunt with the business for 5 months and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Mercedes is a young, hard-working, enterprising woman who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and, through her own daily efforts, help her family. She needs funds to buy artifacts for herself so that she can become independent from her aunt. Mercedes is a new member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LOS DIAMANTES” (The Diamonds) communal bank. The bank has been in 10 operational cycles. She states that she is happy and content with the credit services, the savings and the training she gets from the association. Mercedes is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy artifacts.

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
En su comunidad se han destacado y todos los vecinos les acompañan en la actividades que realizan ya sean sorteos, torneos y actividades para los niños de la comunidad y desean seguir trabajando unidas para seguir creciendo en grupo y así fortalecerse en el comité.

El comité además de trabajar en conjunto, cada integrante realiza una actividad independiente de manera a obtener mejores ingresos en para la familia.
Muchas de las señoras ya cuentan con negocio y otras que están con el proyecto de abrir su negocio como la señora  Herminia quien trabaja como empleada domestica fuera de su casa y actualmente piensa montar un puesto de comidas frente a su casa y así independizarse y trabajar en su casa con sus hijos. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para comenzar con la construcción.
texts.en:
They have stood out in their community and all their neighbors support their activities be they raffles, sports events or children’s activities; they want to continue working together to continue to grow as a group and become stronger in the committee. Besides working as a group, each member has her own independent commercial activity designed to obtain improved income for their families. Many of the women already have their own businesses and others are about to open theirs. Such is the case of Herminia who works as a domestic employee in a private home and plans now to set up a food vending stand outside her home to become independent and be able to work at home with her children. She is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies to begin construction. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johanna Elizabeth  de 31 años de edad es soltera, trabaja como contadora de la universidad URACCAN ,tiene de 2 hijos el mayor de 10 añitos y el menor de 7 años ambos estudian su primaria, vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea. Actualmente està estudiando un post grado en la cuidad capital, y se caracteriza ser una mujer con muchos deseos de superaciòn profesional y laboral,-   

Esta solicitando su 5to credito para construccion de una habitacion, afirma que su  casa la tiene gracias a los creditos anteriores que le abrindado AFODENIC,  pues como asalariada es dificil comprar y mejorar su vivienda. 

Su gran sueño en la vida es tener un hogar digno como toda persona sueña y que  sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Johanna Elizabeth, 31, is single; she is employed at URACCAN University as an accountant. She has two children, the oldest, who is 10 years old and the youngest, who is 7; both are in elementary school. They live in the Nueva Guinea urban zone. She is currently studying for a post-graduate degree in the city and she’s known for being a woman with a strong desire to improve both personally and professionally. She is requesting her 5th loan to build a room. She states that she has her house thanks to prior loans from AFODENIC because, as just a salaried employee, it’s difficult to buy and improve her home. Her great wish in life is to have a proper home like everyone dreams of and that her children study and become upstanding citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia E. is a single parent with one child. She has received junior high education. She bakes bread to sell at Akotokyire and uses her income to provide a meaningful education for her child.

Emilia will use the loan to purchase more flour and other ingredients to bake bread for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, she plans to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Edem Kafui

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est âgé de 31 ans,  il est un  responsable de famille, pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il s’est lancé en 2006 dans le commerce de chaussures , il a associé en 2008 à la vente de chaussures la vente des habits et de sacs de sortie de femme. Il exerce son commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « Nouvelle génération ». il s’approvisionne au marché local de hedzranawoé. Il vend à toutes les catégories de personnes.voulant augmenter son stock en baisse, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de chaussures et d'habits.
texts.en:
This gentleman is 31 years old and is the head of household.  To meet family expenses, he got started in the commerce of shoes in 2006. And in 2008, he included the sale of clothing and women's handbags.  He operates his business in his own shop he calls "Nouvelle Génération". He gets his supplies at the local market of Hedzranawoé.  He sells to people from all walks of life.  Wanting to increase his diminished inventory, he's requesting a loan from WAGES for buying shoes and clothing. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes

loans.name: Blessed Family Group

texts.en:
Esther W. is the head of a group of five borrowers called The Blessed Family. Esther is 48 years old. She did not go to school due to financial constraints.  She is single and has eight children whose ages range from 8 to 30 years old. Her first child did not go to school, but the rest of the children are attending school.

Esther is involved with the sale of used clothes, including socks and neckties. She has been in this business for 20 years. She started her business with 2,500 Liberian dollars and now has a working capital of 40,500 Liberian dollars. Her business is located on Randall Street, in downtown Monrovia.

She says many customers get attracted to her business because she sells quality goods and approaches customers in a good manner. She hopes to increase her business by using her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used clothes.

 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Esther W. is holding the sign.

 

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia 's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socioeconomic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

 

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Bianeth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Bianeth de 31 años de edad, es soltera  labora como Responsable de la Univesidad URCCAN desde hace 9 años,  tiene una bebe de 2 años y y seis meses,su compañero de vida labora como albañil el cual la ayuda con los gastos familiares.

Esta solicitando su 4to crèdito  para comprar materiales de construcciòn y asi construir una habitaciòn para su bebita, y asi tener mejor comodidad en el hogar,este es el segundo credito que tramita con el fondo kiva y expresa sentirse muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado.

Su sueño es ir mejorando poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y seguir estudiando para ser una profesinal con mucha experiencia.
texts.en:
Bianeth, 31, is single and has been employed as a supervisor at URACCAN University for the last 9 years; she has a two-and-a-half year old daughter. Her life partner works as a bricklayer and contributes to family expenses. She is requesting her 4th loan to buy building materials to build a bedroom for her baby so that the home will be more comfortable. This is her 2nd loan with Kiva funds and she states that she is very grateful for the support provided. Her dream is to gradually improve her living conditions and to continue to study to become an experienced professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty E. is a hairdresser and sells hair products as well at Akotokyire. She has received senior high education. She is single and has been in hairdressing for some time now.

Gifty takes care of herself by using her small income to pay for her accommodation, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more hair products to sell and also to use for her beauty salon.

Gifty hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to sell and also to invest in her beauty salon

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Joven Luis de  27 años de edad es soltero, trabaja como docente desde hace 11 años en el Ministerio de Educaciòn, vive con su mamà pues aun no formado su propio hogar, es un hombre bien responsable ya que cuida de su madre y la ayuda con los gastos familiares pues son  personas de escasos recursos econòmicos y dependen economicamente de la siembra de raices y tuberculos y del salario que el devenga como maestro.

Està solicitando su 4to crèdito con el cual pretende cambiarle el zinc a la casa que se encuentra en mal estado y asi cuando venga el invierno estar preparado.

Espera seguir siendo beneficiada por AFODENIC ya que es una instituciòn que le otorga  crèditos a personas de escasos recursos econòmicos . su sueño en el futuro es que su familia tengan mucha salud y trabajo para seguir ayudandolos.
texts.en:
Luis, 27, is single and has been employed by the Ministry of Education as a teacher for 11 years. He lives with his mother because he hasn’t formed his own family yet. He is a responsible young man who cares for his mother and helps her with household expenses because they are a low-income family that depends on whatever income they make from farming tubers and root vegetables and his teacher’s salary. He is asking for his 4th loan which he will use to replace the zinc metal roofing on the house because it’s in bad shape and he wants to be prepared for winter. He hopes to continue to receive benefits from AFODENIC because it’s an institution that grants loans to low-income persons. His dream for the future is that his family be very healthy and that he can continue to have employment so that he can continue to help them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace zinc metal roofing.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia D. sells onions and other food supplies and also sells body lotion at Akotokyire. She has received junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter and she supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Afia’s loan will be used to buy more onions and body lotions for sale. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more onions and body lotions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Making and selling cassava flour

loans.name: Jessica Patricia

texts.es:
la sra. Jessica Patricia L. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia Marbely, tiene 1 año de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, Jessica atiende personalmente a sus clientes, al igual ella misma lo administra y durante todo este tiempo se ve que lo ha manejado muy bien,  dicho negocio esta ubicado en la Aldea de Cifuentes Las Trojes carretera principal frente a bodega Cifuentes.                                                                     
En la actualidad, ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para abastecer su negocio, y este negocio día a día va creciendo e igual el numero de clientes. es para eso que utilizara el credito para comprar mercaderia y surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Jessica Patricia L. is a businesswoman, she owns a local store which operates under the name Marbely Store. Jessica has been running the store for 1 year; she attends personally to her customers and manages the store well. The store is located in the village of Cifuentes Las Trojes, on the main road across from Cifuentes winery. Currently, Jessica doesn't have enough working capital to fully stock her business, which is growing day after day with new customers. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, lard, dairy products, sausages and meat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia C. sells vegetables such as garden eggs (eggplant), okro (okra), tomatoes and other food supplies at Akotokyire.

Patricia has been through junior high education. She is married to a petty trader and lives with her son. She helps her husband in educating, clothing and feeding the children.

Patricia’s loan will be used to buy extra vegetables and other food supplies for sale. Her wish is to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Sister

texts.en:
Sister A. sells second-hand clothing at Akotokyire. She moves from house to house selling her goods.  Sister has not received any form of education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. 

Sister has been selling second-hand clothes for about two years now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bales of second-hand clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: to buy bales of second hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama E. is married and has five dependents. She has been through junior high education.  Ama sells vegetables, cassava and plantains at Akotokyire. Her husband is a steel bender.  Ama uses her income to help her husband in the general welfare of the home.  Ama will use the loan to purchase other varieties of vegetables and plantains for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase other varieties of vegetables and plantains for resale

loans.name: Carlos Eddy

texts.es:
El profesor Carlos Edy de 44 años de edad es casado, vive en la colonia Rio Plata en Nueva Guinea,  trabaja como director de la Escuela Vigarmy Flores desde hace 21 años, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian, el mayor en cuarto año, 2 hijos estudian  primer año y la hija mujer en 2do año de secundaria.

Està solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to credito para cambiarle el zinc a la cocina y comprar materiales de construcciòn para contruir una habitaciòn y asi tener mejores condiciones de vida.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus cuatro hijos estudien para que lleguen a ser profesionales y trabajen.
texts.en:
Carlos Edy, 44, is married and lives in Nueva Guinea’s Rio Plata neighborhood. He has been principal of Vigarmy Flores School for 21 years. His four children are all students; the oldest son is in 4th grade, two other sons are in 1st grade and his daughter is in second year of secondary school. He is requesting refinancing of his 6th loan to replace the zinc metal roof on the kitchen and to buy building materials and supplies to build a bedroom for better living conditions. His greatest wish in life is to see all four children become professionals and employed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies and to replace the roof.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Elizabeth (24) y de sus 2 menores hijos, en un barrio ubicado en la selva central peruana. 

Este trabajador hombre se dedica, desde muy joven, a la agricultura y en la actualidad siembra frutos cítricos y plátanos en sus chacras propias. Confiesa que en este tipo de trabajo se debe ser muy cuidadoso para asegurar la buena producción de la siembra y aunque ha tenido varios fracasos en la vida, dice que jamás se debe dejar de trabajar para lograr salir adelante. Es así que cada día se levanta muy temprano para vigilar sus cultivos, generalmente trabaja solo, pero cuando aumenta la producción por diversos factores contrata operarios que le ayudan en la siembra o cosecha. Cuando recoge la cosecha vende toda su producción a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona, quienes le que pagan regulares precios por cada saco de fruta. Además, ya tiene pensado, para más adelante, sembrar en mayor cantidad diversidad de frutas, ya que es un negocio muy rentable.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, también dice que está muy satisfecho con el desempeño de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.

Cristian tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de un terreno pequeño para seguir sembrando en mayor cantidad y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cristian, 30, lives in his own home in the central Peruvian jungle with his wife, Elizabeth, 24, and their two children. This hard-working man has been a farmer since he was very young; he grows citrus fruits and bananas on his own farmlands. He confesses that he must be very careful with this type of work in order to insure a good crop and, despite several failures in his life, he must never stop working in order to get ahead. Every day he rises very early to watch over his crops. He usually works alone but, when production increases for any reason, he hires hands to help him plant or harvest. His harvested crops are sold to area wholesalers who pay the usual prices for each sack of fruit. In addition, his plans for the future are to plant a greater variety of fruit because this is quite a profitable business. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he is very grateful to all the people that made the loan possible so that he can continue working. He also states that he is very satisfied with the work his communal bank does because all the members are responsible with their payments. Cristian is going to use the funds to buy a small lot to add to his farmlands so that he can plant a larger quantity thereby increasing his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Maribel De Jesus

texts.es:
Maribel de Jesus  de 31 años de edad es casada, trabaja como subdirectora de la Escuela Vigarmy Flores con 13 años de experiencia en el sector magisterial, tiene una hija de 11 años de edad en sexto grado de educaciòn primaria, vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea, frente a la Escuela Alfa y Omega  en su propia casa la cual la construido con el apoyo de su esposo con los creditos obtenidos por la instituciòn fianciera y de su trabajo ya que los dos trabajan arduamente para tener una porvenir mejor. 

Esta solicitando su 5to credito con el objetivo de pintar su casa y hacer ciertas reparaciones en ella. 

Maribel es una joven con alto espiritu de superacion, pues està estudiando su ultimo año de su carrera de ciencias de la Educaciòn, su sueño es seguir estudiando y que su hija siga estudiando.
texts.en:
Maribel de Jesus is 31 years old. She is married and is the Assistant Director of the Vigarmy Flores School. She has 13 years of experience in the education sector and an 11 year old daughter who is in 6th grade. She lives in the Nueva Guinea neighborhood across from Alfa and Omega School. She owns her home, which she build with the suppport of her husband and loans from the bank and her work. Both she and her husband work hard for a better future. She is requesting her 5th loan for the purpose of painting and repairing her house. Maribel is young and spirted. She is in the last year of her Education degree and her dream is to continue studying and that her daughter will continue stuyding.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint her house

loans.name: Edubeges

texts.es:
Edubeges tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Inocencio (44), que es agricultor y de sus 4 hijos menores de edad.

Esta laboriosa mujer se dedica a la agricultura, cada día se despierta muy temprano para vigilar sus cultivos, sabe que debe tener dedicación y cuidar muy bien su producción, si quiere cosechar en buena cantidad. Todos sus productos los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes le pagan muy bien por cada saco de frutos cítricos que les ofrece.
A ella le gusta mucho sembrar y cosechar y lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo, juntos se sacrifican a diario en busca del progreso; lo que no le gusta mucho es que cuando los precios de las frutas bajan y no percibe muchas ganancia. 
Siendo una mujer muy emprendedora siempre está en busca de nuevas oportunidades, por lo que para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mayores ganancias.

Es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.

Edubeges tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras para la próxima cosecha, además destinará una parte para el pago de operarios para la limpieza de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Edubeges is 35 years old. She lives in her own home together with her four young children and her husband Inocencio, age 44, who is a farmer. Edubeges is a hardworking woman. Every morning, she wakes very early to care for her crops; she knows that in order to have a good harvest she needs to work with great care and dedication. She sells all her produce to wholesale merchants who pay her very well for each sack of citrus fruit that she offers. Edubeges really likes the work of planting and gathering harvest; her husband helps her with everything. Together, they work very hard every day to make progress. What they don't like is when fruit prices fall, and they aren't able to make much profit. As a very entrepreneurial woman, Edubeges is always looking for new opportunities. In the future, she is planning to plant more so that she could obtain greater income. This is the third loan Edubeges has with MFP, and she is very grateful to all the people who made it possible for her to continue her work. She plans to invest part of the funds into the purchase of manure and fertilizer to prepare her lands for the next harvest; the remaining part will be used to contract workers to clear the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 58 años, casada y madre de 6 hijos, pero solo vive con el último de sus hijos, tiene 15 años y vela por él, en compañía de su esposo viven juntos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años emprendió el negocio de venta de piedras de carbón y desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar, yendo a zonas muy alejadas para abastecerse de este producto. Luego serian vendidos en las fábricas de ladrillo, que son muchos lo que abundan por su localidad. Esta materia prima, sirve para combustible de hornos grandes de condensación, que son muy útiles en estas fábricas. Este negocio le ha dado buenos resultados, por tener mucha demanda el carbón, es así que constantemente compra este material, logrando almacenarlo en el patio de su casa. Ahora su propósito inmediato es comprar en mayor proporción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una camionada de  carbón de piedra.
texts.en:
Antonia is 58 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She lives with her youngest child, who is 15 years old, and cares for him. Together with her husband, they all live together in a house they own. For the past 5 years, she has run a business selling coal. Since starting up, she has not stopped working, and travels great distances in order to obtain her product. The coal is then sold to the brick factories that are plentiful in the area where she lives. This raw material serves as fuel for the large condensation ovens that are common in these factories. This enterprise has given her good results due to the great demand for coal. For this reason, she constantly buys the material and stockpiles it on the porch of her home. Her immediate plan is to buy the coal in greater quantities. This is her second credit with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her loan payments. In addition, she feels this contribution will be very helpful to her in growing her business. She plans to purchase a truckload of coal with the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more coal.

loans.name: Marisol Del Socorro

texts.es:
La joven Marisol de 24 años de edad, es soltera  labora como docente de educaciòn primaria desde hace 10 años, empezando sus labores como alfabetizadora.

Esta solicitando su 4to crèdito  para comprar materiales de construcciòn y asi construir una habitaciòn y asi tener mayor privacidad en el hogar puesto que aun no se ha casado y vive en casa de sus padres. Actualmente Marisol esta culminando su ultimo año en la Universidad en ciencias de la Educaciòn. 

Su sueño es ir mejorando poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y seguir estudiando para ser una profesinal con mucha experiencia y asi ayudar su humilde familia de escasos recursos econòmicos..
texts.en:
The young Marisol is 24 years old, single, and has worked as a primary school teacher for the past 10 years, starting as a reading teacher and moving up from there. She is requesting her 4th loan to buy construction materials in order to build a bedroom. Her goal is to have more privacy, as she is not yet married and lives in her parents’ house. Currently, Marisol is finishing her last year of a Teaching degree at the University. Her dream is to continue improving her standard of living little by little. She wants to become a professional with a great deal of experience, so she can help her humble family with scarce financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to build a bedroom.

loans.name: San Vicente (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco San Vicente lo encontramos en la parroquia Cumbe  siendo el nombre completo de esta localidad  San Luís de Cumbe está ubicada al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Este banco lo integran mujeres emprendedoras que siempre están en busca de una mejor calidad de vida y lo están consiguiendo con su trabajo diario, de lo que se sienten muy orgullosas. Esta ocasión nos acompaña el señor Eulogio Rojas Coordinador de la Regional Azuay junto a  nuestras socias.

La señora  Digna C. es una de nuestras,   vive en su casa propia apenas terminada de construir  en la comunidad  San Vicente con su esposo que trabaja en el área de la construcción  y sus tres hijos de 4,3 1 año,  ella tiene 23 años de edad y se dedica al bordado desde hace ocho años arte que  fue inculcada por su madre,  trabaja sola y en su casa compartiendo con las actividades del hogar por lo que no tiene un horario fijo y depende de los pedidos que tenga,  aparte de este negocio cría cuyes y pollos tanto para el consumo en su casa como para venderlos cuando tiene alguna urgencia económica.

Este es su quinto ciclo con el  banco comunal  y el crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de más cuyes y pollos para incrementar su criadero, su meta es tener un criadero de pollos más grande.

Rosa Alejandrina P. tiene 43 años y es otra de las socias de éste banco, vive con tres de sus cinco hijos pues los dos primeros ya son casados y viven independientes,  su hijo de 18 años trabaja  en la construcción aportando con los gastos del hogar, su hija de 15 le ayuda en casa con el cuidado de los animales y solo su último hijo  estudia en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo vive en el exterior hace once años y les ayuda económicamente y gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio lograron edificar su casa propia.

Se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal gracias a la invitación de una amiga socia de éste banco, con los créditos recibidos compró poco a poco sus  cuyes y  pollos, pero también se dedica al bordado de polleras (vestimenta tradicional) arte que aprendió sola  y por habilidad en la que lleva doce años. Con el  crédito solicitado comprará hilos, tela para confeccionar las polleras.

Tiene como meta llegar a tener un taller más grande para enseñar éste hermoso arte a más mujeres de su localidad.
texts.en:
We find the San Vicente Bank in the town of Cumbe. The full name of this locality is San Luís de Cumbe, and it is located in the southeast part of the city of Cuenca. The majority of residents are dedicated to farming and raising livestock. This bank is comprised of enterprising women who are always in search of a better standard of living. They are managing this through their daily work, which makes them very proud. On this occasion, we are accompanied by Mr. Eulogio Rojas, Regional Coordinator for Azuay, together with our other members. Digna C. is one of our own. She lives in a newly completed home in the San Vicente community, along with her husband who works in construction. They have three children, ages 4, 3 and 1. Digna is 23 years old, and has dedicated herself to embroidery for the past eight years, an art form that she learned from her mother. She works alone from her house, dividing her time between her craft and tending to the household chores. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule, as her work can vary depending on the number of orders she has. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens, both for the family’s consumption and to sell in the event they find themselves in a financial bind. This is the fifth loan cycle for this cooperative bank, and the loan requested would be used to invest in more guinea pigs and chickens as she would like to raise additional animals. Rosa Alejandrina P. is 43 years old, and another member of this bank. She lives with three of her five children, as the two oldest kids are married and living independently. Her 18-year old son works in construction, helping to support the household. Her 15-year old daughter helps her with the house and caring for the animals. Only her youngest is studying at the local school. Her husband has lived abroad for eleven years, helping them out financially. Thanks to their efforts and sacrifice, they managed to build their own home. They are in their fourth cycle with the cooperative bank, thanks to the invitation from a member. With previous loans, she bought some guinea pigs and chickens, but she also dedicates herself to embroidery of traditional garments. She learned this skill on her own, and has been doing it for twelve years. She will use the loan to buy threads and fabric with which to make her garments. Her goal is to have a larger workshop, and to be able to teach this lovely art form to more women in her locality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens, and also thread and fabric to make traditional embroidered garments.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 32 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa  Evy (28) y sus 2 menores hijos.
Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, siembra con la ayuda de su esposa frutos cítricos, plátanos y otras frutas, los que luego de meses de constante trabajo y vigilancia puede llegar a cosechar. Hugo sabe que si brinda el tratamiento adecuado a sus plantaciones, éstas crecerán y podrá recoger una buena producción. Asimismo asegura que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque puede mantener a su familia y brindarles una buena calidad de vida. 
Y como es un hombre muy trabajador, que no se cansa de trabajar honradamente, para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar diversidad de frutas en mayor cantidad para lograr aumentar su producción y así obtener mayores ganancias.
