Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además menciona que su banco comunal viene trabajando adecuadamente y que nadie se atrasa en el pago de sus cuotas.

Hugo tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantas para volver a sembrar, así como fertilizantes y el pago del personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his wife Evy (age 28) and their two dependent children. Since he was a young man, Hugo has been engaged in agriculture. With the help of his wife, he grows citrus fruits, bananas, and other fruits that he harvests after months of constant work and vigilance. Hugo knows that if he provides adequate treatment to his crops, then he is able to increase his production and achieve a good harvest. He also says that he enjoys his work because it allows him to support his family and provide them a good life. As a hardworking man, Hugo does not grow tired of working honestly. In order to get ahead, he plans to diversify his fruit crops in greater quantity so that he can increase his production and generate more earnings.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that he can continue working. Hugo also mentions that his Communal Bank works adequately because no one is behind with their payments. The funds he requested will be invested in the purchase of plants for his new crop, as well as fertilizers. He will also pay for labor to clear his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits plants & fertilizers; pay for labor to clear his fields

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.es:
Laxmi tiene 22 años, vive en la casa de sus padres al lado de su esposo Ronald (25), que es agricultor y de sus 2 hijos menores.

Desde hace 2 años instaló una tienda de venta de repuestos para autos y camiones, algo singular en la zona donde vive (selva central). Pero el tiempo le demostró que era un buen negocio, ya que en poco tiempo ha crecido bastante y ahora puede ofrecer diversidad de repuestos a sus habituales clientes que la buscan ante cualquier problema de sus autos. El trabajo es tranquilo, ya que está ubicado en su casa y mientras lo atiende no descuida la crianza de sus hijos, además como es el único negocio de su tipo por la zona donde vive, las ganancias que le genera son buenas. Así, mientras su esposo siembra frutas, ella se dedica por entero a la venta de los repuestos. A pesar de su juventud Laxmi tiene muchos planes para el futuro, entre ellos ampliar su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de repuestos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además dice que su grupo comunal es uno de los más organizados, pues todos los integrantes son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. 

Laxmi tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de repuestos para abastecer su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laxmi is 22 years old and lives in the home of her parents with her husband Ronald (age 25), who is a farmer, and their two young children.

Two years ago, Laxmi opened a store selling spare parts for cars and trucks. This type of product is unique in the area where she lives (in the central jungle). However, time has proven that hers is a good business because it has grown significantly. She now offers a variety of parts because she has regular customers who come to her whenever they need to fix a problem with their cars. Her work is peaceful because her business is located in her home, which also allows her to look after her children. Her business also generates good revenue because it is the only one of its kind in the area. Meanwhile her husband works as a fruit farmer while she devotes all of her time to her parts business. Despite her young age, Laxmi has many plans for the future, including expanding her business and offering a wider variety of parts.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working. Laxmi says her Communal Bank is one of the most organized groups. In addition, all the members are punctual when submitting their payments. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of a large quantity of spare parts so that she can restock her business and offer better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to increase her inventory

loans.name: Greisly

texts.es:
LA SRA GREISLY ESTA CASADA, VIVE EN CASA DE SU SUEGROS TIENE UN HIJITO QUE TIENE DOS AÑITOS, SU CONYUGE ES CHOFER DE TRUFI (TRANSPORTE URBANO QUE PRESTA SERVICIO A PASAJEROS EN LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA). eLLA VIVE EN SACABA UNA DE LAS PROVINCIAS MAS POBLADAS DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA, DONDE EMPRENDER ABRIO NO HACE MUCHO UNA DE SUS AGENCIAS. 

LA SRA. GREISLY SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO VENDE PRODUCTOS DE USO DOMESTICO EN UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO QUE TIENE EN LA CASA DE SU SUEGRADONDE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMO PAN, ABARROTES ( MACARRONES , ARROZ Y OTROS) , LA SUEGRA TIENE UN PUESTO DE VENTA EN EL MERCADO DE PAPA CANCHA EN EL DISTRITO DE SACABA LO CUAL DE DIO PRESTADO UNA TIENDA A GREISLY PARA QUE PUEDA VENDER ELLA. EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITO ES PARA AUMENTO DE CAPITAL Y PODER SURTIR EL NEGOCIO QUE TIENE. UNO DE LOS DESEOS DE LA SRA. GREISLY ES EL DE COMPRARSE UN TERRENO Y HACER CONSTRUIR SU CASITA, ES UN APERSONA JOVEN TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Greisly is married and lives with her in-laws and 2-year old son. Her spouse is a trufi driver (public transportation driver in Cochabamba city). She lives in Sacaba, one of the most highly populated provinces in Cochabamba, where Emprender recently opened a branch. Greisly sells household products in a neighborhood store, located in her mother-in-law's house. She sells bread and groceries (macaroni, rice, etc.). Her mother-in-law has a market stall in the Papa Cancha market in Sacaba district and lends the store space to Greisly so she can earn income. The loan Greisly is requesting will allow her to supply her business. One of Greisly's hopes is to buy land to build her own house. She is a hardworking, responsible young woman and is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for entrusting her with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Amelia de 44 años de edad es soltera, vive en la colonia la Fonseca, trabaja como docente de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera del municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 14 años, tiene 1 hijo de 24 años de edad.-      
Està solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4to crèdito con el fondo kiva, con el cual piensa comprar materiales de construcciòn para hacer una habitaciòn y asi poco a poco mejor sus condiciones de vida.  

Expresa que con su salario es muy dificil mejorar su casa, pero con los creditos puede hacerlo; su sueño en el futuro es conocer a sus nietecitos y servir a  Dios, tener salud y que su familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Amelia is 44 years old, single, and lives in the Fonseca subdivision. She has been working as a teacher at the Rafaela Herrera School in the city of Nueva Guinea for 14 years. Rosa Amelia has a son who is 24 years old.

She is requesting refinancing through her fourth loan using Kiva funds. She plans to purchase building materials so that she can continue with the construction of her house and gradually improve her living conditions.

Rosa Amelia says it is difficult to make improvements to her home on her salary, but the loans make this a possibility. Her dreams for the future are to get to know her grandchildren, serve God, experience good health, and have her family stay together.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to continue with the construction of her house

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 63 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su hermano, cuñada y sobrinos, en un barrio ubicado en la selva central peruana. Es separado y sus 2 hijos son mayores y ya viven independientemente.

Desde muy joven se dedica al cultivo de frutos cítricos, ya que por esta parte del país es lo que generalmente la tierra produce en grandes cantidades. Trabaja cada día y vigila con mucha dedicación sus plantas, a veces cuando la siembra es baja trabaja solo y cuando la producción se proyecta a crecer contrata peones para que lo ayuden en la cosecha. A Lorenzo le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues es tranquilo y lo mantiene entretenido en busca del progreso. Aunque no tiene a quien mantener, se esmera mucho para salir adelante y obtiene muy buenas ganancias por la venta de sus cítricos. Para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y empezar a sembrar plátanos para variar su producción. 

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además está muy contento con el trabajo de su banco comunal, puesto que está conformado por personas muy responsables en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas.

Lorenzo tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono, fertilizantes y el pago del personal que contratará.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 63 years old and lives in his own home that is near his brother, sister-in-law, and nieces and nephews. He resides in a neighborhood located in the central Peruvian jungle. Lorenzo is separated from his wife and has two adult children who live independently.

He has been growing citrus fruits since he was a young man. This part of the country is generally responsible for growing produce in large quantities. Lorenzo works each day and looks after his crops with great dedication. He sometimes works alone when the work is slow, but when the harvest season arrives, he hires laborers to help with the work. Lorenzo enjoys what he does because the work is peaceful and keeps him entertained as he looks to make progress. Although he does not have anyone else to maintain his farm, he goes to great lengths to get ahead and generate a good income from the sale of his citrus fruits. In the future, he plans to plant a wider variety of crops by introducing bananas to vary his production.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Lorenzo is extremely grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that he can continue working. He is also very happy with the work of his Communal Bank because it consists of people who are responsible in making each of their payments. Lorenzo plans to invest the money he requested in the purchase of compost and fertilizers. He will also pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizer; pay for labor

loans.name: Obo

texts.en: Obo A. sells provisions and disposable spoons and containers at Akotokyire.  Obo has received junior high education.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a petty trader. Obo has been selling provisions for some time now. She helps her husband in the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her dependents' education.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 32 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Robert (34) y sus 5 menores hijos.
Hace 7 años instaló en su casa una tienda de comestibles, pues se había dado cuenta que en la zona por donde vive no existía un negocio similar. Así empezó, y con el tiempo pudo surtir mejor la tienda con toda clase de productos. A ella le gusta mucho atender su negocio porque como está ubicado en su casa no descuida la crianza de sus hijos, ya que son pequeños y no puede salir a trabajar y dejarlos solos. Las ganancias que obtiene son buenas debido a que no tiene competencia. 
Paralelamente a esta actividad, Olinda vende productos de belleza de una marca reconocida y aprovecha cuando hay promociones, para sacar los productos y ofrecerlos en una vitrina especial que tiene en su tienda. Además como es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre se proyecta al futuro, por lo que para más adelante tiene planeado ampliar y mejorar las instalaciones de su local para ofrecer un mejor servicio. 

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. A su vez, dice que el trabajo de su banco comunal marcha muy bien, ya que todos los integrantes trabajan con honestidad. 

Olinda tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer mejor su tienda y seguir ofreciendo lo mejor a sus habituales clientes.
texts.en:
Olinda is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Robert (age 34) and their five young children. Seven years ago, she opened a store in her home where sells groceries. Olinda recognized that this type of business did not exist in the area where she lives. Therefore, she started her business and over time stocked her store with all types of products. She enjoys managing her store because it is in her home and allows her to look after her children since they are still small. Olinda is not able to work outside of the home and leave them alone. Her business generates good revenue because she does not have competition.

At the same time, Olinda sells beauty products of a well-known brand and takes advantages of promotions whenever they are made available. These products are kept in a special display case in her shop. Being a hardworking woman, Olinda always plans for the future. She wants to expand her store and improve the facilities so that she can offer better service.

This is her third loan with MFP. She is extremely grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue to work and make progress. Olinda says the work of her Communal Bank is going very well and all the members are honest. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of a large quantity of merchandise so that she can increase the inventory of her store and continue offering the best products to her regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand the inventory of her store

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Martha es madre de tres hermosos hijos,  vive en el barrio La Fuente, de edad de 33 años, junto con su esposo venden cerdo el cual llevan varios años de vender, lo que ah aumentado a sus ventas hoy en día es la venta de granos básicos en donde desea invertir para mejorar las ganancias, ya que para muchas familias el arroz, frijoles son los alimentos principal. 
Su meta es lograr poco a poco ir aumentando de inventario y lograr a si una pequeña pulpería. De esta manera la venta y compra de cerdos, como su pulpería enfocada a su crecimiento. Con el objetivo de poder dar a sus pequeños lo necesario en educación pero hay que apoyarlos mucho ya que todo esta caro, pues estudian en colegio publico, pero los gastos de vestimenta, zapatos, útiles escolares ha incrementado. Por tal razón quiere aumentar las ventas a si como mejorar la infraestructura de su casa ya que parte es de madera ya vieja, falta repellar paredes, embaldosar todo lo desea hacer para mejor seguridad e higiene de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 33 years old and the mother of three beautiful children. She lives in the neighborhood of La Fuente. Martha and her husband have been selling pork for several years. Now she wants to increase her sales by selling dry goods. Since many families eat rice and beans as the main component of their meals, she believes selling these products will improve her income.

Her goal is to gradually increase her inventory until she is able to establish a small grocery store. Martha will continue to buy and sells pigs, but she will also focus on the growth of her store. With this goal in mind, she wants to provide her young children what they need to obtain an education because everything is expensive. They attend a public school, but the cost of uniforms, shoes, and school supplies have increased. For this reason, she needs to increase her sales and improve the infrastructure of her home because the wood is aging and the walls need repairs. She also wants to tile all the floors so that they will be safer and cleaner for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, oil, and pigs to butcher

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Yolanda (29) y su pequeño hijo.
Este trabajador hombre aprendió desde muy joven las técnicas necesarias para la agricultura, en la actualidad siembra plátanos y frutos cítricos en sus chacras propias. Aunque dice que el trabajo es algo sacrificado, por el cuidado que requiere la siembra, siente que su sacrificio tiene recompensa cuando inicia la venta de su producción a los comerciantes mayoristas, pues le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten mantener a su familia. 
A Roberto le gusta el cultivo de frutas, ya que puede sembrar y cosechar solo y cuando la producción aumenta, contrata operarios que le ayudan en el trabajo. Para más adelante tiene planeado aumentar su producción de frutas y sembrar variedad de ellas.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero del crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además dice que está muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues todos han demostrado ser muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Roberto tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantas de frutas, abono y fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Robert is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his wife Yolanda (age 29) and their young son.

This hardworking gentleman learned at a young age the techniques needed for farming. He currently grows bananas and citrus fruits in his own fields. Although he says the work requires sacrifice in order to care for his crops, Roberto feels the reward is worthwhile when is able to sell his products to the wholesalers and generate a good income to support his family. He enjoys growing fruit because he can plant and harvest by himself. When production increases, he hires laborers to help with the work. In the future, he plans to increase production by planting a variety of fruits.

This is his third loan with MFP. Roberto is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that he can continue working. He says that he is very satisfied with the work of his Communal Bank and that everyone has demonstrated that they are responsible with their payments. Roberto plans to invest the funds he requested in the purchase of fruit plants, compost, and fertilizers to maintain his land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit plants, compost, and fertilizer

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Esperanza inicia su ciclo 22  con 23 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comidas, cosméticos, ropa, golosinas, abarrotes en general, verduras, cereales, leña y animales menores.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Marcelina que es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, Marcelina es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda en su C. en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, negocio que inicio hace pocos meses y sus ventas están mejorando, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, aceite, azúcar. Los sueños D. Marcelina son surtir su negocio, comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios en la universidad.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles haciendo un total D. 12,600 soles.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Esperanza” (Hope) is starting its 22nd loan cycle with 23 members. They are engaged in different businesses selling food, cosmetics, clothing, candy, groceries, vegetables, grains, firewood, and small animals.

Such is the case with Sra. Marcelina, who serves as the Communal Bank President. She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Marcelina has a store in her home where she sells groceries. She started this business a few months ago and her sales have been improving. Marcelina's loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, oil, and sugar. Her dreams are to restock her business, purchase a car for her husband to use for work, and see her children finish their studies through university.

The members needed different loan amounts ranging from 300 PEN, 450 PEN, 600 PEN, to 1050 PEN, for a grand total of 12,600 PEN to the entire Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase his inventory

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: EL SR. WALTER ESTA CASADO Y TIENE 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, NO TINE DOMICILIO PROPIO, POR TAL MOTIVO SE HA COMPRADO UN LOTE PARA CONSTRUIR, Y FORMAR SU HOGAR, Y ASI NO ESTAR VIVIENDO EN LA CASA DE SUS PADRES, SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA A LABORES DEL HOGAR, SU ACTIVIDAD ES EL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS EN LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ- EL TORNO; EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE ALAMBRE Y CERCAR SU LOTE; SU DESEO ES PODER CONSTRUIR SU CASA Y PODER HABITARLA CON TODA SU FAMILIA, ES MUY TRABAJADOR YA QUE SOLO MANTIENE EL HOGAR Y CON LA COMPRA DE SU LOTE SE PUSIERON EN APRETURAS Y TIENE QUE LIMITARSE EN LOS GASTOS,  SE SIENTE AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL  CREDITO.
texts.en:
Walter is married and has 2 young children. He lives in the town of Torno, 40km from Santa Cruz city. He doesn't own his own house. He has bought a lot to construct his own home so that he can move out of his parents' house. Walter's wife takes care of the house and he works as a taxi driver in Santa Cruz city. The loan is for barbwire to surround his lot. Walter hopes to build his house soon for his family. He is very hardworking and supports his family by himself. Now that he has purchased the land he has to limit his expenses. Walter is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for entrusting him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of barbwire

loans.name: Bissimilai Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Bissimilai” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan SLL 2,400,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

Forty-year-old Fadima K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of the group. She was born in Waterloo, is married to a businessman, and has four children. One of her children is in senior secondary school II and the others are no longer attending school. Fadima has been a businesswoman for more than ten years now. She sells ready-to-wear clothes for both men and women. With her share of this loan (SLL 1,000,000), she will expand her business by buying bales of ready-to-wear clothes for both men and women.

loans.use: Buy bales of ready-to-wear clothes for both men and women

loans.name: Believe Usef Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Believe Usef II” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,500,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

Thirty-eight-year-old Adama K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of the group. She was born in Waterloo, is married to a soldier, and they have four children – one of her children is in senior secondary school II, one in JSS I, one in class V and the last is in nursery school. Adama has been a businesswoman for more than twenty years now. She sells dried fish. With her share of this loan (SLL 500,000), she will expand her business by buying basketsfull of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her current stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Na We Yone Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Na We Yone” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of 2,400,000 leones from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses.

Kadiatu S., 28 years old and pictured on the left, is the leader of the group. Kadiatu was born in Magburaka town in Northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a building contractor and they have four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for more than ten years now. She sells market food such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), magi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, garden eggs (eggplant), etc. With this loan, she will travel to a periodic market center in Kono, and buy the above goods wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, magi, pepper, garden eggs, etc.

loans.name: Go Try Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Go Try” group from the small-town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking for a loan SLL 3,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

M’balu K., 41, pictured in the middle, is the leader of the group. M’balu was born in a place call Masimgbi. She is married to a businessman and they have five children. M’balu has been a businesswoman for more than five years now. She owns a small kiosk where she sells provisions: milk, Ovaltine, sugar, butter, rum, canned drinks, etc. With this loan, M’balu will buy these items wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy milk, Ovaltine, sugar, butter, rum, canned drinks, etc.

loans.name: Lane Kuru Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Lane Kuru”, a Temne phrase meaning “Believe in God”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the first loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 leones for each member of the group. 

Their leader, 35-year-old Fatmata M. (pictured in the middle), sells "Yoruba market". This includes a variety of assorted little stuffs first introduced and sold in Sierra Leone by the Yorubas from Nigeria. To name a few in English, they include spoons, knives, thread, rings, bracelets, “madoni cream”, etc. Fatmata was born in a place called Ribi. She is married to a businessman and they have five children and one foster child. Fatmata has been in her business for nearly 20 years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying “Yoruba items” in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy spoons, knives, thread, rings, bracelets, “madoni cream”, etc.

loans.name: Trust We Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Trust We”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the second loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. The previous loan created significant impact in the lives and businesses of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid that loan successfully, they are again seeking a new loan of SLL 2,600,000 for the entire group in order to further improve their businesses.   

Their leader, 32-year-old Mamusu B. (pictured left), sells fried foods such as fried meat, fish, chicken and eggs with bread and stew. She will invest her share of the loan in her fried food business by buying ingredients like mayonnaise, tomato ketchup, oil, eggs, onions, pepper, etc. at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy mayonnaise, tomato ketchup, oil, eggs, onions, pepper, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Sorbeh Kargbo Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Sorbeh K.”, after the surname of the group’s leader. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the first loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods ito their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. Thus, they are requesting a loan of SLL 2,100,000 in order to further strengthen their businesses. 

Their leader, 40-year-old Alie K. (pictured in the left), sells rice, groundnuts/peanuts, drinks and water at wholesale. He was born in Koya, about 38 miles from Waterloo. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children.  Alie K. has been a businessman since his childhood days. With his share of the loan (SLL 500,000), he will expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items to add to his stock.

loans.use: To buy rice, groundnuts/peanuts, drinks and water

loans.name: Gambi Club Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Gambi Club”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.  This will be their first Kiva loan through SMT.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. Therefore, they are requesting a loan of SLL 2,400,000 for the entire group in order to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Their leader is 21-year-old Konnie G. (pictured second from left) who has been selling cold water and drinks for three years now. Konnie will use her share of the loan to buy bundles of plastic water and crates of drinks to add to her business.  This entrepreneur was born in Four-Mile village, which is four miles away from Waterloo. She is married to a businessman and they have two children who are still not of school-going age.

loans.use: To buy water and crates of drinks

loans.name: God Bless Ii Group

texts.en:
This group is named “God Bless II”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.  This will be their first Kiva loan through SMT.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. Therefore, they are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group in order to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Their leader is 36-year-old Kadiatu K. (pictured left). She has been selling pepper for over 20 years now. Kadiatu is currently trading with three bags of pepper. But with the help of the loan, she will be able to add two more bags of pepper to her business.  Kadiatu was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a police officer and they have three children who are attending secondary, primary and nursery schools respectively.

loans.use: to buy two more bags of pepper

loans.name: Rakia Tieku Brefo

texts.en: Rakia T. B. is married and has four children. She has been through junior high school. Rakia sells different types of biscuits, toffees, drinks and other sweet and savory snacks at Akotokyire. Her husband is an architect. Rakia uses the profits she gets from her sales to sustain the family. Rakia will use the loan to purchase more goods to sell. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Rakia plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: Rakia will use the loan to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Lily Jovanna

texts.es:
Lily tiene 25 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a su esposo y su familia en el sector Santa Rosa del distrito de Olmos, una zona caracterizada por tener a la mayoria de su población dispersa en areas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y queda ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis meses a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, ella nos comenta que la idea del negocio surgió de la necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso que ayude a su familia a salir adelante, actualmente la bodega constituye una importante ayuda económica para su familia, por lo que ella trata de mantenerla ofreciendo productos de calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes.

Sus esfuerzos están empezando a tener resultados y su clientela ha ido aumentando en las ultimas semanas, tal situación ha hecho que ella considere ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a logar su objetivo.

Lily es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre lucha por sacar adelante a su joven familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacerse mas conocida en la zona. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer alegre y responsable.
texts.en:
Lily is 25 years old and currently lives with her husband and family in the Santa Rosa sector of the District of Olmos, a rural area where most of the population is scattered and lives far apart from one another. This area is part of Lambayeque Province and an hour and forty-five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past six months, Lily has been selling groceries and basic necessities out of a store in her home. She says the idea for this business arose from the need to provide her family with an income to help them get ahead. Her store currently provides important financial support for her family, so she tries to keep offering quality products and good service to her customers.

Her efforts in starting this business have resulted in an increase in customers within the past few weeks. This situation has made Lily consider increasing her business by purchasing more products. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN in order achieve this goal.

Lily is a hardworking woman who always strives to succeed on behalf of her young family. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she becomes well-known in the area. Lily’s neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a cheerful and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nueva Ilusion Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión inicia su quinto ciclo con 17 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, ropa, artesanía, alfalfa, chatarra y comida. 
Como es el caso D. la Señora Rosa que es presidenta del Banco Comunal, Rosa es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Rosa compra y venD. artesanías ayacuchanas en las ferias artesanales D. la ciudad D. Huancayo, y tiene proyectado participar en las ferias D. la ciudad D. Lima, Además Rosa realiza tejidos D. bufandas, gorros que también venD. en las ferias. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. lana D. diversos colores. Los sueños D. Rosa son ampliar su negocio, vender sus productos en el extranjero, aprender a realizar tejidos en telar y tener una polleria.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles haciendo un total D. 10,300 soles.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Ilusion is starting its fifth loan cycle with 17 members. The members operate various businesses, in which they sell groceries, clothing, handicrafts, alfalfa, cheap goods, and food. Such is the case of Rosa, who is the president of the communal bank. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. She buys and sells handicrafts at fairs in the city of Huancayo, and she also plans to participate in the fairs in Lima. Furthermore, Rosa knits scarves and hats that she also sells at the fairs. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of various colors of wool. Her dreams are to expand her business, sell her products abroad, learn to weave using a loom, and to have a poultry store. The members are requesting different sums of money, such as 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, and 750 soles, adding up to a total of 10,300 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various colors of wool

loans.name: Dora Judith

texts.es:
la sra. Dora Judith C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular y granos básicos, tiene diez años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio. Dora atiende personalmente por lo tanto es bien administrado y durante todo este tiempo se ve que lo ha manejado muy bien,  dicho negocio esta ubicado en el desvió de la calle que conduce a Planes, Las Trojes. este lugar es bien transitado por los Alumnos que se dirigen a la escuela que se encuentra a escasos metros de su negocio.  
Es una persona muy reconocida en la Aldea y se ha sabido ganar la clientela lo que le a generado mayor demanda de los productos que ella vende en su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y surtir su pulperia, la ganancias que obtenga las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora Judith C. makes a living by selling common goods and basic grains, which she has done for ten years. She attends to her store personally, for which it is well run. It is easy to see that during this whole time she has managed it very well. Her business is located on a detour off the street that leads to Planes, Las Trojes. This place is well traveled by students as they make their way to school, which is very close to her business. Dora is a very well known person in her town, and she knows how to earn her clientele, which has generated a greater demand for the products that she sells. She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her store, and thereby earn more income to cover her domestic expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, soft drinks, dairy products, butter, sugar, coffee, tortillas, bread, pills, toilet paper, sanitary wipes, cookies, soup, and pasta

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy C. A. sells rechargeable units for mobile phones at Akotokyire. Lucy has received a senior high education.  She is a single parent with one child. Lucy has been selling mobile phone rechargeable units for not very long. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more units cards for all the mobile phone networks to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy more cards to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rechargeable units cards to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Making and selling cassava flour

loans.name: Good Family Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Good Family” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,600,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

48-year-old Musu M. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of the group. She was born in Waterloo and is a widow with six children. One of her children is in class IV and the rest are in college. She has been a businesswoman for more than 20 years now. Musu owns a bar where she sells both soft and hard drinks. In her bar, she also sells provisions: luncheon meat, baked meat, peak milk, sardine, etc. Musu will use this loan to further expand on this business by buying drinks such as Star beer (a popular local brand), stout, Heineken, Codys, Carlsberg, etc.

loans.use: To buy drinks such as Star beer, stout, Heineken, Codys, Carlsberg, etc.

loans.name: Dosmila

texts.es: Dosmila tiene 40 años, casada y madre de 3 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja, mercadería que se abastece de su propia granja de abejas que tiene en el patio de su casa. Es así que su actividad empieza viajando a otras ciudades para vender su producto. Además, cada quincena se dedica a la venta de animales como: cuyes, ovejas y pollos, en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Esta actividad, por lo general lo realiza sola, hay ocasiones en que recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, que la ayudan en el transporte de su mercadería. A lo largo de estos años, Dosmila ha visto las ventajas de  generarse ingresos de manera independiente, y por lo que continuará trabajando para así poder incrementar su capital. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, asimismo considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de miel de abeja al por mayor y también de animales como ovejas.
texts.en:
Dosmila is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. They live together in their own house. For the last 10 years she has made a living by selling honey, which is supplied by her own bee farms that she keeps on the patio of her house. She has managed to begin traveling to other cities to sell her product. Furthermore, every two weeks she sells animals, such as guinea pigs, sheep, and chickens, at the livestock fairs in her town. In general, she carries out these activities by herself, but occasionally her sons help her transport the merchandise. Throughout the years, Dosmila has seen the advantages of generating income independently, and therefore will continue working this way to increase her capital. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. Likewise, she believes that this credit will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will invest in the purchase of wholesale honey and also animals, such as sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase honey and sheep

loans.name: Bessy Carolina

texts.es:
la sra. Bessy Carolina C. cuenta con una Pulpería denominada pulperia "Vanesa" ubicada en la Colonia Gracias a Dios de la Ciudad de Danlí, tiene 1 año de realizar esta actividad económica lo que le hace tener experiencia en el manejo de su negocio. Bessy es una persona muy conocida en el lugar por su espíritu de superación, solvencia moral y de buena conducta, se ha sabido ganar la clientela lo que le ha generado mayor demanda de sus productos ya que las ventas las realiza de forma de contado y al crédito generándole de esta forma clientela permanente en todo el año.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia.
texts.en:
Bessy has a general store called "Vanesa." It's located in "Colonia Gracias a Dios" in the city of Danlí. She's been doing this for a year, which has given her experience in running a business. Bessy is very well known for her high spirits, honesty, and good conduct. She has learned how to win customers and has created great demand for her products by offering both cash and credit sales. She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise to be able to offer a greater variety in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua B. is married and has four children. She has received a junior high education.  Efua goes to Techiman to buy bags of maize to sell at Akotokyire. Her husband is a cleaner.  Efua uses her income to help her husband to sustain the family. Efua will add the loan to her initial capital to buy more bags of maize to resell to her demanding customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Mariscal Sucre Group

texts.es:
La alcancía Mariscal Sucre  está integrada por 11 socios, actualmente  asume el cargo de presidenta la señora  Marta L., quien es casada y tiene 6 hijos, trabaja con  Edaprospo desde hace 3 años y ocho meses
Ella en su pequeño terreno donde habita, se inicio con la crianza y venta de aves (gallinas, patos), su primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de alimentos balanceados. Posteriormente logra abrir una pequeña Bodega con 5 cajas de cervezas 5 cajas de gaseosas, y poca cantidad de golosinas y abarrotes, al transcurrir el tiempo y viendo la mejoría de su negocio  fue adquiriendo más productos y también la  mejoría en la infraestructura de su vivienda.
A pesar del mal de diabetes  que padece,  sigue adelante  esforzándose cada día más. 
Su actual préstamo lo invertirá  en la compra de mercadería (abarrotes, golosinas) y otros para surtir su bodega 
Marta anhela comprarse un auto para poder trasladar su mercadería del punto donde lo compra para su casa, y sobre todo en apoyar a su hija a de 15 años de edad  en sus estudios secundarios y superiores.
texts.en:
The Mariscal Sucre communal bank is made up of 11 members. Currently holding the position of president is Marta L., who is married and has 6 children. She has worked with Edaprospo for 3 years and eight months. On the small plot of land where she lives, she began by raising and selling birds (hens and ducks). She invested her first loan in buying balanced feed. Later, she was able to open a small store with 5 cases of beer, 5 cases of soft drinks, and a small quantity of snacks and groceries. As time passed and her business grew, she acquired more products and also improved the infrastructure of her home. Despite the fact that she suffers from diabetes, she continues to get ahead by increasing her efforts each day. Her current loan will be invested in buying merchandise (groceries and snacks) and other items to stock her store. Marta's desire for the future is to buy a car so that she can transport her merchandise from the point of sale to her home, and above all to support her 15-year-old daughter in her secondary and university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a larger quantity of groceries for her store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. is married and has five dependants. She has been through junior high school.  Ama cooks banku to sell at Akotokyire. Her husband is a bookkeeper.  Ama uses the earnings she generates from her sales to help her husband with the general welfare of the home.  Ama will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to make banku and kenkey, which she will serve as an additional trade to invest in. With the new profits from her extended business, Ama plans to save to further for her children’s education.

At the time the picture was taken, she was not preparing banku but was asked to demonstrate how it is prepared.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to make banku and kenkey

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: el sr. Bernardino S. se dedica a dar el servicio de moler maiz y tambien vende leña, cuenta con un molino. Tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y se ve que le ha ido muy bien, ya que con los ingresos de su negocio suple las necesidades de su familia. El no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para realizar mantenimiento y cambio de piezas de su molino. el credito lo utilzara para comprar los repuestos y asi poder darle un buen mantenimiento a su molino y de esta manera brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bernardino provides corn grinding services and also sells firewood. He has one grinder, and has been doing this for four years. Things have been going well for him and he is able to provide for his family with the income from this activity, but he does not have the necessary working capital to be able to provide maintenance and spare parts for his grinder. He will use the money from this loan to buy the necessary spare parts and be able to maintain his grinder. In this way, he will be able to better serve his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edwin Wilder

texts.es:
Edwin forma parte del banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”, tiene 27 años y es soltero. Edwin estudia la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco y está cursando el último semestre. Edwin nos cuenta que con tres compañeros de la universidad abrieron un taller mecánico llamado “CRIVERSA” donde brindan servicios de diseño automotriz de estructuras metálicas y muchas cosas más. Ya son tres años que se dedica a brindar el servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Edwin es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyor a su familia, el requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina soldadora, accesorios de computadora y software actualizado. El anhelo del socio es estudiar una maestría en el país de Alemania. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, el socio manifiesta, que se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro, capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Edwin is a part of the “Los Diamantes” communal bank. He is 27 years old and single. Edwin is studying for a professional career as a mechanical engineer at “Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco” and he is in his final semester. Edwin tells us that he and three other fellow students opened a mechanics shop called “Criversa,” where they provide automotive structural design services for metal components and other things. He has been doing this for three years and things are going well, thanks to the emphasis he places on his work. Edwin is a hard working and enterprising young man, constantly searching for opportunities to get ahead and help his family. He needs this loan in order to buy a welding machine, computer accessories, and software. He hopes to one day do an apprenticeship in Germany. The communal bank has been functioning for ten cycles. [Edwin] tells us that he is happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, and capabilities provided during the communal bank’s existence. He is grateful for the opportunity and promises to repay on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools and equipment

loans.name: Silvia Marleni

texts.es:
Silvia es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hija de 12 años de edad en el distrito de Pacasmayo, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicado en la región La Libertad, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace mas de diez años trabaja comercializando prendas de vestir y calzado por pedidos. Ella adquiere su mercadería en las ciudades de Lima y Trujillo para luego ofrecérselas a sus clientes. Este negocio le ha permitido solventar los gastos familiares junto a su esposo durante el tiempo que llevan viviendo juntos, actualmente ellos se encuentran trabajando juntos para construir su casa propia, por lo que ambos dan lo mejor de si en sus respectivas actividades para lograr su objetivo.

Silvia desea ampliar su negocio para poder satisfacer la creciente demanda que viene experimentando su negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas mercadería.

Ella es una mujer emprendedora y bastante responsable, siempre da lo mejor de si en su trabajo para poder sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver su casa terminada y poder mudarse alli para pasar agradables momentos con su familia
texts.en:
Silvia is a 34 year old mother. She lives with her husband and 12 year old daughter in the Pacasmayo district, located in the province with the same name, which is itself located in the La Libertad region, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than ten years, she has been selling articles of clothing and shoes through customer orders. She acquires her merchandise in the cities of Lima and Trujillo in order to later be able to offer it to her customers. This business has allowed her and her husband to pay their family expenses, during the time they have been together. They are now working together to build their own home. They each give their best to their respective activities. Silvia wants to expand her business in order to satisfy the growing demand that she has been experiencing. It is because of this that she has seen the need to request her first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) that she will invest in more merchandise. She is a responsible, enterprising woman who always gives her best to her work in order to move her family ahead. Her greatest desire is to see her house completed and be able to move in so that she can spent some nice moments there with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba M. prepares kenkey for sale at Akotokyire.  Araba has received a senior high education.  She is married to a driver and has four children. Araba has been selling kenkey for some time now. She helps her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare kenkey

loans.name: Las Sabrositas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Sabrositas” esta representado por la señora Verónica Beatriz y conformado por 10 miembros caracterizados por ser muy trabajadores, unidos y muy solidarios, todos se conocen ya que residen en la misma zona y confían plenamente en sus integrantes. La señora Verónica Beatriz se dedica a la venta D. dulces y comida rápida en el snack del colegio 6 D. Junio, ella también trabaja como portera del mismo colegio y aprovecha para vender sus productos, ella resiD. en el mismo colegio y desea poder ampliar su pequeño negocio con la compra D. sillas y mesas para su snack esta es la razón por la que desea el crédito, su mayor anhelo es poder darles a sus hijos una casa propia para poder crecer y vivir mejor.   El resto del grupo se dedica a la venta D. frutas, venta D. refrescos, flores, bebidas y al transporte público d pasajeros ya sea como propietario D. sus vehículos o solo como chóferes y otro D. los socios se dedica al alquiler D. mesas D. futbolín. Todos los integrantes del grupo tienen mucha experiencia en su rubro por lo que la competencia no es un factor que les impida generar ingresos. El crédito será destinado a la compra D. mercadería, reparación D. sus vehículos, pagos D. deudas y para la compra y refacción D. algunas mesas D. futbolines. El grupo va cursando su primer ciclo pero el grupo ya tiene experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que saben como administrar sus fondos y ser un grupo responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
The “Las Sabrositas” group is represented by Verónica Beatriz and maD. up of 10 members who can be described as very hardworking, tight-knit and close; they all know one another since they live in the same area and have complete trust in each other. Verónica Beatriz sells sweets and fast food in the snack bar of the 6 D. Junio school. She also works as a schoolkeeper and uses it as an opportunity to sell her products. She lives at the school and wants to expand her small business with the purchase of chairs and tables for her snack bar. This is why she would like the loan. Her greatest wish is to be able to give her children a house of their own in order to grow and live better. The rest of the group works at selling fruit, soft drinks, flowers, drinks and providing public transportation of passengers as an owner of one's own vehicles or as chauffeurs and another of the members works at renting table football tables. All the group members have a lot of experience in their work so competence is not a factor that prevents them from generating income. The loan will be put toward the purchase of merchandise, vehicle repair, payment of debts and for the purchase and refurbishment of table football tables. The group is in their first cycle but already has experience with solidarity groups, which is why they know how to administer their funds and be a responsible group with their commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina E. A. is married and has four children. E. smokes fish to sell at Akotokyire. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a mason. Angelina uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of their home. Angelina will use this loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Angelina plans to further her children’s education. What you see behind her is a locally made oven designed for the processing (smoking) of the fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marvin De Jesús

texts.es: Este cliente es originaria del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para compra de materiales para construir su casita tales como: puertas, laminas de zinc, bolsas de cemento, ya que por falta de financiamiento no ha podido reforzarlo. Agradece ya que con la ayuda su familia va a tener una casita donde vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Este cliente es originaria del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para compra de materiales para construir su casita tales como: puertas, laminas de zinc, bolsas de cemento, ya que por falta de financiamiento no ha podido reforzarlo. Agradece ya que con la ayuda su familia va a tener una casita donde vivir dignamente.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de materialez

loans.name: Intachables Group

texts.es: El gripo “Intachables” esta representado por la Señora Yovana Vanesa y conformado por 11 miembros muy unidos que se conocen desD. hace ya varios años son bien organizados y muy responsables, algunas son madres solteras pero saben como salir adelante para sacar a flote a sus familias. La señora Yovana Vanesa es madre soltera tiene dos niños en edad escolar, vive en la casa D. sus madre quien es viuda y ambas se hacen compañía para salir adelante, la señora Yovana Vanesa se dedica a la venta D. refrescos a orillas del río Pirai el cual es muy concurrido en especial los fines D. semana que es donD. sus ventas se elevan, ella destinar el crédito para poder comprar una caseta cerca D. su actual trabajo para no perder su clientela y poder ampliar su mercadería haciendo emparedados y hamburguesas,  su mayor expectativa es poder agrandar la casa D. sus mama para darles a sus hijos y a su madre mayor comodidad. El resto D. las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades algunas venden comida en le río Pirai, otras son promotoras D. cosméticos, otras venden ropa y frutas. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a que ya cuentan con clientes fieles que demandan sus productos. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y la ampliación D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercadería e insumos para mejorar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. La socias ya van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando puntualidad y ganas D. salir adelante por el bien estar D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Intachables” group is represented by Yovana Vanesa and maD. up of 11 very close members who have known each other for several years. They are well-organized and very responsible. Some are single mothers, but they know how to succeed in order to proviD. for their families. Yovana Vanesa is a single mother who has two school-age children. She lives in the house of her widow mother, and they proviD. each other with companionship in order to get ahead. Yovana Vanesa sells soft drinks on the banks of the Pirai River, which is very crowded, especially on the weekends when sales are up. She will put the loan toward buying a tent near her place of work in order not to lose clientele and be able to diversify her merchandise by making sandwiches and hamburgers. Her principal goal is to be able to extend her mother's house in order to give her children and mother greater comfort. The rest of the members work at different activities. Some sell food by the Pirai River, others promote cosmetics and still others sell clothing and fruit. As in all commercial business, there is always competition for supply and demand, but the members know how to get ahead thanks to the fact that they already rely on faithful customers who demand their products. This loan will be put toward the diversification of products and the expansion of their businesses with the purchase of merchandise and supplies to improve their sales and income. The members are already in their second cycle with the institution and have demonstrated timeliness and the desire to get ahead for their families' well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa H. sells crates of eggs. She also prepares tea with fried eggs and bread in the evenings in Akotokyire. Adjoa has received senior high education. She is a single parent with two children. Adjoa has been selling eggs and making tea to sell for some time now. She is responsible for educating and feeding her family. Her loan will be used to buy more eggs to be able to supply other people. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save for a piece of land to build a house on.

loans.use: To buy eggs

loans.name: Cruceñas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Cruceñas" esta representado por la señora Daniela y conformado por 11 miembros todas mujeres trabajadoras, unidas y muy responsables como lo han demostrado en sus anteriores ciclos, todas residen en la misma zona de y se conocen muy bien. La señora Daniela se dedica a la venta de ropa en el M. ella es casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar su esposo es chofer y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, la destinara el crédito para la compra de mercadería la cual trae desde Chile para que sea abajo precio y de buena calidad, ella ya tiene sus clientas que  demandan sus productos por ser de muy buena calidad. El resto de las socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, comida en el barrio en pequeñas pensiones, otras venden ropa de forma ambulante y empanadas. La competencia es muy dura en estos días pero las socias saben como salir delante de cualquier adversidad gracias  a us experiencia y a sus ganas de salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo, con la compra de mercadería, insumos y para el mejoramiento de ambientes de trabajo como las dedicadas a la venta en pensiones que requieren el crédito para la ampliación de sus pensiones.
texts.en:
The members of the Cruceñas Communal Bank are represented by Daniela. The group is comprised of 11 members. All of them are hard-working women who are united and very responsible, as they have demonstrated in their previous cycles. All of them live in the same area, and they know each other very well. Daniela sells clothes in the market. She is married and has two school age children. Her husband is a driver, and he helps her with the household expenses. The loan is to buy merchandise, which she brings from Chile in order to get a low price and good quality. She has her customers who demand that her products be of very good quality. The rest of the members sell cosmetics or food in the neighborhood in small boarding house. Others sell clothes as street vendors, and some sell empanadas. The competition is very hard these days. But, the members know how to get ahead in front of any adversity thanks to their experience and their desire to get ahead. The support of their families depends on their businesses. The loan is for working capital to buy merchandise and supplies to improve their work environments. For example, the members who sell food in boarding houses need the loan to expand their boarding houses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa B. sells a variety of soaps in Akotokyire moving from one customer to the next. Yaa has been through senior high school. She is married and has four children. She helps her husband take care of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more and different varieties of soap to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more soaps

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en: Auntie T. is a fish monger in Akotokyire. She goes to the nearby seashore to buy fish from the fishermen to smoke and then to sell. Auntie has been educated up to the senior high level. She is married to an office clerk and has five dependants. She provides a helping hand to her husband for the general welfare of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process (smoke) for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process (smoke) for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. bakes bread to sell in Akotokyire. She sells her bread with margarine and groundnut paste (peanut butter). Esi has received junior high education. She is married and has four children. Esi has been baking bread for about two years now. As part of her responsibilities, she helps her husband with the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to bake bread in larger quantities for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in baking extra foods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake bread

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana E. sells provisions and foodstuffs in Akotokyire. Nana has been through senior high school. She is married and lives with her six dependants. Her husband is a foreman. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to save the new earnings from her business to build a kiosk for it.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail A. sells vegetables such as okra, garden eggs (African eggplant), and fresh pepper at Akotokyire.  Abigail has been educated up to junior high level.  She is married and has three wonderful children. Her husband is a mason. She uses the income she generates from her sales to help her husband in provide food, clothing and shelter for her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene un micro en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa, y trabaja como chofer de transporte de pasajeros. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa Victoria de la ciudad de la Paz en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital inversión (compra de llantas y reparación de vehiculo ).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus condiciones laborales, y las condiciones de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Jaime has a “micro” (a medium-sized bus commonly used for public transportation) in the Eduardo Avaroa syndicate, and works as a driver transporting passengers. He lives in his parents’ home, located in the Villa Victoria section of the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be destined for a capital investment in his business (to purchase tires and repairs for the bus). This is the second time he requests a loan with Impro, and this credit will allow him to improve his work conditions and his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires and repairs for his passenger bus.

loans.name: Gaviotas Dos Group

texts.es: El banco “Gaviotas Dos” esta representado por la señora Maria del Carmen y conformado por 10 miembros de los cuales 8 son mujeres y dos son varones, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre. La señora Maria del Carmen es madre soltera ella es propietaria de  dos vehículos de transporte publico  (minibuses) los cuales hace trabajar con chóferes los cuales le entregan una renta diaria, ella vive en una pequeña casita que es de su propiedad ya hace 20 años, ella requiere el crédito para la refacción de sus vehículos con la compra de algunos repuestos ya que si sus vehículos paran de trabajar por auxilio mecánico ella no cuenta con el dinero de ese día de renta y como no tiene otros ingresos desea poder realizar las reparaciones lo mas antes posible, sus mayor expectativa es poder ampliar su casa para poder darle mayor comodidad a su hijo que se encuentra estudiando. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades como la venta de ropa, venta y confección de edredones, venta de cosméticos por catálogos, venta y confección de chamarras y al transporte publico de pasajeros. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias donde venden sus productos y por tanto la competencia en su mercado es indiferente. El crédito será destinado a la compra de mercadería, a la reparación de sus vehículos y a la compra de materia prima para la elaboración sus edredones y demás productos. El grupo ya van cursando juntos un quinto ciclo demostrando crecimiento en sus negocios y bastantes expectativas de poder cumplir con sus sueños de construcción de viviendas y compras de lotes y herramientas de trabajo para ayudar en sus negocios  todo esto con el apoyo  económico brindado y la confianza que les ofrece la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen represents the Gaviotas Dos Communal Bank. The bank is comprised of ten members, eight women and two men. This bank is characterized as being very united and happy. Maria del Carmen is a single mother. She has two vehicles (mini-buses) used for public transportation. Drivers work with the vehicles, and they give her daily rent. She lives in a small house that she has owned for 20 years. She needs the loan for upkeep of her vehicles. She will buy some replacement parts. If her vehicles stop working because they need mechanical help, she does not get the rent money that day. As she does not have other income, she wants to make the repairs as quickly as possible. Her biggest hope is to be able to expand her house in order to make her son, a student, more comfortable. The rest of the group is involved in different activities like selling clothes, making and selling comforters, selling cosmetics by catalog, making and selling jackets, or public passenger transportation. Generally, the group has plenty of experience in the businesses the have. That is the reason they are well known in the fairs where they sell their products, and the competition in the market is not important. The loan is to buy merchandise, repair their vehicles, and to buy raw material to make comforters and the rest of the products. The group is in their fifth cycle together. They are demonstrating growth in their businesses. They have expectations of being able to fulfill their dreams of building houses, buying lots, and buying work tools to help in their businesses. All of this is with the economic help and the trust that the Fundación Agrocapital offers them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Yudelka

texts.en:
Yudelka is an individual loan client with Esperanza. Her story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). In El Seybo, where she is located, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure here, as a single mother with her child.

Yudelka is excited to be taking her seventh total loan and third individual loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business raising livestock by purchasing two cows which she will use to produce milk and eventually meat. She will use the profits to save towards the purchase of more land to continue to expand her farm, as well as provide for the needs of her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Xenia Sulay

texts.es:
la sra. Xenia Sulay se dedica al comercio, vende ropa interior de la conocida y prestigiada línea LOVABLE, actividad que tiene de realizar desde hace mas de un año y la realiza de manera ambulante siendo sus mejores clientes las maestras de los diferentes centros educativos, empleadas de oficinas y empleados  de las diferentes manufactureras de tabacos existentes en la ciudad de Danlí y El Paraíso.
las ventas las realiza de contado y créditos lo que le permite tener clientela todo el año, me comentaba que a pesar de que estas prendas interiores son mas caras que las demás siempre se venden ya que son mucho mas duraderas y de mayor calidad, que hasta los varones muchas veces las compran para hacerle regalos a su pareja.
el credito lo utilizara en comprar mas ropa interior.
texts.en:
Xenia Sulay dedicates herself to commerce, selling undergarments from the well-known and popular line called LOVABLE. She has been carrying out this activity for more than one year, selling her products door-to-door. Her best customers are the teachers from the local schools, office workers, and employees of the various tobacco manufacturers in the cities of Danlí and El Paraíso. She sells both in cash and on credit, which allows her to have customers year-round. She tells us that, despite the fact that these garments are more expensive than others, they always sell well since they are of better quality. Even the men often buy them to give as a gift to their partners. The loan would be used to buy more garments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments for women, men and children.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia tiene 49 años, vive en pareja y tiene 3 hijas, dos de ellas ya son mayores de edad, una de ellas ya culminó sus estudios universitarios mientras la otra sigue estudiando y la menor esta en el colegio.
Ellos viven en la compañía de Las Piedras en su propio domicilio. Su pareja trabaja en la ANDE como Electricista de Distribución hace mas de 26 años.
Antonia trabajaba anteriormente en un supermercado y como se había dado cuenta del buen ingreso que dejaba el negocio, se empeñó hasta formar su propia despensa que hasta hoy día es el que sustenta los gastos familiares, más el ingreso de su marido.
También tiene alquileres de sillas, mesas y cubiertos, dicha actividad comenzó después de haber festejado la fiesta de 15 años de su hija, ya que en ese entonces había comprado las sillas, mesas y cubiertos y como ya no las usaría más, decidió alquilarlas para cualquier otro tipo de eventos de la zona.
Ella tiene un proyecto, que es el de construir una casilla, ya que posee una panadería inactiva y mediante esta construcción podrá exhibir sus productos, para lo cual solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old. She lives with her spouse and 3 daughters. Two of them are adults- one of them them graduated from college and the other is still at school. The youngest is in high school. They live in Las Piedras in their own home. Her spouse has worked for ANDE as a distribution electricist for more than 26 years. Antonia previously worked in a supermarket. Realizing that the business provided a good income, she worked to establish her own convenience store. Today it continues to be the family's support, more than her husband's income. She also rents out chairs, tables and flatware. She began this activity after having a party for her daughter when she turned 15. She purchased chairs, tables and flatware, and since she wasn't going to use them again, she decided to rent them out for any type of event in the area. She has a project, which is constructing a little building. She has an inactive bread bakery and with the contruction she can show her product. That is why she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Blanca Janeth

texts.es:
la sra. Blanca G. se dedica a la venta de ropa clasificada, su negocio esta ubicado en la Colonia Gracias a Dios contiguo al campo de Fútbol, tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, ha ganado mucha experiencia y por lo tanto buena clientela siendo sus clientes los empleados de las fabricas de tabacos  ubicados al contorno del Municipio, la Sra. G. utilizara el credito para la compra de fardos de ropa de casa, juvenil y adultos.
las ganancias las utilizara para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca G. sells clothes. Her business is located in the Gracias a Dios neighborhood next to the soccer field. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. She has gained a lot of experience and thus good customers. Her customers are the tabacco factory workers from the outskirts of town. Mrs. G. will use the loan to buy bundles of everyday clothes for children and adults. She will use the profits to pay for household expenses.
