Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Sauceñitas Group

texts.es: El banco “Las Sauceñitas” esta representada por la señora Verónica Victoria y conformado por 15 miembros donD. 8 son mujeres y 7 son varones, este banco esta caracterizado principalmente por la confianza entre los socios y su dinamismo. La señora Verónica Victoria quien es la actual presidenta es casada, el nombre D. su esposo es Hugo con el que comparte 2 bellos niños, verónica a demás D. ser una madre dedicada trabaja en un pequeño negocio D. distribución D. productos D. estética y arreglo personal del cual también es propietaria, con muchos esfuerzos Verónica Victoria y su esposo lograron construir su casa propia y ambos trabajan día a día a fin D. mantener a sus niños. El resto del grupo principalmente las mujeres se dedican a la elaboración y venta D. pan y masitas, asimismo los varones en su mayoría se dedican al área D. la construcción y transporte urbanos con sus taxis propios, otras actividades a las cuales se dedican otros socios es la venta D. comida, venta por cartilla, venta D. cds, es importante mencionar que gran parte D. las socias que integran el grupo venden hace bastantes años en el mismo lugar y son vecinas. El grupo en si tiene bastante experiencia en las actividades que realizan. El crédito será utilizado como capital D. trabajo, compra D. materias primas y enseres para el negocio y solucionar  algunos problemas que les impiden desempeñarse plenamente en sus negocios (compra D. llantas para vehículos, y algunas refacciones en estos). Si bien el banco es nuevo y esta en su primer ciclo, muchos D. los socios tienen experiencia en créditos comunales y se los pueD. calificar como personas confiables gracias a las reuniones previas en las cuales se efectúa la evaluación D. los socios.
texts.en:
Verónica Victoria represents the Las Azucenitas Communal Bank. The bank is comprised of 15 members. There are eight women and seven men. This bank is characterized primarily by the trust among the members and their dynamism. Verónica Victoria, the current president, is married. Her husband’s name is Hugo, and they have two beautiful children. Besides being a devoted mother, Verónica works in a small business that distributes aesthetical and personal grooming products. She is the owner of the business. With much effort Verónica Victoria and her husband built their own house. They both work day to day in order to support their children. The rest of the group, especially the women, make and sell bread and pastries. Most of the men work in the area of construction or urban transportation with their own taxis. Other activities the members do are selling food, catalog sales, or selling CDs. It is important to mention that a large part of the members of the group have been selling in the same place for years, and they are neighbors. The group has plenty of experience in the activities they do. The loan is to be used as working capital to buy raw materials and utensils for their businesses. It will also be used to solve some problems that keep them from fully doing their jobs in their businesses (buy tires for vehicles, and some vehicle repairs). The bank is new and in its first cycle, but many of the members have experience with communal loan. They are able to qualify as trustworthy people thanks to the member evaluation that was completed at the previous meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pants, hats, shirts, shoes, perfumes, blouses, skirts and other clothing items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria de Jesus C. se dedica a la venta de granos de cafe y tambien vende golosinas de platanos fritas, tiene mas de 10 años de ejercer este tipo de actividad comercial lo que le permite agenciar ganancias que contribuyen a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
el cafe que se produce en esta zona es de buen sabor y aroma ya que esta zona es una de las principales zonas productoras de café de Honduras, doña Gloria es una mujer que como muchas contribuyen con los gastos del hogar a su esposo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cafe y platanos.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria de Jesus C. sells coffee beans and candied banana slices. She has been doing this work for more than ten years, and the income from it has allowed her to improve her standard of living and that of her family. The coffee that is grown in this area has a good flavour and aroma since this is one of the principal coffee-growing areas of Honduras. Gloria is one of the many women who help their husbands with household expenses. The loan will be used to buy coffee and bananas.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy coffee and bananas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: EL SR. MARTIN NACIO  EL 3 DE ENERO DE 1955  ES COCHABANBINO,  CASADO CON DOÑA ALBERTA  CON 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, EL TRABAJA EN LA AGRICULTURA EN LA LOCALIDAD 1RO. DE MAYO A 30KM DEL TORNO, HACE 11 AÑOS QUE TIENE SU PARCELA EN ESA COMUNIDAD, TAMBIEN TIENE GANADO, Y SU ESPOSA SE ENCARGA DE LA CRIANZA DE LOS ANIMALES,  EN LA AGRICULTURA EL SIEMBRA JOCO, MAIZ, AROS, Y MANI. Y TODOS SUS PRODUCTOS LOS COMERCIALIZA EN EL  MERCADO DE EL TORNO, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TABAJADORA QUE TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERACION, TRABAJA CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS HIJITOS QUE TAMBIEN AYUDAN EN EL RIEGO DE SUS CULTIVOS, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA SEMILLAS PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPA ESTE ES UN NUEVO PRODUCTO QUE SE ESTA ANIMANDO A SEMBRAR YA QUE ES SU EPOCA DE SIEMBRA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y  KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Martin was born January 3, 1955 and is a native of Cochabamba (Bolivia). He is married to Alberta, and they have two school-aged children. He works in agriculture in the town of 1st of May, 30 kilometers from Torno. He has had his plot of land in this community for 11 years. He also has livestock and his wife is in charge of raising the animals. For agriculture, he sows pumpkin, corn, rice and peanuts. He markets all of his products in the Torno market.

He is a very hard-working person, that has a lot of desire to get ahead. He works with his wife and their small children who also help to water the crops. With the money from the loan, he will buy seeds for the sowing of potatoes. This is a new product that he is inspired to sow, since it is the sowing period. He is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, sauces, beans, flour, vegetables, salami and ham

loans.name: Cronelio Ramon

texts.es:
el sr. Cornelio Ramon R. es comerciante individual, vende medicinas populares, tiene mas de 10 años 
de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad la cual la realiza de forma ambulante/domiciliar este negocio es una fuente de generacion de ingresos que le permiten darle el apoyo a su familia y cubrir con los compromisos adquiridos. Cornelio tiene muy buena clientela en varias partes de la ciudad y lugares vecinos, tiene 4 hijos que cursan la primaria y secundaria.
Cornelio se siente muy satisfecho con su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas medicamentos.
texts.en:
Sr. Cornelio Ramon R. is a private businessman who has been selling traditional medicines for more than ten years. He sells his products in the streets and also visits people's houses. The income he earns allows him to support his family and cover other commitments. Cornelio has a good customer base in various parts of the town and neighbouring areas. He has four children who attend primary or secondary school. He feels very satisfied with his business. The loan will be used to buy more medicines.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy traditional medicines

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is an individual loan client with Esperanza. Her story is representative Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. She is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seybo, an area economically based around agriculture, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their four children.

Andrea is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, and her second individual loan after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing two dozen pairs of shoes, a dozen pairs of pants, skirts and blouses in the capital in the main markets and then selling them in her community at a profit. She will use the profits to construct her own home and "to get out of poverty!" She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy two dozen pairs of shoes, a dozen pairs of pants, skirts and blouses for resale

loans.name: Yoselin Virginia

texts.es: LA SRA. YOSELIN ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJAS,  SE DEDICA A LA REPOSTERIA, VENDIENDO LOS PEQUEÑOS BOCADOS DULCES COMO POR EJEMPLO QUEQUES, ALFAJORES, EMPANADAS Y REPARTIENDO A LAS TIENDAS DE LA CIUDAD Y COLEGIOS. ELLA DESPUES DE MUCHO TIEMPO SE ANIMO A ABRIR UNA TIENDA DONDE PUEDA EXPONER SUS PRODUCTOS Y ADEMAS A LA VEZ OFRECER PRODUCTOS DE CONSUMO MASIVO, ESPERA ELLA QUE TENGA MUCHO EXITO, YA QUE EMPEZAR UN NUEVO NEGOCIO PARA ELLA ES CUMPLIR UNO DE SUS SUEÑOS, QUE GRACIAS A LA ISTITUCION ESTA HACIENDO REALIDAD, Y QUE A  FUTURO LE PODAMOS SACAR UNA FOTO EN SU NUEVO NEGOCIO, ESTA MUY COTENTA DE TENER UNA TASA KIVA, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y POR AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE SUS QUEQUES Y TORTAS, SUS HIJAS LE AYUDAN EN SUS TIEMPOS LIBRES YA QUE ESTUDIAN EN LA UNIVERSIDAD Y OTRO DE LOS DESEOS DE LA SRA. YOSELIN ES DE VER A SUS HIJAS PROFESIONALES, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRAR MESAS Y SILLAS, ANAQUELES, ETC Y TAMBIEN INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS QUEQUES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yoselin is married and has 2 daughters. She does baking, selling the sweet pastries like cakes, candies, and empanadas (filled pastries) and distributing them to stores in the city and to schools. After some years she decided to open a store where she could display her products and also offer them to the general public. She hopes to be very successful, now that she has started her new business. This is a fulfillment of one of her dreams, and thanks to the institution, it has become reality. In the future we can take a picture of her in her new business. She is very happy to have a loan from Kiva. She is hardworking and for many years has made cakes and pies. Her daughters help her in their free time from studying in the university. Another hope for Mrs Yoselin is to see her daughters become professionals. With the money from the loan she will buy tables, chairs, shelves, etc and also ingredients to make her cakes. She is very grateful to EMPRENDER and KIVA for the confidence they have shown her in the issuing of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The furnishings for a bakery

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es: La Srta. Rocio es una jovencita que trabaja con su mamá en la atención de una tienda ubicada en la zona de Cota Cota cerca al parque de las Lagunas, la mamá a parte de la tienda tiene otra actividad tiene un contrato de abstecimiento de víveres con la prefectura, en lo que se refiere al centro penitenciario femenino la carcel de mujeres, en esta actividad para trámites y compras le colabora su hija, ella tiene 20 años y se encuentra estudiando en la universidad una carrera financiera, es soltera, este es su segundo credito en Emprender, trabajo puntualmente con sus pagos, ahora el crédito invertirá en la compra de refrescos y bebidas, ya que por esta época en el día se siente mucho calor y estos productos tiene mucha demanda, La Srta. rocio es un a persona joven y muy trabajadora desde niña ayudo a su mama en esta actividad, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Srta. Rocio is a young woman who works with her mother in the service of a store located in the Cota Cota region close to the park of Las Lagunas. Apart from the store, her mother has another job, which is a provisions supply contract with the Prefecture (Coast Guard), in regards to the female penitentiary center (women's prison). In the business of procedures and purchases, she collaborates with her daughter, who is 20 years old and single, and is studying a financial degree in the university.

This is her second loan with Emprender, and she is punctual with her payments. Now she will invest this loan in the purchase of refreshments and drinks, since for this period, during the day it is really hot and there is a lot of demand for these products. Rocio is a very hard-working young person and since she was a young girl, she has helped her mother in this business. She is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es:
el sr. Eduardo Jose Z. V. se dedica  a la elaboracion y venta de muebles de madera, tiene mas de 16 años de realizar este tipo de actividad.

Eduardo esta casado y es padre de 4 hijos, la hija mayor cursa la secundaria y los tres menores cursan educacion primaria, con los ingresos que le genera este negocio suple algunos gastos familiares.
nos comento que atravez de este negocio logro comprar la casa en la cual el vive y cuando el comenzo a trabajar apenas tenia 14 años y los 21 años monto su propio taller de carpinteria con los ahorros que el tenia, de su trabajo compro la maquinaria. Cuando los clientes que tenia antes cuando era empleado de una carpinteria se dieron cuenta que el tenia su propio taller comenzaron a buscarlo para que les realizara los trabajos,  es asi
como emprendio su Fabrica de Muebles. El Sr. Eduardo tiene dos empleados que le ayudan a fabricar 
los muebles que vende a sus clientes, su clientela se ha incrementado y se ha visto en la necesidad de  
solicitar un credito para la compra de madera que es la materia prima mas importante de su negocio.
Su deseo es tener una fabrica con tecnologia moderna y producir en serie para lograr conquistar 
nuevos clientes tanto nacionales como internacionales, fomentar mas empleo y mejorar las condiciones de 
vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo Jose Z. sells wooden furniture, and has been doing this type of activity for more than 16 years. Eduardo is married and is the father of four children. His oldest daughter attends secondary school and the three younger children are in primary school with the earnings this business generates to cover some family expenses. Eduardo told us that because of this business, he was able to buy the house in which he lives. When he began to work, he was barely 14 years old, and at 21 years old he opened his own carpentry shop, and with the savings he bought machinery. When the clients he had earlier realized that he had his own workshop, they began seeking him out to do jobs, and so it was that he started his Furniture Factory. Eduardo has two employees who help him produce furniture that he sells to his clients. His clientele has increased and he sees a need for borrowing money to buy wood, the most important material for his business. His wish is to have a factory with modern technology for serial products and thereby acquire new national and international clients, fostering more employment, and bettering the living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase woods (cedar, caoba, laurel, pine) and repair parts for machinery

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 33 años, casada y madre de una pequeña hija, de apenas 3 años, juntos viven en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 2 años, decidió instalar el servicio de Internet, por lo que  situó cabinas en un espacio que le cedieron sus suegros. La gran demanda de este servicio, le ha generado considerables rentas, por ser el único que ofrece este servicio en su localidad,  es así que atiende todos los días, alquilando por horas sus computadoras. Ahora planea dar mantenimiento a sus maquinas y ofrecer mayor comodidad y calidad a sus clientes cibernautas. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que el aporte que recibirá le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de muebles nuevos para sus computadoras.
texts.en:
Soledad is 33 years old, married, and the mother of a 3-year-old daughter. They live in the house of their in-laws. Two years ago, Soledad decided to install Internet service in cubicles in a space provided by her in-laws. There has been great demand for this service, which has generated good income. This is the only service of this type in the neighborhood, and they are open every day, renting computers by the hour. Now, Soledad is planning maintenance for the computers and offering more comfort and quality for her web-surfing clients. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is committed to being responsible with her payments. She considers the support that she receives will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of new furniture for the computers.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furniture for computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: tools and raw materials for metal fabrication

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 2,4 Group

texts.en:
Bienvenida is the coordinator of her group La Nueva Esperanza 2,4 (which means "The New Hope") and her story is representative Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seybo, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her five children.

Bienvenida is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a "colmado," or small general store, by stocking it with fish, rice, cooking oil, salami, sardines, sauces, potatoes, and spaghetti. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and expand it, and to provide for the needs of her large family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy fish, rice, cooking oil, salami, sardines, sauces, potatoes, and spaghetti to sell

loans.name: Saldivar Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Saldivar Poty, se conformo en fecha 22 de marzo del 2.007, gracias a las ganas de cada una de ellas. 
Una vez contactada con la asesora acerca del Programa se reunieron 18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 11º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo en el transcurso de los ciclos, pasó por algunos inconvenientes, ya que la Directora General estuvo con problemas de salud, pero respondiendo sin ningún problema al compromiso aceptado, de esta manera el grupo gracias a su trabajo solidario logró salir adelante y siguen trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
Una de las integrantes es la señora quien se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza, todos los productos son elaborados por la señora.
Una vez elaborados los productos ella sale a ofrecer por varios lugares.
Solicita el préstamos para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en:
The Saldivar Poty Communal Bank was formed on March 22nd in 2007, thanks to the aspirations of each one of then. Once they contacted the counselor about the program, 18 women joined. They are working happily together in their 11th cycle in a supportive way within the program. Through the cycles the group has had some inconveniences. The General Director had health problems. But, she is responding without problems to the commitment she accepted. The group, thanks to its supportive work, was able to get ahead and still keep working in the program. All of them have different activities to make money. They help each other to reach the common objectives that they all have in the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in the weekly meetings, and their work is impeccably supportive. One of the members is a woman who sells cleaning supplies. She makes all of the products. Once she has made the products, she goes out to sell them in various places. She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make these products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sodium hydroxide solution, soap, bicarbonate, and glycerin

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 28 años D. edad, es casado y tiene 3  hijos menores D. edad, dos D. los cuales se encuentran en actividad escolar, vive junto a su familia en el sector ciudad D. Dios del distrito D. San José, una zona dedicada a L. pesca y que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a L. venta D. pescado hace 4 años aproximadamente, Santos compra su mercadería en terminal pesquero D. L. región (situado en el distrito D. Santa Rosa) y luego L. venD. D. manera ambulatoria en las areas aledañas D. Ciudad D. Dios y en el distrito D. San Jose, para lo cual utiliza una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte D. carga y pasajeros).

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad movil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren D. urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ello Santos D. ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en L. reparacion D. su mototaxi, esto le ayudará a seguir realizando sin problemas su actividad D. venta D. pescado.

Santos es una persona bastante trabajadora y su actividad es muy importante para L. economía D. su familia, el siempre da lo mejor D. si para sacarlos adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 28, married, and has three minor children. Two of the children go to school. He lives with his family in the city of Dios in the San José district. This is an area devoted to fishing, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has been selling fish for approximately four years. Santos buys his merchandise at the fishing terminal in the region (situated in the Santa Rosa district). He then sells it as a street vendor in the outskirts of the city of Dios and in the San Jose district. He uses a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers) to do this. The continual use of his mototaxi has caused it to start to have problems that require urgent repair in order to function properly. That is why Santos has seen the need to request, for the first time, a loan for 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use it to repair his mototaxi. This will help him to continue selling fish without problems. Santos is a very hard-working person. His activity is very important to the economy of his family. He always gives his best in order to get them ahead. His biggest desire is to keep growing as a businessman in order to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for the mototaxi used in his business of selling fish

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - San José - Lambayeque

loans.name: Esperanza Nueva 1,3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group L. Nueva Esperanza 1,3(The New Hope). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an area where agriculture dominates the economy and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and and their three children.

Maria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan, which helped to expand her business. She plans to use this new loan to invest in her business running a fruit stand. She will use the funds to purchase apples, lemons, melons, mandarins, grapefruits and mangoes. She will use the profits to invest in constructing her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase apples, lemons, melons, mandarins, grapefruits and mangoes.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio es Agricultor y productor lechero, actividades que constituyen su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su familia; su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Tahari Provincia Omasuyos, a dos horas  de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de Ganado (una vaca lechera) y de esta forma incrementar sus ventas en leche y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es Primer crédito con Impro y con Kiva.
texts.en:
Gregorio is a farmer and milk producer. These activities are his principal source of income, which he uses to support his family. His home is located in the Tahari community in the Omasuyos province. It is two hours from the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy livestock (a dairy cow). That way he will increase his milk sales and improve his income. This is his first loan with Impro and with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is an individual loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. She is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their and three children.

Marisol is excited to be taking her sixth total loan with Esperanza and her third individual loan after having successfully repaid her previous loan, which helped her to expand her business. She plans to use this new loan to invest in her business raising pigs. She will be purchasing two pigs and the necessary food for the pigs. She will use the profits to invest in her business by purchasing a vehicle. Some of the profit will also be invested in her home by finishing its construction. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy corn, firewood, lime, watermelon, and soy

loans.name: Virila

texts.es:
La señora Virila tiene 49 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Nelson Acosta Almeida quien es empleado de una empresa de telecomunicaciones que realiza armaje de antenas por el interior del pais, tienen 3 hijos, dos mujeres y un varón, viven en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Itá, posee un copetín ubicado en su domicilio hace poco tiempo, debido a que por este año no trabajará como cantinera de una escuela de la ciudad como lo venia haciendo hace varios años atrás por que su hija quien la ayudaba en el negocio actualmente esta trabajando como empleada de una estación de servicios.
La señora Virila solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas en general,  también para la compra de carne, jamón, queso, panificados, harina, mandioca los cuales necesita para realizar sándwich de carne, empanadas de harina, mandioca y jamón y queso.
texts.en:
Virila, age 49, is married to Nelson Acosta Almeida. He is employed by a telecommunications company that makes antennas for the interior of the company. She has three children, two girls and a boy. They live in a well known-known neighborhood in the city of Itá. She has had a snack bar in her home for a short time. This is because this year she will not work as a food server in a school in the city as she has been doing for the past several years. The reason for this is that her daughter, who helped her in the business, is currently working as an employee in a service station. Virila is asking for a loan to buy drinks. She will also buy meat, ham, cheese, bread products, flour, and tapioca. She needs these items to make meat sandwiches, flour empanadas, tapioca, and ham and cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, drinks, and other products

loans.name: Sonadores Con Propositos Group

texts.en:
Manuel is the coordinator of his group Mujeres Sonadores (Women who Dream), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the rural areas surrounding El-Seibo, where the economy is based around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple, rented structure with a long term partner and their child.

Manuel is excited to be taking his tenth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to expand his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business running a colmado, or small general store, by purchasing cooking oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, spaghetti, and fish to sell in his shop. He will use the profits to invest in furniture for his home as well as saving towards purchasing a plot of land on which to build his own home. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, spaghetti, and fish.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: Gerardo Antonio, tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, por lo que son menores y están a su cargo. El señor tiene un negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, en su casa de habitación. El inició con este negocio desde que termino de hacer su casa hace 8 años con una habitación, ahora tiene 5 habitaciones y le va muy bien. Este crédito solicitado por el señor quiere invertirlo en la compra de muebles variados y hamacas, ya que nos encontramos en una fecha de bastante alquiler, ya que su casa está localizada en una zona muy concurrida de turistas. El señor sueña con tener algún día un hotel, si es posible en una playa cercana y poder dejarle un legado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gerardo Antonio is 45 years old, he is married and he has 2 children who are minors and are still in his care. His business is renting rooms out of his house. He started out with this business after he finished building his house 8 years ago. He has 5 rooms to rent and it has been very profitable. The loan he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of various furniture items and hammocks. Currently it is a tourist season and his house is located in a locale frequented by tourists. His dreams are to one day have a hotel, if possible on a beach near by and to leave it as a legacy for his kids.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal SOL Y LUNA  en su Secuencia 5, está formado por 8 clientes, todas mujeres , todas  las socias pertenecen a L. Zona de Pampahasi, que están ubicados por los alrededores de L. oficina de Emprender las socias se dedican a L. venta de diversos productos como ser, de ropa, cosméticos, venta de verduras, y L. confección y venta de deportivos o L. venta de chamarras. En L. secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción de una socia que pagó con su ahorro debido que uno de sus familiares estuvo delicado de salud, persona que fue retirada del  banco Comunal.
 
L. Sra. Angélica es L. representante, actualmente toma el cargo de L. presidenta del banco se dedica venta de cosméticos de varias marcas que  solicita mediante catalogo, cuenta con esta actividad hace 5 años, el préstamo será destinado para acceder a descuentos y promociones que L. empresa de cosméticos le ofrece.
L. señora vive separa de su esposo hace 20 aproximadamente, vive con sus  hijos mayores y nietos, L. señora angélica asume el papel de padre y madre veL. por toda su familia, siendo que cuenta con pocos recursos económicos, los créditos obtenidos de L. institución, le apoyaron para salir adelante junto a su familia y a sus hijos, En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos y muy alegre. Manteniendo un ambiente de grupo responsable, siempre apoyando a sus compañeras.

L. Sra. Elisa Es una integrante nueva del banco, L. señora Elisa tiene 18 años, tiene un bebe de 10 meses lo que no le impide superarse, siguiendo adelante frente a todo, no esta casada vive con su mamá y sus hermanas, asume el rol de padre y madre para su hijo siendo que su hijo esta en una etapa de crecimiento necesita mas recursos económicos para su alimentación y su vestimenta es por esta situación que L. señora tiene que trabajar, elL. al igual que su familia viven en una casa ocupando dos cuartos es una familia de bajos recursos económicos el crédito solicitado es para L. compra de mercadería para L. apertura de una tienda de barrio siendo que ya cuenta con el ambiente necesario que esta ubicado a dos cuadras  de L. parada del minibús 300  en L. zona de vilL. victoria, y así apoyar económicamente a su familia y a su hijo, es L. tesorera en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida  por su  responsabilidad y el compañerismo que ha demostrado en su proceso de capacitación.

L. Sra. Roxana Socia que retorna a trabajar con su Banca comunal después de haber dejado un ciclo, L. señora Roxana se dedica a L. confección de deportivos y posteriormente  los comercializa  en su puesto de venta en L. calle Illampu  zona que es muy comercial para L. venta. El préstamo esta destinado para incrementar su capital en L. compra de materia prima. L. señora Roxana es soltera tiene una hija, vive con sus familiares en L. zona de Pampahasi. Su meta es tener su propia casa y en adelante tener su propia microempresa y realizar sus ventas al por mayor e incluso realizar L. exportación de L. mano de obra que elL. realiza, indicando que las personas tenemos que seguir adelante sobre todas las cosas buenas y malas.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por L. confianza brindada en L. otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The SOL Y LUNA (Sun & Moon) communal bank is in its 5th cycle; it’s composed of 8 members, all women from Pampahasi, near the Emprender offices. They are involved in a variety of commercial activities, such as: clothing and cosmetics sales, vegetable sales, manufacture and sale of sportswear and jacket sales. In their last cycle they all paid back in full except one of the members who used her savings to repay because one of her family members became ill; her membership in the communal bank was revoked. Angélica is the group representative and is the current bank president. She sells various brands of catalogue cosmetics. She has been in this line of work for 5 years and will use the requested funds to take advantage of sales and promotions that the firm offering the cosmetics has available. She has been separated from her husband for about 20 years; she lives with her oldest children and her grandchildren. Angélica acts as both mother and father watching over the wellbeing of the entire family. Because she has limited resources, funds from the institution have been of great use to her to get ahead together with her family and children. She has stood out in her communal bank as a responsible and punctual person with respect to her repayments; she is also very cheerful. Elisa is a new group member. She is 18 years old and has a 10 month old baby but this is not an obstacle for her to improve and to continue forward despite everything. She is unmarried and lives with her mother and sisters. She is both mother and father to her son. Because he is in a development stage she needs more resources for his nourishment and clothing. For this reason, she has to work. She and her family live in a two-room house; they are a low-income family. The funds will be used to buy merchandise in order to open a neighborhood grocery store since she already has a proper locale for it located two blocks from Minibus Route 300 stop in VilL. Victoria. This will make it possible for her to support her family and her son. She is bank treasurer and she was elected to this post thanks to the responsibility and companionship she has shown during her training period. Roxana is a returning member; she dropped out for a cycle. She makes sportswear that she subsequently sells at her sales stand on Illampu Street, an area that is very commercial for sales. She will use the funds to buy raw materials. Roxana is single and has a daughter; she lives with relatives in the Pampahasi area. Her goal is to own her own house and later on have her own micro business and to sell her items at wholesale; she would even like to export the labor she does indicating that people have to continue forward despite everything, both good and bad. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
don Daniel G. es una persona emprendedora,  se dedica a la venta de pan blanco y dulce en diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad de Choluteca. 
es padre de 3 hijos, el hace el trabajo de padre y madre ya que el solo esta al cuidado de sus hijos, los tiene en la escuela. es por lo cual Daniel trabaja duro para sacar adelante  a sus hijos y darle lo necesario.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas pan ya que su recorrido ahora es mas grande y a veces se queda sin producto antes de terminar sus ventas diarias.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel G. is an entrepreneur, and he sells white and sweet bread in different neighborhoods and sections in the city of Choluteca. He is a father of three children, and he does the work of both mother and father as his in solely responsible for the children's care. He has them in school, and it is for this reason that Daniel works hard to raise his children and give them what they need. He will use the loan to buy more bread now that his route is larger, and at time he's run out of bread before finishing his daily sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase white and sweet bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa tiene 30 años, es madre de familia, tiene dos hijas menores de edad a su cargo, posee un negocio de venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Ubicado  en su casa de habitación, realiza sus ventas en sus alrededores, su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia, está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio  ya que se acerca la temporada  de semana santa y desea aprovecharla. Pues aquí donde logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 30, and she has two minor children under her care. She has a business selling clothes as a street vendor. The business is located in her home, and she sells in surrounding areas. Her husband is self-employed. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Now that the Holy Week season is near she wants to take advantage of it. This is where she gets the needed income for her household. Her wish is to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amistad 2,5 Group

texts.en:
Antonia is the coordinator of her group Amistad (Friendship), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her husband and child.

Antonia is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing. She will be purchasing men's pants in the Capital, at the main market, and then re-selling them in her community for a profit. She will use the profits to invest in her home. She will be purchasing a bed, sheets and constructing a living room. Her long term goal is to own her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase men's pants to sell.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es: EL SR. AUGUSTO ESTA CASADO Y TIENE 5 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN ESTUDIANDO EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, ES CLIENTE  NUEVO EN LA  INSTITUCION, EL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA PARA CONSTRUCCION DE MAS AMBIENTES EN SU CASA,  PUESTO QUE AL MOMENTO VIVE ESTRECHAMENTE CON TODA SU FAMILIA, CUENTA CON UN SOLO DORMITORIO Y COMO TIENE CINCO HIJOS LE ES DIFICIL LA SITUACION. TRABAJA COMO TRANSPORTISTA DE LA LINEA Nº 113, TAMBIEN MANTIENE A SU MADRE QUE ES DE LA TERCERA EDAD  Y DESEA DARLES COMODIDAD A SUS  HIJOS Y A SU MADRE. SU ESPOSA TRABAJA VENDIENDO COMIDA AMBOS QUIEREN MEJORAR  SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y TRABAJAN DURO PARA REALIZAR UNO DE SUS DESEOS EL DE VER SU CASA TERMINADA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDAD EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Augusto is married and has 5 children who are university students. He is a new client of the institution and will use the requested funds to build more rooms onto his house because he currently lives with his family in pretty crowded conditions: he only has one bedroom and, with five children, the situation is difficult. He works as a public transport provider on Route #113; he also supports his mother, who is a senior citizen. He wants to provide comfort for his children and his mother. His wife works selling food; both want to improve their quality of life and they work hard to make their dream of finishing building their house come true. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home construction costs.

loans.name: Janeth Natividad

texts.es:
El  Banco Comunal  Lomas del Viento está situado en  la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí, sus socias  son  un grupo de señoras  muy trabajadoras  y responsables donde se vive un ambiente de compañerismo, en nuestra vivista al banco comunal conversamos con la señora Janeth  S. que lleva como socia dos ciclos trabajando con la Fundación.

Janeth está casada desde hace cinco  años, tiene dos hijos su esposo se desempeña como chofer y ella al comercio informal de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, cuando nuestra socia empezó en las ventas  lo hizo con prendas intimas  y después fue surtiendo su stock hasta comercializar lo  ahora tiene.  Con este nuevo crédito  va  a comprar más mercadería como pantalones, blusas, camisas,  bermudas, etc. para damas, caballeros y niños y estas compras las realiza dos veces al mes.  Nuestra socia a sus  24 años  ha tenido que  combinar el tiempo entre el hogar,  sus hijos y el negocio, por eso en la mañana se dedica a la casa y en las tardes sale a recorrer su comunidad visitando a sus clientes que por lo general son del mismo sector donde vive.

El sueño de  Janeth es poder terminar sus estudios  en  belleza y cosmetología, así como  terminar de construir su casa propia y para ello está ahorrando sus ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
The Lomas del Viento Communal Bank is situated in the city of Portoviejo in the Manabí province. Its members are a group of women who are very hard-working and responsible. An atmosphere of collegiality exists among them. On our visit to the communal bank we spoke with Janeth S.. She has been a member working with the Fundación for two cycles. Janeth has been married for five years. She has two children, and her husband works as a driver. She sells clothing for women, men, and children. When she started in sales she sold intimate wear. Later, she was stocking up until she got the business where it is today. With this new loan she will buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts, and bermudas, etc. for women, men, and children. She makes these purchases twice a month. At her 24 years of age she has had to combine her time between her home, her children, and the business. In the mornings she takes care of her house, and in the afternoons she goes out into the community to visit her customers. They are generally from the same area in which she lives. Janeth’s dream is to be able to finish her beauty and cosmetic studies. She also dreams of finishing construction of her own house. She is saving her earnings from her business to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, shirts, and bermudas, etc. for women, men, and children

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista tiene  60 años de edad, es casado y  junto a su compañera tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. El señor Juan tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 5 años, por lo que también se dedica a la venta de cerdo, pues el busca la forma de traer ingresos. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de productos variados para la pulpería, principalmente en la compra de granos básicos que es lo que las personas están priorizando en la actualidad en sus compras. Su sueño es llegar a establecer un negocio con suficiente capacidad económica para establecer una distribuidora que brinde productos a los precios más bajos y que incrementen sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista, age 60, is married. He and his wife have 2 grown children. Señor Juan has a small grocery store in his house. He began his business 5 years ago. He also sells pork because he is always looking for ways to bring in income.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of various products for his shop, mainly dried grains since this is what people mainly want in the purchases they are making currently. His dreams are to succeed in establishing a business with sufficient economic strength to act as a distributor that offers products at the lowest prices and to increase his family income.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia  es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Flavia, tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Su principal actividad económica es el cuidado y limpieza del baño público del centro comercial “El Pacifico del Sur” del distrito de Wanchaq  de la ciudad del Cusco y su actividad económica complementaria es vender útiles escolares. Ya son varios años que se decía al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que cada día pone en su trabajo, ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería para la librería.

Flavia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa es socia nueva, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación que brinda la Asociación. 

Flavia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Flavia is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead. Through her daily effort she wants to give her children a better future. Favia is 39, married, and has four children. Her main economic activity is taking care of and cleaning the public bathroom at the El Pacifico del Sur commercial center in the Wanchaq district of the city of Cusco. Her supplemental economic activity is selling school supplies. She has had this business for several years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work everyday. She needs the loan to buy merchandise for the bookstore. Flavia belongs to the Los Diamantes Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa. She is a new member. She says that she is happy and satisfied with the loan services, the savings, and the trainings that the Asociación provides Flavia is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the bookstore

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el sector Molino El Carmen del distrito de Motupe,un distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era joven, empezó trabajando como peón agrícola en diversos cultivos de la zona y con mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir hace cinco años un terreno agrícola propio en donde suele sembrar maíz, el suele poner todo su esfuerzo en esta actividad ya que de ella depende el mantenimiento de su familia.

El cultivo ya esta muy avanzado y dentro de poco dará frutos, Francisco quiere asegurarse una buena producción brindandole riegos y fertilizantes, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar la actividad propuesta.

Francisco es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y conocidos lo consideran una persona responsable y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar a los que lo necesitan
texts.en:
Francisco is the 46 year old father of a family. He lives with his wife and children in the Molio El Carment sector of the Motupe district. This district is part of the Lambayeque province and is located 1 hour and 45 minutes outside of the city Chiclayo. He has worked as a farmer since he was young. He began working as a farmhand in various farms in the region, and with much effort was able to acquire his own farm 5 years ago. He grows corn, and puts all his efforts into this work and he depends on it to support his family. The crop is already very advanced, and soon will give a crop. Francisco wants to ensure good production via water and fertilizers, and for this he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will help him complete this task. Francisco is a hardworking person, his greatest longing is to continue growing as an entrepreneur in order to bring his family a better quality of life. His neighbors and friends consider him to be a responsible person, and he is always ready to help those who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for Francisco's corn

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a su familia. 

Iris, tiene 30 años, es conviviente y es docente. Su principal actividad económica es enseñar en el colegio nacional “Fortunato Herrera” de la ciudad del Cusco. La institución educativa le va contratar por un año. Ya son varios años que ejercer su profesión y le va muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que cada día pone en su trabajo, ella requiere el crédito para ahorrar y luego se va comprar una computadora portátil.  

Iris pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa es socia nueva, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación que brinda la Asociación. 

Iris se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Iris is a young, hardworking and enterprising woman that looks for opportunities in each moment to get ahead and with her daily efforts, support her family.

Iris is 30 years old, has a live-in partner and is a teacher. Her main economic activity is teaching at the national school “Fortunato Herrera” in the city of Cusco. The educational institution is hiring her for one year. She has already been in the profession for several years and it has gone well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work every day. She is requesting the loan to save and later buy a laptop computer.

Iris belongs to the “Los Diamantes” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa. She is a new member and shows that she is happy and satisfied with the loan, savings, and training services that the Association provides.

Iris is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and similarly, she promises to make her loan repayments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a laptop computer

loans.name: Fuente De Paz 6,7 Group

texts.en:
Violeta is the coordinator of her group Fuente de Paz(Source of Peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her children.

Violeta is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear by purchasing, panties, briefs, brassieres and undershirts. She will use the profits to provide her children with backpacks, shoes and clothes for their schooling. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase panties, briefs, brassieres and undershirts to sell.

loans.name: Magno

texts.es:
Magno es un padre de familia de 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Pampas de la Aviación, perteneciente al distrito de Chochope, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agrícolas, solía trabajar como peón agrícola en los campos de cultivo de la zona y hace quince años pudo adquirir su propio terreno de cultivo en el que viene sembrando maíz. El gusta mucho de la labor que realiza debido a que ha ido creciendo gracias a su propio esfuerzo y también porque gracias a esta actividad ha podido mantener a su familia durante todos estos años.

Magno tiene instalado actualmente un cultivo de maíz que ya se encuentra bastante desarrollado y próximo a dar fruto, el desea asegurarse una buena producción brindándole riegos y aplicándole fertilizantes, para cumplir con este objetivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Magno es un padre responsable y trabajador, todas las actividades que planea siempre tienen como meta sacar adelante a su familia, a quienes quiere brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona honorable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Magno is a father of a family and is 52 years old. He lives together with his wife and their children in the Pampas de la Aviación sector, which belongs to the Chochope district, an agricultural zone in the province of Lambayeque, an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has been working in agriculture since he was very young. He usually worked as a farm worker in the fields of the area and fifteen years ago, he was able to acquire his own farmlands in which he is growing corn. He likes his work very much due to the fact that it has been increasing, thanks to his own effort. In addition, thanks to this business, he has been able to support his family during all of these years. Magno currently has a well-developed corn crop and it will soon bear fruit. He wants to assure that there will be good production by watering his crops and applying fertilizers. To be able to achieve this goal, he is applying for his first loan of 2000 PEN at Edpyme Alternativa. Magno is a responsible and hardworking father. With all of the work that he does, he always has has the goal of helping his family get ahead, to whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be an honorable and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and application of fertilizers to maintain his corn crops.

location.town: Pampas de la Aviación - Chochope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Cervelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Cervelina Sánchez Gutiérrez es profesora de secundaria tiene 25 años de ser maestra trabaja en una comunidad de san Rafael del sur, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos lo cual dos son menores y están en edad escolar, el dinero lo solicita para comprar 200 pulgas de madera para reparar su casa.
Es el sexto crédito con nosotros y dice que todos los crédito le han servido mucho ya que ha podido salir adelante con su familia y espera que siempre le estemos financiando para seguir luchando con su familia.
texts.en:
La Sra. Cervelina Sánchez Gutiérrez es profesora de secundaria tiene 25 años de ser maestra trabaja en una comunidad de san Rafael del sur, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos lo cual dos son menores y están en edad escolar, el dinero lo solicita para comprar 200 pulgas de madera para reparar su casa. Es el sexto crédito con nosotros y dice que todos los crédito le han servido mucho ya que ha podido salir adelante con su familia y espera que siempre le estemos financiando para seguir luchando con su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar madera

loans.name: Eufemia Cecilia

texts.es:
Eufemia L. de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil. Su casa es de cemento y hace dos meses ya cuenta con luz y agua como servicios básicos. Su esposo vende frutas y ellos tienen 4 niños de 11, 9,7 y 2 años de edad. 

Eufemia empezó arreglando la parte delantera de su casa y convirtiéndola en un pequeño local para ubicar el negocio que ella tanto quería e invirtiendo sus ahorros en cosas para papelería y vitrinas.

Gracias a la buena decisión ahora ella tiene una tienda surtida con víveres y papelería. Trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 22:00 pm en conjunto con su esposo. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, arroz y aceites para su pequeña tienda.

En el futuro quiere que su negocio sea mas grande y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Eufemia L. is 35 years old and lives in a zone in the urban fringes in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and as of two months ago, she has electricity and water as basic services. Her husband sells fruits and they have 4 children who are 11, 9, 7, and 2 years old.

Eufemia began working on the back part of her house and converting it into a small area for the business that she has wanted so much and has invested her savings in things for a stationery store and a display case.

Thanks to the good decision, she now has a store stocked with supplies and stationery. She works from 6:00am to 10:00pm together with her husband. With the loan, she wants to purchase notebooks, rice and oils for her small store.

In the future, she wants for her store to be bigger and for her children to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, rice, oil

loans.name: Doris Tatiana

texts.es: Doris Tatiana tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y posee 3 hijos, todos están a su cargo. La señora Maria  tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende granos básicos y otros artículos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 5 años. Porque su mama quería ingresos adicionales que reemplazaran la escasez de trabajo. Al poco tiempo, la pulpería la empezó a administrar Doris y ahora es propiamente de ella, quien la administra y quien invierte para mantenerla. Su crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales y pan. Su sueño es llegar a instalar una distribuidora en el municipio en donde vive, ya que actualmente no hay ninguna.
texts.en:
Doris Tatiana is 35 years old and a single mother with 3 children, all in her care. She operates a small general store from her home, in which she sells basic grains and other articles. She began this business some 5 years ago because her mother needed additional income to take the place of scarce work. Soon, Doris began to administer the store and, now, it belongs to her. Doris runs it and invests in order to maintain it. Her loan will be invested in buying, principally, basic grains, snacks, natural drinks and bread. Doris' dream is to be able to install a distribution center in the municipality where she lives, since at present there is none.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INVENTORY FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Nora Helen

texts.es:
En el sector  Lomas del Viento en la parroquia Andrés de Vera de la ciudad de Portoviejo   se reúne el banco comunal del mismo nombre.  Sus integrantes tienen un  gran compañerismo y responsabilidad con sus pagos, conversamos con varias socias entre ellas la señora Nora,  ella está casada desde hace 17 años y  tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es docente con el que  mantiene una muy buena relación en el hogar.

Nuestra socia es comerciante informal de productos de belleza en las marcas de Yanbal y Esika en este último recién ingreso para probar como le va con ésta nueva línea de cosméticos, lleva  ocho  años  en ésta actividad y lo hace para aportar  económicamente  a su familia y además porque siempre le han gustado las ventas.

Con los prestamos que recibe de la fundación ha podido hacer crecer su capital, con el nuevo crédito invertirá en perfumes, maquillajes, cremas, y bisutería, puesto que  cada 15 días tiene que cubrir los pagos de los productos y por ello ha decidido comprar al contado la mercadería  y así darles  más tiempo de  crédito a sus clientes fijos,  por lo general de lo que invierte gana el 30 % y eso lo invierte  para incrementar su negocio. 

La señora Nora ha tenido que pasar por momento difíciles que no le han permitido terminar sus estudios secundarios por eso ahora estudia por las noches para lograr el bachillerato y luego seguir sus estudios superiores  y alcanzar su máximo sueño que es ser profesional.
texts.en:
The Lomas del Viento area in the Andrés de Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo is where the communal bank of the same name meets. Its members are very compatible, and responsible with their payments. We talked with several of the members -one of whom is Mrs. Nora. She has been married for 17 years and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher and they have a good familial relationship. Our member sells beauty products but not in a store. The brands that she sells are Yanbal and Esika. She has only recently started handling Esika and she is seeing how this cosmetic line works out. She has been in this business for eight years and she does it to help with the financial support of her family and also because she likes sales. With the loan she has received from the foundation she has been able to grow her capital. With this new loan she will buy perfumes, makeup, creams and costume jewelry. She has to pay for the products every 15 days and that is why she decided to purchase the merchandise with cash. That way she can give her regular customers more time to repay her on credit. In general when she sells, she earns 30% and that she reinvests into increasing her business. Mrs. Nora has had some difficult times that didn’t allow her to finish secondary school. This is why she now studies at night-so that she can get her diploma and continue with higher studies so that she can achieve her biggest dream of being a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, makeup, creams and costume jewelry

loans.name: Linda

texts.es: La Sra. Linda P. es trabajadora activa de la alcaldía municipal, el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, piedra y pago de mano de obra, es el segundo crédito con nosotros y dice que el primer le ayudo de mucho por que empezó a hacer su casa y ahora necesita para terminar. Es casada tiene un niño menor de edad y espera que siempre le estemos apoyando con estos financiamiento.
texts.en:
La Sra. Linda P. es trabajadora activa de la alcaldía municipal, el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, piedra y pago de mano de obra, es el segundo crédito con nosotros y dice que el primer le ayudo de mucho por que empezó a hacer su casa y ahora necesita para terminar. Es casada tiene un niño menor de edad y espera que siempre le estemos apoyando con estos financiamiento.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: pago de cemento, piedra, arena

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna runs her business out of Limón, located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. She has managed to strike a balance between performing her domestic responsibilities and running her sales business. She plans to use this loan to invest in catalogue merchandise in order to increase her inventory of products for sale. This loan will help Johanna to take advantage of product offers and sales by enabling her to invest in the purchase of items such as cosmetics, clothing and kitchen appliances.

Johanna´s goal is to expand her business in order to increase her income and improve her standard of living (and that of her family). She plans to increase her sales by seeking out new clients and hopes to one day open her own small store. Johanna cites her main obstacle as a lack of working capital, necessary for investments in merchandise that she can sell.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, clothing and kitchen appliances.

loans.name: Pedro Hernan

texts.es: El Sr. PEDRO HERNAN P. R.. Se desempeña como ayudante de bodegas en un supermercado de San Rafael Del Sur, así como a otras actividades del negocio, es padre de dos hijos y muy dedicado a sus labores que le asignan. Este crédito lo solicito para la compra de materiales de construcción  para mejorar su vivienda esto por aproximación de la época lluviosa.
texts.en:
El Sr. PEDRO HERNAN P. R.. Se desempeña como ayudante de bodegas en un supermercado de San Rafael Del Sur, así como a otras actividades del negocio, es padre de dos hijos y muy dedicado a sus labores que le asignan. Este crédito lo solicito para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda esto por aproximación de la época lluviosa.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de hierro, arena, piedra cantera, y cemento.

loans.name: Yine Ecuador

texts.es:
Yine Villacrés de 37 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (su casa esta situada en un lugar muy comercial). Su vivienda es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposa le ayuda en el puesto de comidas ellos tienen 2 hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales.

Yine tiene 15 años con su puesto de comidas, lo empezó en la afueras de su casa (En los lugares populares del Ecuador es muy común que las personas pongan mesas y sillas afuera de su casa para vender comida) con una mesa y unas cuentas sillas. Poco a poco fue incrementando la cliente y obtuvo mas ingresos. 

En la actualidad el esta en el mismo puesto de comidas pero con mas sillas y mas clientela. El plato mas popular que vende es el encebollado (contiene pescados, vegetales, y yucas). Trabaja en conjunto con su esposa desde las 06:00 am. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas, sillas y ollas para su puesto de comidas. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local y poder así comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Yine Villacrés, who is 37 years old, lives in the urban area of Guasmo de Guayaquil. His house is located in a very commercial area. His has a cement home, and he does enjoy all the basic services. His wife helps him in his food stand, and they have two children who attend public school. Yine has had his food stand for 15 years. He started it outside his home with a table and a few chairs. (In the well-known areas of Ecuador, it is quite common that people will put out tables and chairs in front of their homes to sell food). Little by little his costumer base increased, and he earned more income. Currently, he is in the same stand but with more seats and more customers. The most popular plate he sells is "encebollado," (a dish made of fish, vegetables and cassava). He works together with his wife, starting at 6:00 am. With the loan, he wants to purchase tables, chairs and pots for his food stand. In the future, he wants to have his own place of business and to then be able to purchase a car.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tables, chairs and pots

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Héctor (48), que es agricultor, y de sus 7 hijos menores.

La vida en el campo es muy sacrificada, ya que los agricultores deben esforzarse a diario para que sus cosechas no se pierdan. Esto lo sabe muy bien Bertha, quien se despierta cada día desde muy temprano para vigilar sus cultivos de papa y olluco para que las plagas y las condiciones climáticas no malogren su trabajo. A ella le gusta mucho sembrar para que después de varios meses de mucha dedicación logre cosechar y posteriormente vender.
En esta labor trabaja junto a su esposo, ambos se esfuerzan para que la cosecha sea fructífera, aunque dice que cuando la cosecha aumenta mucho contratan operarios para que les ayuden a recoger la producción y limpiar los campos. Para más adelante tiene pensado empezar a sembrar alverja y habas, ya que los precios de estos productos se mantienen estables en el mercado.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Aunque su grupo comunal se ha disminuido, los pocos integrantes que quedan trabajan de manera puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.

Bertha tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, pues quiere asegurar sus tierras para las próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Bertha is 45 years old, lives in her own house along with her farmer husband, Héctor (who is 48), and their 7 young children. Life in the countryside requires many sacrifices and farmers must strive daily to ensure that their crops are not lost. Bertha knows this very well, and she gets up very early every day to guard her crops of potatoes and other root vegetable and make sure that pests and bad weather don't ruin her work. She loves to grow crops because, after some months and much dedication, she can harvest and later sell them. She works alongside her husband in these tasks, and they both strive for a fruitful harvest. However, she says that when the harvest is very large, they hire workers to help them gather the produce and clear the fields. For the future, she is thinking of starting to grow peas and beans as the prices of these products in the market are steady. This is the fourth loan that she has had with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who make this credit available and enable her to keep working. Although her loan group has shrunk, the few remaining members continue to work in a timely way and are responsible about their loan repayments. Bertha plans to use the requested money to buy fertilizer because she wants to prepare her land for the next sowing. .

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Julio Cesar Ramírez A. Trabaja como jardinero en un hotel de playa es padre de un hijo el diario se presenta a su centro de trabajo para realizar las actividades que le asignen algunas veces tiene que hacer turnos de noche para regar las áreas verdes del hotel. El crédito lo solicito para mejoras en su vivienda  y pago de la mano de obra .
texts.en:
El Sr. Julio Cesar Ramírez A. Trabaja como jardinero en un hotel de playa es padre de un hijo el diario se presenta a su centro de trabajo para realizar las actividades que le asignen algunas veces tiene que hacer turnos de noche para regar las áreas verdes del hotel. El crédito lo solicito para mejoras en su vivienda y pago de la mano de obra .

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construcción de su vivienda, Compra de cemento, arena, cerámica, bonder, encalichador, bloques, y mano de obra.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 son menores de edad. 

Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa, olluco y habas con la ayuda de su hijo mayor. Cada día se levanta con los primeros rayos del sol para vigilar y brindar el tratamiento adecuado a sus cultivos. Aunque sabe que el trabajo de campo es arriesgado, debido a los factores climáticos y las plagas que amenazan la producción, se esfuerza por trabajar duro para salir adelante. Cuando llega el tiempo de la cosecha recoge toda su producción y la vende a sus compradores regulares, así obtiene buenas ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente al lado de su familia. Y como es una mujer emprendedora en busca del progreso, para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad e iniciar la siembra de alverja, ya que es un producto de buen precio en el mercado.  

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además dice que el trabajo en su banco comunal marcha bien pues todos los integrantes son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas.

Gladys tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono y semilla de habas para asegurar su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Gladys is 36 years old and lives in her own house alongside her 3 children, two of whom are minors. Since she was very young she has been working in agriculture. With the help of her oldest son, she grows, potatoes, other root vegetables, and beans. Every day she gets up with the first rays of the sun to care for her crops. Although she knows that farming is risky, owing to climatic factors and the pests that threaten her crops, she strives to work hard and be successful. When the harvest time comes she gathers-up all her produce and sells it to regular buyers, and so obtains good profits that enable her to live comfortably with her family. And, as she is an enterprising woman in search of progress, in the future she intends to grow in greater quantity and to start growing peas, which carry a good price in the market. This is the fourth loan that she has had with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who make the loan possible and enable her to continue working. She says that the work of her community bank is going well and all the members are very punctual about making their repayments. Gladys intends to use the requested money to buy fertilizer and seed beans for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to make comforters

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 57 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo Santos (59), quien es agricultor, y D. sus 2 hijos que ya son jóvenes.

DesD. muy pequeña veía como todos los integrantes D. su comunidad se dedicaban a la agricultura, así aprendió las técnicas necesarias D. la siembra. Ha pasado el tiempo y en la actualidad siembra junto a su esposo productos tales como papa, olluco y habas, los cuales luego D. meses D. mucha dedicación y cuidado recoge para vender a los comerciantes mayoristas D. la ciudad. 
A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es lo que mejor sabe hacer y obtiene buenas ganancias, paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. leche fresca, la cual que comercializa a diario, pues tiene 2 vacas que llegan a dar hasta 25 litros D. leche al día. Para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y comprar una vaca más para producir mayor cantidad D. leche.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. También menciona le gusta trabajar con los integrantes D. su banco comunal, pues todos son muy responsables y puntuales en el pago D. sus cuotas.

Juana tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. abono para asegurar sus tierras para las próximas siembras, también comprará pasto para alimentar a sus vacas.
texts.en:
Juana, 57, lives in her own home with her husband Santos (59), who is a farmer, and their 2 children who are still young. From the time she was very small she used to see all of the members of her community working in agriculture. In this way she learned the techniques needed for cultivation. Now much time has passed, and she currently cultivates, along with her husband, products such as potatoes, olluco (an Andean tuber crop), and beans. After many months of dedication and care, she harvests her products to sell to the wholesale traders in the city. She enjoys her work very much, because it is what she does best, and she obtains good earnings. In addition, she sells fresh milk, which she brings to market daily. She has 2 dairy cows that give her up to 25 liters of milk per day. For the future, she has plans to cultivate a larger quantity of plants and to buy another dairy cow so that she can produce a greater quantity of milk. This is the 4th loan that she has taken with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who have maD. this loan possible, a loan that will allow her to continue to work. In addition, she mentions that she likes working with the members of her communal bank, as they are all responsible and punctual with their payments.
