Juana plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of organic fertilizer to maintain her land for the next planting season. In addition, she will buy grass to feed her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and feed for her cows

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su madre y de su pequeño hijo.
Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, recuerda que ayudaba a sus padres en las largas faenas del campo que duraban desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta la tarde. 
En la actualidad siembra papa y olluco sin la ayuda de nadie, sólo cuando aumenta la producción contrata operarios para que la ayuden en el recojo de toda su siembra. 
Generalmente vende todos sus productos a los comerciantes mayoristas que le ofrecen buenos precios, es por esta razón que el negocio le parece rentable y le alcanza para mantener sin problemas a su madre y a su hijo. 
Adicionalmente a esta actividad cría vacas y vende la leche que producen a diario a una planta industrial ubicada en su localidad, lo que le permite percibir un dinero extra. 
Para el futuro tiene planeado comprar más vacas para producir en mayor cantidad, además quiere sembrar más tipos de vegetales para poder ofrecer variedad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible su crédito, el cual le permitirá continuar trabajando. También menciona estar muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, puesto  que todos los integrantes son responsables en el trabajo grupal. 

Juana tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de medicinas para sus vacas, pues no quiere que se enfermen, además comprará los fertilizantes necesarios para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old, and lives in her own home along with her mother and her small son. From the time she was very young she has worked in agriculture. She remembers helping her parents with long labors in the fields that lasted from the first hours of the morning until the evening. Now she plants potatoes and olluco (an Andean root vegetable) without the help of anyone. Only during the harvest time does she hire workers to help her collect the harvest. She usually sells all of her products to the wholesale traders who offer good prices. For this reason her business is profitable, and enables her to support her mother and son without any problems. In addition to this activity, she also raises cows and sells the milk that she produces daily to an industrial plant located in her area. This allows her to earn some extra money. For the future she plans to buy more cows to increase her milk production. In addition, she wants to cultivate more types of vegetables so that she can offer a greater variety of products. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who have made this loan possible, since it allows her to continue working. In addition, she mentions that she is very pleased with the work of her communal bank since all of the members are responsible in the group work. Juana plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of medicines for her cows, because she does not want them to become sick. In addition, she will buy fertilizers needed for her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy medicines for her cows and fertilizers

loans.name: Odalys Mariela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Lomas Del Viento se reúne en la parroquia Andrés de Vera a pocos kilómetros de distancia de la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí.  Odalys  es socia activa de éste banco  hace dos ciclos es soltera tiene 20 años, y trabaja en una granja como vacunadora y estudia en las noches  en la universidad Técnica de Manabí la carrera de administración de empresas. 

El dinero que está solicitando es para invertirlo en la tienda de víveres que tiene en casa de sus padres comprará arroz, azúcar, sal, fideos, atún, bebidas  y artículos de limpieza y aseo personal, nos comenta que ellos le ayudan administrar su tienda porque ella pasa en las granjas. Con el dinero obtenido de los créditos ha logrado comprarse una nevera e ir incrementando su tienda

Odalys quiere hacer realidad el sueño de tener un local de bisutería en el centro de Portoviejo algo  bien surtido.
texts.en:
The “Lomas del Viento” (Hills of the Wind) communal bank meets in Andrés de Vera parish a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo in Manabí province. Odalys, 20, has been an active member of the group for two cycles. She’s single and works on a farm as a vaccinator while going to Manabí Technical University at night majoring in business administration. The funds she is requesting will be used to invest in a grocery store that she has in her parents’ house; she will buy rice, sugar, pasta, tuna, beverages and personal and household cleaning articles. She tells us that her parents help her run the store because she’s always on the farms. With money from past loans she bought a refrigerator and increased her store’s stock. Odalys would like to have her dream of having a well-stocked notions store in downtown Portoviejo come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Ober

texts.es:
Ober tiene 28 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Noemí (27) y de sus 2 menores hijos.
Desde muy joven se dedica a la siembra, conoce muy bien las técnicas necesarias para aprovechar las bondades de la naturaleza y lograr que la tierra produzca sin problemas. 
En la actualidad siembra papa, olluco, alverja y habas en sus chacras que son propias, comenta que le gusta mucho la agricultura pues es un trabajo tranquilo, aunque algo arriesgado por los diversos factores – como las plagas y los cambios climáticos - que amenazan constantemente la siembra. La venta de toda su producción la hace a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona, lo cual le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente. 
Además de esta actividad, se dedica también a la crianza de ganado vacuno y vende leche a diario a una planta industrial ubicada en su comunidad. Y como es un hombre muy emprendedor, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y adquirir algunas cabezas de ganado para aumentar su producción láctea.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Asimismo, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues todos los integrantes han demostrado ser muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. 

Ober tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono e insecticidas para asegurar sus tierras para las próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Ober, 28, lives in his own house with his partner, Noemí, 27, and their two minor children. He has been a farmer since a very young age; he is very knowledgeable of techniques needed to take advantage of nature’s bounty and get the land to produce problem free. He currently farms potato, olluco (an Andean tuber), peas and broad beans on his own farmlands. He tells us that he enjoys farming quite a bit because it’s peaceful work although it can be troublesome sometimes due to pests and climate changes that constantly threaten the crops. He sells his entire crop to wholesalers in the area which produces sufficient profits for him to live comfortably. In addition to this activity, he also raises cattle and sells the daily milk production to an industrial plant located in his community. As he is an enterprising man, he plans in the future to plant larger amounts and acquire additional heads of cattle to increase milk production. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he is very grateful with all the people that made the loan, which will allow him to continue working, possible. Also, he is very satisfied with his communal bank’s work because all the members have been very punctual with their payments. Ober will invest the requested funds in the purchase of manure and insecticides to assure his fields for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Martha Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Maribel Espinosa A.. Es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar, se desempeña como colectora de impuestos de todos los negocios del casco urbano, a diario tiene que caminar para llegar a cada negocio que no ha pagados sus impuestos. Este crédito lo solicito para la compra de todo el techo de su vivienda la cual se encuentra en mal estado por el paso del tiempo. Y de esta manera pasar un invierno sin mojarse.
texts.en:
La Sra. Martha Maribel Espinosa A.. Es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar, se desempeña como colectora de impuestos de todos los negocios del casco urbano, a diario tiene que caminar para llegar a cada negocio que no ha pagados sus impuestos. Este crédito lo solicito para la compra de todo el techo de su vivienda la cual se encuentra en mal estado por el paso del tiempo. Y de esta manera pasar un invierno sin mojarse.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra del techo de mi casa la cual se encuentra en mal estado.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino tiene 26 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus padres y hermanos, aunque tiene 3 hijos menores no vive con ellos porque está separado de su pareja.

Bajo el cálido sol de la selva peruana este hombre agricultor trabaja cada día en busca del progreso. Siembra frutas cítricas y vigila a diario su producción para poder cosechar sin problemas. También es un padre muy preocupado, pues sabe que de la venta de toda su producción depende el bienestar de sus hijos, porque aunque no viva con ellos se esmera  mucho por brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida. La venta de cítricos a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad es un negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y es por eso que está muy satisfecho. La mayor parte del tiempo trabaja solo, pero cuando la producción aumenta contrata operarios que le ayuden en la siembra. 

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. También dice que los integrantes de su banco comunal son muy responsables y trabajadores, es por esta razón que continuará trabajando con ellos.

Sabino tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, ya que quiere asegurar sus tierras antes de  la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Sabino is 26 years old and lives in his own home near his parents and siblings. Although he has three young children, they do not live him because he is separated from his spouse.

Under the hot sun of the Peruvian jungle, Sabino works every day so that he can keep progressing. He plants citrus fruits and monitors his crops daily so that his production will be without problems. Sabino is also a concerned father. He knows that the welfare of his children depends on the sale of his entire crop. Since he does not live with them, he goes to great lengths to provide them an adequate quality of life. Sabino sells his citrus fruits to the wholesalers in the city and is very satisfied with the earnings he is able to generate. Most of the time he works alone, but when production increases, he hires workers to help with the planting.

This is his third loan with MFP. Sabino is extremely grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that he can continue working. He also says that the members of his Communal Bank are very responsible and hardworking. For this reason, he has decided to continue working with them. Sabino plans to invest the money he requested in the purchase of compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his land for the next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertlizers

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Fidel (37), que es agricultor, y de sus 2 pequeños hijos.

Desde muy joven aprendió a cultivar diversidad de frutas, en la actualidad siembra cítricos y plátanos. Aunque es un trabajo algo complicado porque se necesita paciencia y dedicación, sabe que su recompensa será una fructífera cosecha.
Sus productos los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes le ofrecen buenos precios por su mercadería, así puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 
Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una marca reconocida y también obtiene buenas ganancias por este trabajo, está muy satisfecha con ambos negocios porque puede trabajar tranquilamente sin descuidar la crianza de sus hijos. 
Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y poner en marcha otro negocio, pero aun no decido de qué tipo será.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Yeni tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes y plantas de frutos cítricos para asegurar la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Yeni is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Fidel (age 37), who is a farmer, and their two small children.

At a very young age, Yeni learned how to grow different fruits. She currently grows citrus fruits and bananas. Even though her work is complicated because of the patience and dedication that is required, she knows that she will be rewarded with a fruitful harvest. Her products are sold to the wholesale merchants who offer good prices for her merchandise. This allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. At the same time, Yeni sells beauty products of a well-known brand and also earns good income from this work. She is very satisfied with both of her businesses because they allow her to work peacefully without having to neglect her children. Being an enterprising woman, Yeni has plans to produce fruit in greater quantity and also start up another business, but she hasn’t decided what type it will be.

This is her second loan with MFP. Yeni is extremely grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of fertilizers and citrus fruit plants for the next crop season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & citrus fruit plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase scaffolding & merchandise for her store

loans.name: El Halcón Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Halcón lo conforman Cristina del Carmen M., José Isabel Jiménez Díaz y Miriam del Socorro Narváez tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y luchadoras que se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras que varían de acuerdo a la temporada. Ellos desde tempranas horas empiezan sus labores en el mercado de Masaya y terminan a altas horas de la noche acomodando la venta del día siguiente.

Este grupo tiene varios años de trabajar con Adim donde han sido participes tanto de los beneficios financieros como del proceso de capacitación y formación sobre genero y desarrollo empresarial. Ambos servicios les han ayudado mucho comento M., coordinadora del grupo, principalmente porque cuentan con dinero para invertir y el aprendizaje para administrarlo. 
 
Actualmente ellos invertirán en perecederos en flota como mamones, jocotes, aguacate, mango etc.
texts.en:
The group “El Halcón” (The Falcon) consists of Cristina del Carmen M., José Isabel Jiménez Díaz, and Miriam del Socorro Narváez. They are three hardworking, strong, and determined individuals who are in the business of selling fruits and vegetables based on the season. From the early morning hours, they begin their work at the market in Masaya and finish in the late hours of the evening arranging the items they will sell the following day.

This group has been working with ADIM for several years and has reaped the financial benefits of participating in training classes such as gender education and business development. Cristina, the group coordinator, says both services have helped them because they have money to invest and are learning how to manage it.

They currently plan to invest in perishable items in bulk such as “mamoncillos” (a fruit native to the Caribbean and Latin America), plums, avocados, mangoes, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Alma Lila

texts.es: La Sra. Alma Lila C. Méndez es madre de tres hijos, dos en edad escolar, casada , y se dedica  a la ardua labor de profesora de educación primaria, este crédito lo solicito para realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, a diario tiene que viajar ya sea en bicicleta o a pie hasta su centro de trabajo.
texts.en:
La Sra. Alma Lila C. Méndez es madre de tres hijos, dos en edad escolar, casada , y se dedica a la ardua labor de profesora de educación primaria, este crédito lo solicito para realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, a diario tiene que viajar ya sea en bicicleta o a pie hasta su centro de trabajo.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de cemento, zinc, arena y mano de obra.

loans.name: Braulio Group

texts.es:
El grupo Braulio está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, decididas y entusiastas una de ellas es Norma del Socorro Dávila M. de 37 años quien se dedica al comercio de frutas como tamarindo, mango y mamon. En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo e hija quienes le ayudan a vender.

Sus compañeras de grupo son la joven María Evelia Martínez C. quien tiene una pequeña pulpería y Martha Lorena L. G. la cual se dedica a la venta de frutas. Ellas invertirán el préstamo en productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
The Braulio Group consists of three hardworking, determined, and enthusiastic women. One of them is Norma del Socorro Dávila M. who is 37 years and sells fruit such as tamarind, mangoes, and “mamoncillos” (a fruit native to the Caribbean and Latin America). She works at her business with her husband and daughter, who help with making sales.

Her fellow group members are María Evelia Martínez C., a young woman who has a small grocery store, and Martha Lorena L. G., who sells fruit. They will invest their loan in the purchase of products for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits

loans.name: Francisco Eremi

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Eremi de 47 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Haydee Mejía, tiene 4 hijos: El mayor de 19 años de nombre estudia segundo año de su carrera universitaria y además colabora en las actividades de su pequeña parcela, Yudelsi segundo año de secundaria, Sadrach tercer grado de primaria, y Samir el menor de 3 años de edad,  doña Haydee trabaja como docente en colonia los Laureles apoyando con los gastos familiares. Francisco desde hace 10 años labora como docente en colonia los Laureles como maestro educacion de primaria y secundaria, se recibio de Licenciado en Español y ademas es Ingeniero Agronomo.  

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de construir anexo en su casa de habitacion para ampliar y  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, pero no cuenta con los recursos economicos necesarios para llevar a cabo dicha obra, por lo que  esta solicitando su 1er credito pues a la institucion esperando que le apolle para hacer realidad su sueño.   

El mayor sueño de don Francisco es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y personas de bien que ayuden a sacar adelante el pais.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco Eremi is 47 years old and married to Sra. Haydee Mejía. They have four children. The oldest child is 19 years old, a second-year university student, and also helps with the activities on their small plot of land. Yudelsi is a second-year high school student. Sadrach is a third grade elementary school student. Young Samir is three years old. Doña Haydee works as a teacher in the Laureles subdivision and helps with the family expenses. Francisco has worked ten years as a teacher in the Laureles subdivision at both the elementary and secondary levels. He recently received a degree in Spanish and is also an agricultural engineer.

He currently needs to build an extension to his house in order to expand and improve the living conditions of his family. However, he does not have the financial resources to carry out the work, so he is requesting his first loan from the Institution in hopes of realizing his dream.

Don Francisco’s greatest wish is to see his children develop into professionals and good people who will help the country move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an extension to his house

loans.name: Pastora Walquiria

texts.es: La Sra. Pastora Walquiria Sánchez Pérez, se desempeña como profesora de educación secundaria, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, los créditos que ha solicitado han sido para la mejora de su vivienda, por que esta es la única manera  de hacer este tipo de actividad  ya que estas  instituciones dan financiamiento considerando los ingresos de la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
La Sra. Pastora Walquiria Sánchez Pérez, se desempeña como profesora de educación secundaria, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, los créditos que ha solicitado han sido para la mejora de su vivienda, por que esta es la única manera de hacer este tipo de actividad ya que estas instituciones dan financiamiento considerando los ingresos de la unidad familiar.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de bloques, piedra cantera, hierro, cemento y mano de obra.

loans.name: Concepción Group

texts.es:
El grupo Concepción está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y emprendedoras quienes llevan varios años trabajando con Adim. La coordinadora es la señora Alma Nubia M. C. quien desde hace quince años se dedica al comercio de zapatos en el cual invertirá el préstamo.  

Sus compañeras de grupo son Gladys Johana V. R. comerciantes de zapatos desde hace ocho años y Rosa Argentina S. Orosco desde hace 20 años tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos.
texts.en:
The Concepción Group consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising women who have been working with ADIM for several years. The coordinator is Sra. Alma Nubia M. C., who has been selling shoes for fifteen years and will invest her loan in more inventory.

Her fellow group members are Gladys Johana V. R., who has been selling shoes for eight years, and Rosa Argentina S. Orosco, who has been operating a “fritanga” (a popular type of restaurant that sells fried foods) for twenty years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay to retain her calves

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el sector Molino El Carmen del distrito de Motupe, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como agricultor desde hace cuatro años, empezó trabajando junto a su padre y ha ganado experiencia poco a poco, su padre ha creido conveniente que ya puede trabajar solo en la siembra de maíz y le ha cedido una pequeña parcela de terreno para que la trabaje, de ese modo el ya puede percibir sus propios ingresos; el ha instalado hace algunos dias maíz y su cultivo ya empezó a desarrollarse.

Julio se encuentra emocionado y bastante contento con la actividad que está realizando, el desea asegurarse una buena producción y ha decidido aplicar fertilizantes y pesticidas a su cultivo para que el maíz se desarrolle correctamente, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Julio es un joven responsable y emprendedor. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para adquirir su propio terreno, las personas que lo conocen lo consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza. En la imagen nos muestra  su cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Julio is 27 years old, single, and lives with his family in the Molino El Carmen sector of the District of Motupe, which is part of Lambayeque Province. This area is located 1½ hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Julio has been a farmer for four years. He began working with his father and gradually gained experience. His father thought he was ready to begin work on his own, so he gave him a small parcel of land so that he could begin planting his own crops. Julio is now able to generate his own income. Just a few days ago, he began planting a crop of corn.

Julio is excited and quite happy with the work he is doing. He wants to make sure that he has a good production, so he decided to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to apply to his crop of corn so that it develops properly. Julio does not have enough capital to achieve this goal, so he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

He is a responsible and enterprising young man. His greatest wish is to continue working so that he can acquire his own land. The people who know Julio consider him to be a peaceful and reliable individual. In the photograph, he is standing in his field of newly planted corn.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & pesticides to maintain his crop of corn

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Ana está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Ana Belki U. C. quien se dedica  aproximadamente hace más de ocho años a la venta de cosa de horno. Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de esta este tradicional bocadillo.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Martha Lorena M. G. quien vende cosa de horno, ornado hecho a base de maíz y Carla Patricia A. desde niña se dedica a producir y vende dulces tradicionales como arroz de leche, atolillo, pilloquinto y cosa de horno.
texts.en:
The Santa Ana Group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Sra. Ana Belki U. C., who has been selling baked goods for more than eight years. She will use her loan to buy traditional snacks. The other group members are Martha Lorena M. G., who sells baked goods made of corn, and Carla Patricia A., who has been producing and selling sweets since she was a young girl. Her products include rice pudding, corn custard, rum cake, and other baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baked goods

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es: Norlan Antonio de 28 años de edad, es casado con la joven Maritza Borge con quien procreo 2 niños: el mayor de 7 años estudiando la primaria y el menor de 3 añitos. Gracias a la experiencia que ha tenido trabajando con su papá ahora se desarrolla como pequeño ganadero del municipio de Santo Domingo, Chontales, donde tiene su pequeño inventario de ganado, sin embargo, esta luchando para aumentar su inventario ganadero por lo que esta solicitando su 3er credito para compar terneros y desarrollarlos y engordarlos para posteriormente venderlos a un buen precio que le permita obtener ganancias que le ayuden a mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar.  El mayor sueño que tiene Norlan es tener la oportunidad de contar con recursos que le permitan darle a sus hijos estudios para que sean hombres de bien, y dejarles un buen patrimonio para que puedan mantenerse con un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Norlan Antonio, 28, is married to Maritza Borge and they have two children; the oldest, 7, is in elementary school and the youngest is 3 years old. Thanks to the experience gained working with his father, he’s now cattleman in Santo Domingo, Chontales. He has a small herd of cattle but he’s working towards increasing its size. This is the reason behind his 3rd loan request: to buy calves to raise for future sale at a good price that will help him improve his family’s living conditions. Norlan’s greatest wish is to have resources sufficient to provide an education for his children so that they will become upstanding citizens and to leave them a good equity so that they will maintain a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a crafts course and to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Don Gustavo  de 60 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Maria Auxiliadora Valverde y es padre de familia de 3 hijos, uno trabaja y estan estudiando secundaria y la universidad.  Gustavo labora como guarda de seguridad para MINSA Juigalpa  desde hace 3 años, esta solicitando su 3er credito para levantar una pared interna de 10 mts y hacer la division de los dormitorios de su casa para de esta manera contar con mayor privacidad. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar su vivienda poco a poco y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia para asi brindarles mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Don Gustavo is 60 years old and married to Maria Auxiliadora Valverde. He is the father of three children one who works and the others who are attending high school and university. Gustavo works as a security guard for MINSA (the Ministry of Health) in Juigalpa which he has been doing for three years. He is asking for his third loan to erect a wall inside his house to divide two rooms to achieve greater privacy. His main goal is to improve his home little by little and improve the quality of life for his family and offer them greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: erect a wall between two rooms

loans.name: Juana Marina

texts.es:
Juana tiene 35 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a su hermano y a su hijo de 11 años de edad en el distrito de Guadalupe, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de cabinas de internet (internet café) y videojuegos (play station) desde hace mas de un año. Ella brinda su servicio a los escolares y jóvenes de la zona durante todo el día; el negocio goza de muy buena acogida ya que son muy pocas las viviendas que gozan de este servicio en el distrito y actualmente Internet facilita a los estudiantes una fuente amplia de información con la que pueden complementar sus trabajos escolares.

Juana se encuentra contenta con la acogida que tiene su negocio y se esfuerza diariamente para que este salga adelante ya que de el depende el sostenimiento de su familia. La creciente demanda con la que cuenta su negocio ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarlo con la compra de otra computadora, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Juana es una madre de familia responsable y entregada a los suyos, su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio para hacer progresar a su familia. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Juana, 35, is separated and lives with her 11-year-old son and her brother in Guadalupe district, Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She has had an Internet café and play station for over a year. She offers her services to students and youngsters of the area all day. The business is well-received because there are few households in the district that enjoy this service and Internet is very useful to students for it is an extensive source of information that they can use to complement their school work. Juana is very happy with the reception her business has had and daily strives to have it succeed since it is her family’s source of support. The growing demand her services have had has inspired her to think of enlarging it buying an additional computer. This has motivated her to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal. Juana is a responsible mother who is dedicated to her loved ones; her greatest wish is to continue to expand her business so that her family can progress. People who know her consider her to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra Maria es casada con el Sr. Julio Castilla con quien tiene 6 hijos, el mayor tiene 28 años y el menor 12. Todos habitan en la Comarca La Palma del municipio de Tecolostote.  Es comerciante de leche la que ademas procesa y obtiene crema, queso y cuajadas las que vende a las personas de su comunidad. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar.  Esta solicitando su primer credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, reparando una pared que se encuentra en mal estado, y de esta manera brindar a su familia mayor seguridad.  El mayor sueño de Sandra es poder tener una vivienda digna con las condiciones basicas para que su familia se sienta comoda.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is married to Julio Castilla; they have 6 children ranging from 28 to 12 years of age. They all live in La Palma, Tecolostote municipality. She is a milk merchant but also produces cream, cheese and cuajadas (a type of white cheese) for sale to her neighbors. Her husband helps out by providing for household expenses. She is asking for her first loan for home improvements; she wants to repair a wall that is damaged so that her family can have better security. Sandra’s greatest wish is to have a home that is proper with basic conditions for her family to feel comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To erect a wall.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Petronila Peña D. 49 años D. edad, es una D. las 7 integrantes D. la Alcancía Renacer que viene trabajando con Edaprospo Prosperidad desD. hace  5 meses, es casada y tiene 3 hijos  (2 mayores y  uno D. 14 años)
Se inicio con  el negocio D. venta D. ropa en forma ambulatoria y a pedidos desD. hace 10 años, y como no era suficiente el ingreso con el que contaba en ese entonces, decidió hacer otro  tipo D. negocio, dedicarse a la  preparación  y venta D.  tamales en su domicilio  desD. hace 4 y al ver que su ingreso iba mejorando decidió en invertir algo mas  en ella y fue entonces que por intermedio D. sus vecinas  que la  invitaron a participar en su alcancía obtuvo su primer préstamo el cual lo invirtió  en la compra  D.  insumos  para la preparación D. tamales (maíz, hoja D. plátano, pollo, y otros).
Su préstamo actual  lo invertirá en la compra D. una cocina industrial y claro está en mas ingredientes para la preparación D. sus tamales.
La meta que tiene en mente   y que viene persiguiendo,  ya desD. hace mucho tiempo es la compra  D. una moledora eléctrica, en lograr la apertura D.  una juglería  en una zona transcurrida por el público.
 Su  anhelo mayor es seguir  apoyando  a su  menor hijo en sus estudios tanto secundario  como Superior.
texts.en:
Petronila Peña, 49, is one of Renacer (To be Reborn) communal bank’s seven members who have been collaborating with Edaprospo Prosperidad for the last 5 months; she is married and has three children (two adults and one 14-year-old). She started out selling clothing door-to-door and via prior orders 10 years ago. Because this didn’t produce sufficient income she decided to open a second business: sale of home-maD. tamales. She has been in this second line of work for 4 years and, as her income increased, she decided to invest more into it. Thanks to an invitation to join the bank extended by some of her neighbors, she obtained her first loan which she used to buy ingredients for the tamales: corn, banana leaves, chicken, etc. Her current loan will be used to buy an industrial stove and, of course, more ingredients for tamale preparation. The goal she has in mind now and has had for a long time now and that she continues to strive for is to have an electric juicer and to open a juice bar in an area with lots of foot traffic. Her greatest wish is to continue to support her youngest son’s secondary and university education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an industrial stove and ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the roof and doors.

loans.name: Erling Alexander

texts.es: Erling Alexander habitante de Nueva Guinea es casado con la joven Neysi con quien tiene un niño pequeño. Desde muy pequeño se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de taxis en este municipio, actividad que le enseño su papá  quien trabajaba en esta misma actividad. Ademas realizar viaje a San Carlos en donde obtiene ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.  Está solicitando su 1er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC  para realiza mejora a su taxi,  para asi brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida  y que a su hijo no le falte nada y que cuando sea grande pueda coronar una carrera que le permita trabajar. Erling se caracteriaza por ser muy responsable  y honesto.
texts.en:
Erling Alexander lives in Nueva Guinea, he is married to Neysi and they have a small child. From a young age he drove taxis in his municipality; he was taught to drive by his father who also works as a taxi driver. He also travels to San Carlos where he gets additional income to sustain his family. Erling is asking for his first loan with AFODENIC (Kiva’s field partner) to make repairs to his taxi and so that he can give better service to his customers. His biggest dream is to be able to give his family better living conditions, that his son will not need anything and that when he is older he can have a career that will allow him to work. Erling is characterized by being very responsible and honest.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his taxi.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane J. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Mary Jane is single. To make a living, Mary Jane owns a specialized retail store in which the main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month .

In 2009, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jorelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jorelyn A. is from the city of Canlangan Tangub City. She is 38 years old. Jorelyn is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. Jorelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jorelyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and banana for sale. Jorelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

loans.name: Osita

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur is an active Barangay official from Silangit, Tangub City. Mrs.Osita R. is a Barangay Councilor, 53 years of age, married and blessed with 4 children, 2 young adults and 2 teenagers. Her husband earns an income as a “jabal-jabal” (single motor vehicle for hire) driver. Although he earns an average income of 150 PHP a day, it is not enough to support the family and that is why Mrs. R. undoubtedly engaged in business. She opened up a little sari-sari store and for 2 years she has been able to sustain her business. She is now earning an average net income of 1,500 PHP a month. With good luck, she was also elected as a Barangay Councilor and earns an average honorarium of 3,000 PHP a month, which is so helpful.

With her good reputation in Barangay and her good credit repayment record, Mrs. R. was given the privilege to obtain a first loan of 5,000 PHP. She is now applying for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to add to her capital for her sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to meet the family's daily needs, for loan repayment and for savings. Mrs. R. is hoping that someday her children will finish their studies right up to college, for their good future.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma A. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in her general store and tricycle business. She lives in Barangay Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her 46-year-old husband, Eusebio, who drives their own tricycle.  They have 3 adult children who are between 16-26 years old.

Thelma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and tricycle business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $140.

She is now borrowing 15,000 PHP for the operations of her general store and tricycle business. This will be her 16th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Thelma aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal working capital

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosita C. is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her husband is a driver and her daughter works in Manila. Mrs. C. is a PDP_LP member and she manages a piggery business. She has operated her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it. Mrs. C. joined PMPC to gain access to financial help to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used for the expansion of her business. She is now requesting a new loan, her 5th, of 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feed and piglets.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion T. is a 47-year-old married woman with sevem children who lives in Sitio Macasayang, Barangay Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Asuncion has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for one year now and earns a living by running a sugarcane plantation, a general store and a buy-and-sell rice business.		
		
She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.	
	
About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit.  To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients.  In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   
		
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase solar lantern

Emma joined PMPC to gain access for financial support and to engaged in other business activities. Having fully repaid her previous loan of 10000 that used to expand her business, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 12000 to purchase additional items.

loans.name: Nadeeka

texts.en:
Nadeeka is a 26-year-old married woman living with her husband and one child in the town of Hikkaduwa in the Galle district of Sri Lanka.

Nadeeka has a granite workshop, working as a team with her husband.  Her husband delivers granite with his own lorry. They have lots of experience with this type of business since they have been doing it for five years.

Now she has requested a 40,000-LKR loan to maintain and expand her workshop. 

Nadeeka started this business as a small one, but it is growing and now in need of further capital.  She considers herself to be honest and hardworking, to which she attributes her success.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.name: Anusha

texts.en:
Anusha is a 41-year-old married woman living in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. She and her husband have two kids. Her husband is a soldier in the army, while Anusha is collecting coir (coconut fibers used in many household items) and re-selling it. She started her business two years ago and is a very honest woman who likes to work hard.  

Anusha has requested a 30,000-LKR loan from BRAC to buy more coir. Currently she does not have the financial capital necessary to grow.

Ultimately she hopes to use her additional income to help pay for her children’s education.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.name: Chithra

texts.en:
Chithra is a 43-year old woman living with her sister in the town of Hikkaduwa in southern Sri Lanka.  Chithra is divorced and has no children.

Chithra makes carpets, a business she started after the devastating tsunami in 2004.  Chithra hopes to be a self-sufficient woman, as she lost everything in the tsunami and is working hard to support herself.

Chithra has requested a 30,000-LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka, which she will use to buy a new machine to improve her carpet business.  This will be her third loan from BRAC to supply capital for the carpet business and she hopes to continue to see success.  She is appreciative of BRAC providing her a loan to help her expand her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.name: Nella

texts.en: Nella T. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Nella is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Nella owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nella has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Nella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nella is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Nella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mitina

texts.en:
Mitina N. is a hardworking businesswoman. She is 30 years old with only two children, one of whom is going to school. She has a clothing business located in Masaka town Kikubo (Ssemwogerere building). She has been running this kind of business for over eight years. 

Nassuna is using the loan to purchase clothes from Kampala to Nyendo. She wants to purposely expand on her business by purchasing more party dresses, suits for ladies, trousers and tops, among other items. Her future hopes are to prosper and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase clothes (party dresses, suits for ladies, trousers, tops, etc.)

loans.name: Mallorina

texts.en:
Mallorina C. is a 56-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Sitio Macasayang, Barangay Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Mallorina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for two years now and earns a living by running a general store business.		
			
She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.		


About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit.  To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients.  In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also functions as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   
		
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase of a solar lantern

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma B. is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in Prk Banaba, Brgy Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling food and herbal products.

Wilma’s 45-year-old husband, Ronnie, is a farmer. They have 10 children who are between 5 and 22 years old. Four of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. The other six children work to help the family.

Wilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of their family's life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by selling food and herbal products. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000 from her business activities.

Wilma is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 was used to fund operations of her business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her twentieth cycle loan, PHP 15,000, which she intends to use for her business of selling food and herbal products. Wilma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her business selling food and herbal products

loans.name: Madiama

texts.fr: Monsieur Madiama D. habite a Yoff mais il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Ouakam depuis l’année dernière. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur au sein de l’institution.  Il est âgé de 51 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants. Il s’active dans le domaine de l’élevage et du commerce de moutons. Il a une expérience de 7 ans dans cette activité qu’il a choisie par passion  depuis son enfance. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs destine a l’achat de moutons qu’il va revendre. Son premier crédit lui a permis  d’avancer dans ses activités et d’atteindre une capacité de faire face à ses charges  de chef de  famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Madiama D. lives in Yoff, but he has been member of the UIMCEC credit union in Ouakam since last year. He has already benefitted from an earlier loan. He is 51 years old, married and the father of two children. He raises sheep for resale. He has had seven years of experience in this business, to which he has been attracted since childhood. He is seeking a loan of 400,000 West African francs in order to purchase sheep for resale. His previous loan allowed him to grow his business and to achieve a sales volume which is necessary in view of his family responsibilities.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering the business capital

loans.name: Creslie

texts.en:
Creslie V. is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Coloso Subd. Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in the following businesses: a general store, vegetable vending and a boarding house.

Creslie’s 46-year-old husband, Pablito, buys and sells spices. They have four children who are between 1 and 14 years old. Two of them currently go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Creslie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of their family's life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income through her businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000 from her business activities.

Creslie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, vegetable sales, and boarding house. The loan had a positive impact on both the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her eighteenth cycle loan, PHP 28,000, which she intends to use on her businesses: her general store, vegetable vending and her boarding house. Creslie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina B. is a 59-year-old married woman who lives in Prk. Narra, Brgy Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living from her eatery, and also as an itinerant vendor.

Cristina’s 63-year-old husband, Aram, is a laborer on a sugarcane plantation.  They have six children who are between 17 and 34 years old. Three of them are raising their own families, while the other three work to help their parents.

Cristina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of their family's life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through her eatery and her vending sales. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000 from her business activities.

Cristina is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 was used to fund operations of her eatery and her vending sales. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 23rd cycle loan, PHP 12,000, which she intends to use on her eatery business. Cristina is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for eatery

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou D. est une femme de 51 ans sociétaire de la caisse de Ouakam et qui habite dans la même localité. Elle a un an d’ancienneté dans l’institution et a déjà bénéficié d’an prêt antérieur. Elle est parent bénéficiaire, mariée  et mère de 8 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce et la vente de légumes et de charbon de bois. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de charbon de bois destine a la revente. Depuis un certain temps elle a note l’augmentation de la demande et son but est de satisfaire la commande des boutiquiers qui sollicitent de plus en plus ce produit. Pour madame D. ses bénéfices lui permettent de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et d’assurer la dépensé quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou D. is a 51-year old woman, who is a shareholder-member of the Oukam savings bank and who lives in the same town. She has been with the bank for a year and has already had one loan. She is a parent member, married and mother to eight children. She is active in trading and selling vegetables and charcoal. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs which will be used for the purchase of charcoal destined to be resold. For some time she has noticed an increase in demand, and her aim is to satisfy the orders of shop owners who are increasingly asking for this product. Mrs. D.'s profits allow her to pay for her children's schooling and to cover daily expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of funds

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred A., age 38, supports her family by running an eatery and by buying and selling livestock. She lives in Brgy Bantayan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Levy, age 39, who works as a security guard, and their three children. Their youngest child is two years old and the two older children are attending school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her eatery and through the purchase and sale of livestock, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 5,800.

Mildred is now borrowing Php 11,500 so that she can continue her two business endeavors. This will be her nineteenth loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 9,500, which she paid off well within its term, served as another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mildred aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. ("Dungganon" is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda G. is a 52 year old married woman who supports her family by selling water and shrimps, and via her pig fattening business. She lives in Sto. Catali, Brgy Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her 54 year old husband and their children. Her husband Jerrry is a farmer. They have 5 children between 20 and 30 years old; 2 of them have their own family, while the rest are working to help the family. 

Rhoda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 18,000. 

Rhoda is now borrowing Php 29,500 so that she can use it as an additional working capital for her businesses. This will be her 17th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rhoda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way. In the picture you see Rhoda with her water container.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. is a 31 year old married woman who supports her family by producing juice and buying and selling livestock. She lives in Prk Daisy, Brgy Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her 40 year old husband, Jose Erlito, who helps his wife deliver the finished product.They have 4 children who are between the ages of 4 and 11 years old.

Victoria has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 17,000.

Victoria is now borrowing Php 11,500 so that she can expand her businesses. This will be her 6th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 10,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Victoria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.

loans.use: For additional business capital

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie S. is a 52 year old widow who supports her family by engaging in a general store and farming business. She lives in Brgy Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her 5 children who are between 13 and 30 years old; 3 of her children have their own families, while the other 2 children are currently attending school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Winnie is now borrowing Php 19,500 so that she can expand her general store. This will be her 17th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Winnie aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.

loans.use: To buy additional product to sell

loans.name: Sharlene Margie

texts.en:
Sharlene Margie V. is a 36-year old married woman who lives in Sawangan Brgy Libacao, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living from her general store business. Sharlene’s husband, Ernesto V. Jr., is a security guard. They have 3 children who are between 1 and 12 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Sharlene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 9,000 from her business activities.

Sharlene is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 20,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and had a positive impact in both the business and her family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 11th cycle loan in the amount of Php 18,000, which she intends to use for her general store. Sharlene is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which include providing them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn M. is a 31-year old married woman who lives in Prk Kalubihan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her general store and sugarcane plantation businesses. Ailyn’s husband, Eriberto Sr., is a tricycle driver. They have 2 young children who are between 3 and 9 years old. One child is currently going to school and also helps in the business as part of their daily chores.

Ailyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and sugarcane plantation businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000.

Ailyn is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 22,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store, and had a positive impact in both the business and her family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan in the amount of Php 24,000, which she intends to use for her general store and sugarcane plantation. Ailyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which include providing them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: For additonal working capital

loans.name: Blanca Sixta

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 52 años D. edad, es separada y vive junto a sus tres hijos en el distrito D. Mochumí, un distrito cuya principal actividad económica es la agricultura, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia D. Lambayeque, a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace 29 años a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes, cerveza y frutas en su domicilio, el negocio siempre goza D. muy buena acogida debido a que se encuentra ubicado cerca al mercado del distrito. Este negocio es su unica fuente D. sustento económico, por lo que ella trata D. mantenerlo ofreciendo productos D. buena calidad y buen trato a sus clientes.

Blanca desea captar mas clientes para poder crecer como empresaria y brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida, por ello desea comprar más mercadería que le permitan ampliar su negocio, ella se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Blanca es una mujer alegre y D. trato amable, su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad D. estudiar una carrera superior que les permita asegurarse un futuro prometedor. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran alguien responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Blanca is 52 years old, she is separated and lives with her 3 children in the Mochumí district, the main economic activity is agriculture, and it is near the Lambayeque province some 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 29 years, she has sold basic household goods, groceries, beer and fruits in her home. The business always has a good customer base since it is located near the market district. The business is her only source of income and she tries to keep it by offering quality products and kind treatment to her customers.

Blanca wishes to have more customers to be able to grow as an entrepreneur and give her children a better quality of life. It is because of this that she wishes to buy more merchandize that will allow her to expand her business. This is her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles that will allow her to meet her goals.

Blanca is a very happy and good-natured woman. Her biggest wish is to give her children the opportunity to study a career that will allow them to ensure a promising future. Her neighbors and people, who know her, consider Blanca to be a responsible and hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize to increase her business.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr: -Madame Ndeye G. est une ancienne societaire de la caisse de Ouakam qui a déjà rembourse 9 prêts antérieurs. Elle a neuf ans d’ancienneté au sein de l’institution. Elle est célibataire mais très dynamique et s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle gère une cantine bien place dans le quartier de Taglou ou elle vit et cette cantine est située  non loin de chez elle. C’est une rue très fréquentée et elle vend des produits alimentaires et du petit déjeuner. Mademoiselle G. a choisi cette activité pour éviter le chômage et disposer de revenus avec lesquels elle parviendra a subvenir a ses propres besoins.  Aussi l’aspect qui l’intéresse le plus c’est le contact avec la clientèle et la  qualité  des relations sociales qu’elle noue avec elle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs destine d’une part  a l’achat de produits pour sa cantine et d’autre part pour l’achat de 2 appareils portables dans le but de se lancer a la commercialisation de crédit téléphonique en détail. Son objectif est de mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce et accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye G. is a long-time member of the Ouakam branch and already reimbursed nine previous loans. She has nine years’ seniority within the institution. She is unmarried, very dynamic and has been commercially active for over ten years. She runs a well-situated cantina in the Taglou neighbourhood, not far from where she lives. The street is very busy and she sells food products and breakfasts. Ms. G. chose this activity to avoid unemployment and dispose of income with which she can meet her own needs. The most interesting aspect of her activity is the contact with her customers and the social relations she is able to establish with them. She is requesting a 200,000 FCFA loan in part to buy products for her cantina, but also to buy two mobile phones in order to start a retail business for phone credit cards. Her aim is to improve the return of her commercial activity and increase her income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen working capital

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mocumí, una zona netamente agrícola donde predominan los cultivos de maíz y arroz, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde que era joven a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio, en la zona la mayoría de mujeres se dedican a esta actividad con la finalidad de apoyar a sus esposos en el sostenimiento del hogar. Martina cría aves de corral y cerdos en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta vivos (a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona, en el caso de las aves) o sacrificados ( a sus vecinos, en el caso de los cerdos). Ella es ayudada por su hija en las labores de crianza.

Martina desea ampliar su negocio para poder captar mas ingresos y poder salir adelante, por ello desea adquirir más animales y sus respectivos alimentos con los cuales puedan desarrollarse favorablemente, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Martina es una mujer hogareña y que trabaja siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, ella también ayuda a su esposo en las labores de siembra, el sueño que ambos comparten es hacer mejoras en las vivienda en donde viven , ya que esta construida de material rustico.
texts.en:
Martina is 43 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the Muy Finca area of the district of Mocumi. This is primarily an agricultural area where corn and rice are the main crops. It's located in the Lambayeque province which is an hour outside of Chiclayo. Since she was young, she has raised and sold small animals from her house. In this area, most of the women do the same in order to help their husbands support the family. Martina raises poultry and pigs at home and sells the poultry, live, to the retailers who visit her area, or the sacrificed pigs to her neighbors. Her daughter helps her raise them. Martina would like to grow her business to be able to earn more money and get ahead. She would, therefore, like to buy more animals and their feed so they can grow heartily. Following her objective, she finds it necessary to take out her first loan. of 800 soles. from "Edpyme Alternativa." Martina is a woman who loves her home and always works thinking of her family's well being. She also helps her husband with his planting. They both dream of making some improvements to their home since it's built with rustic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purhase animals and feed to grow their business of raising animals and selling them.
